name: Star Wars Episode I: War
description: RISK in the "Star Wars" universe. The "War" in the title is how Risk is called in Brazil. In essence, it is the same game, with planets as territories. Apart from the map being as seen in a mirror, the only difference in its layout is an extra link between two planets. For some obscure reason, the game is limited to four players - maybe because they ran out of cool colors, as they used black, white, gold and silver.
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Ting-A-Ling Bingo
description:
This children's game is based on bingo, but replaces the customary numbers and letters with pictures of everyday objects. Also, each bingo card has every picture so all players have something to do each turn. The pictures are randomized through the use of a spinner. The spinner has a built-in musical chime sound mechanism which is pleasing to the ear.

Since all cards have all pictures, play is fast and easy. A recommended variation lengthens the game by having each player spin only for themsleves.

Ages 4-8.

name: Tiles
description: Game equipment consists of 72 letter tiles (color-coded to indicate vowel, common consonant, or less-common consonant) and two frames. Each frame holds 19 letter tiles in an array of four interlocking words, of 4, 5, 6 and 7 letters; the frames can be rotated and flipped to form 16 different patterns. A player draws 19 to 25 tiles (depending on desired level of difficulty), balancing the colors to get a good mix of letters, and tries to form words in the frame. Can be played solitaire or competitively.

name: Magefire
description:
Fantasy board/card game in which the players are wizards fighting for control of an arena whose concentric circles yield progressively greater magic power. (There is also a very strong source of power that moves randomly around the board.) Wizards can make direct physical attacks on one another, cast offensive or movement spells (using two shared Fate decks -- cheaper and weaker Primary Fate cards and stronger and more expensive Secondary Fate cards), or summon elementals to fight on their behalf. The last player with a wizard or elemental left in the arena wins.

The approximate playing time is a guess and will probably depend on the number of players and their temperament.

The designer created this game when he was a sophomore at Booker T. Washington High School in Tulsa, OK.

name: Circulation: An Incredible Journey
description:
An oddity in every sense of the word. Players move 'plasma trays' through the arteries and veins to supply the arms, legs and head with 'food' and 'oxygen' while disposing of 'waste', warding off 'germ attacks' and controlling 'emergency situations'. Both an interesting game, an oddity, a rarity and an education. 2 to 4 players. Ages 10 & up. Teaching Concepts from 1978.

INCLUDES: Gameboard, 130 die-cut counters (30 Food, 30 Gaseous Waste, 30 Renal Waste, 30 Oxygen & 10 WBC), 18 Emergency cards, 15 Circulate cards, 4 'Plasma' trays (small cups), 4 score boards, spinner & instructions.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Der WÃ¼stentruck
description: Players race from the pyramids of Giza to an oasis in the desert. Dependent upon how many play, you may control from 1 - 3 trucks. Gasoline is precious, and sabotage is sure to happen. Players can choose between following shorter more treacherous routes or longer routes with petrol stations positioned along them.

name: Triple Play
description: The object of the game is for a player to score ten "triple plays" by filling 10 triangles on the center wheel with marbles. Players try to accomplish this task while the center wheel rotates.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Arms Race
description:
Subtitled "Simulation of Global War and Strategic Building 1950-2001"

Description from Nicholas Palmer's book The Comprehensive Guide to Board Wargaming (Sphere 1980): Arms Race has the USA and USSR (and China in a three-player version) slugging it out from 1950 to 2001 with armor, infantry, fighters, bombers, spy satellites, U-2s, guerrillas, transports, subversive political groups, secret foreign services, extensive production rules, and the threat of nuclear war.

Players: two to four (The basic game is for two or three, but an expansion kit which is actually an extra sheet of counters and a half-page scenario description allows for a Germany that survived WW II).
Period: postwar
Time scale: seasonal
Ground scale: about 600 miles to the inch?
Unit scale: abstract - army corps?; naval fleet; air force

Components (review copy included the expansion kit)

1 - cover page with goofy ray-gun art, unit cost chart on back
1 - six-page rules booklet
1 - unit identification chart
3 - unit production charts
1 1/2 - pages of scenarios
5 - sheets of counters with crude artwork
2 - 17x19" area-movement maps that mate to show the whole world, very crudely drawn and badly printed.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Trading Card Game
description:
From publisher:
Upper Deck Entertainment and Konami Corporation present the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Trading Card Game! This awesome new Trading Card Game is based on the all new TV series showing on Fox Box and the Cartoon Network. Leonardo, Donatello, Raphael, and Michelangelo, with their master and friends, Splinter, April, and Casey Jones, battle against the villainous forces of the Shredder, Hun, Baxter Stockman, and the Foot Clan.

Gameplay is fast and furious. Use characters, weapons, and various martial arts moves to get past your opponent's blocks and cause him to deck out.

Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles TCG features:
- The coolest martial arts brought to you from Japan! Learn fighting moves like the Blue Dragon, Shinku Throw, Rekka, and Chimera.
- Fast games with a brand-new game design. You have to think smart and have guts to out-fight your opponent.
- Two-player starter set contains 2 decks. Everything you need to play!
- Holo-foil card in every booster pack.
- Future sets will include the Mystic Ninjas and Shredder's Elite Guard, plus many other characters and brand new weapons and martial arts.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting

name: Beakman's World Beakmania Game
description:
(From the box)
Based on the hit TV show that stars The Umpire of Understanding himself, this game features over 300 Beakmania questions (and answers!) and five great ways to take the Beakman Challenge!

The object (you know, the goal of the game!): be the first player to collect 7 beakers from the lab. ("How?" you may ask.) Land on a Beakmania space and answer a question correctly! Meet up with Lester and maybe he'll help you get one! (But do not step on his tail...)
categories: Action / Dexterity, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Intrigue
description:
(From the inside box cover)

Intrigue is a fascinating game involving foreign agents, secret information and "murder." The action takes place aboard an ocean liner tied up at an American seaport. A diplomat courier has been murdered, and his briefcase, containing secret papers, has been stolen and hidden in one of the staterooms.'

'The object of the game is to be the FIRST DETECTIVE to locate the stolen briefcase and take possession of it. Clues are obtained by searching the staterooms and meeting opponents in the passageways of the ship.'

name: Farben Yatzy
description:
Die rolling meets Speed: First a card with several colored circles is drawn. 8 pyramidic dice with different colored balls on the corners are rolled. Players try find out as fast as possible how many of the rolled dice match the card. First correct guess gets the card.

Quite nice "speed-style" game which was a lot earlier than the "real" Speed".

name: Trivia by the Pound: Pop Culture Trivia Game
description: Playable on its own or to supplement your favorite trivia game. Features 1200 questions on pop culture.

name: Max Backtalk
description: Max Backtalk is an electronic memory/reaction game that uses the player's own voices. To begin, each player sits by a colored button and speaks a word into the microphone. The game starts by Max flashing a player's light and repeating that player's word. The player scores a point by quickly pressing his or her button. If your reaction time is too slow you lose a point. Max then calls another player's word and so on. Be careful - Max can also bluff by calling one player's word and lighting another player's light. Any player that reacts would then lose a point. The longer you play, the faster the words are spoken and the lenses light. The player with the most points at the end is the winner. An elimination version, and a simple memory game (ala Simon) can also be played.

name: Hakodate 1869
description: A wargame on a battle of the Japanese civil war between those factions who wanted to keep Japan closed vs. the Meiji reformers.

name: Border Patrol
description: Using a set of octiamonds (all the different ways to join 8 triangles) players add their pieces to the main figure trying to be the first to run out.

name: Philadelphia in a Box
description: A Monopoly clone from Late For The Sky; this version is based in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. It has spaces such as Penn's Landing, Liberty Bell, Society Hill, Jeweler's Row, Betsy Ross House, Italian Market, and a Philly Cheesesteak. The tokens include a pretzel, heart, Liberty Bell, Ben Franklin, Love statue, and a Cheesesteak. Cards include local events and staples of life in Philadelphia.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Shelters
description:
"As the comet approached, the townspeople sought shelters in caves in the surrounding hills. But there were not quite enough shelters to go around . . ."

Players each have nine pieces which start in the middle of the board. Pieces may move one space in any direction or jump over adjacent pieces, and multiple jumps are allowed. Pieces are never captured.

Terrain - roads, woods, and rivers - alters the movement rules: pieces move faster on roads, jumping moves are not permitted into or over rivers, etc.

The object of the game is to get your pieces to the caves on the outer edge of the board. The first player to accomplish this wins.

name: Toy Story: Adventures in the Real World
description:
A card game where players take turns drawing cards from the top of the deck and executing actions based on what's drawn. The object of the game is to collect four Buzz Lightyear cards and four Woody cards.

Other cards allow other actions:

- steal a card from another player
- take another player's Buzz or Woody card and mix it face down with a "Sid's hand" card -- if the player chooses their card, they get it back; otherwise, it is discarded
- take one of your Woody cards and put it in the game box; any player that draws a Buzz card and remembers that Woody is in the box gets to "rescue" Woody and add him to their collection
- place a card in front of them that gives protection from the detrimental effects in the game
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Martian Mud Wrestling
description:
Published by Looney Labs in 2002, in Hypothermia issue #15.

Martian Mud Wrestling is a game for two players, using two stashes of Icehouse pieces and a 5x5 grid board. There are only three rules to the game: how to move individual pieces, how to remove pieces from the board, and how to lose. The designer claims that this game tends to draw between players of equal skill level.

name: The Wind in the Willows
description:
The Wind in the Willows game is a simple roll and move game for up to four players. The game was published by Reader's Digest using artwork and characters from the TVC London production of The Wind in the Willows for Carlton TV.

Players take it in turns to roll the dice and move their character (Mole, Ratty, Mr Toad or Badger) the number shown. Throughout the game players will land on spaces that will slow down or speed up the progress to the celebration party at Toad Hall. The instructions on the various squares must be followed when they are landed on.

The first player to land on the Finish at Square 49 with an exact throw on the dice is the winner.
categories: Animals, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Chariots
description: This is a game for a standard piecepack about racing chariots, like in the Circus Maximus in ancient Rome. The game uses a plotted impulse based movement system similar to that in the game Star Fleet Battles or Car Wars. This game is about racing, not combat.

name: Due Conga
description:
Due Conga is an abstract two-player game using a board with four hollows and three varieties of eight stones.

In turn, each player places 1, 2 or 3 stones in one of four hollows. It is forbidden to have the same amount of stones in any of the hollows. The player who gets caught out or places the last stone is the loser.

Publishing history: Essen isn't only a place for publishers to find their gaming audience, sometimes it is also the place where designers find their dream publisher. Intrigued by a beautiful wooden version of Wittig's "Moguli", Frank Stark, with mainly card games and only one board game under his belt, got talking with the publisher and not much later Clemens Gerhards released two of his designs in the same high quality make-up. "Trio Trio" and "Samas" were followed a year later, in 2005, by "Kick-It" and "Due conGa", again in the deluxe wooden versions that are Clemens Gerhards' specialty.

name: Royal Fluster
description:
This is part of the Big Deal series of card games by Patch Products.

Players are dealt five cards from a modified standard deck and attempt to put together a Royal Flush by drawing and discarding cards. If you discard an Ace, you must draw a Fluster card and follow the instructions, hoping not to be harmed. The first player to make a royal flush wins the game.

name: Nautilus
description: The game consists of a spiral recessed track, 32 small containers (8 in each of 4 colors) and 16 chips. The chips are put in half the containers (four per color) and the containers are mixed together so that the locations of the chips are hidden. The containers are placed in the spiral and players take turns rearranging the containers. When players move pieces of their own color (or have permission from the owning player) they shake them and listen for the chips. When four pieces of a color are in a row in the spiral, the player collects the chips contained within. The first player to find all of his chips wins. (The complete rules contain a number of additional details.)

name: Go Fish For Letters
description:
Use letter cards to form the most words.

Key differences between this game and Go Fish:
1. Players ask for letters to form words, not numbers to make matches.
2. Players must form words of three letters or more.
3. At the end of the game, players count how many words they have formed. Each word counts as one point. Players subtract one point if they have any cards left in their hands. The player with the most points wins.

Letter-quantity of cards (60 total)
A-5
B-1
C-1
D-2
E-7
F-1
G-2
H-1
I-5
J-1
K-1
L-2
M-1
N-4
O-5
P-1
Q-1
R-4
S-3
T-4
U-3
V-1
W-1
X-1
Y-1
Z-1

name: Radar Flop
description:
Six circular areas, each with a sweeping radar at its core, are surrounding a central area, again with its own radar system. Each radar is surrounded by three rings, marked 1 (=inner) to 3 (=outer), and each radar zone is divided into 6 pie-parts, except for the central radar zone, which has 12 pie-parts. The radars themselves are small dots at the center of each zone. The outer 6 radars each have 2 pie-bits connected to a neighbor. One movable radar beam is placed on each station, covering a sixth of each circular area, and a beam half that size is placed in the central zone. Each player takes ownership of an equal amount of outer radar posts, and gets a small squadrons in the same color. These are then placed on the starting fields on the outer edge of the board, just outside their own radar post zone.

Using dice, 2-6 players try to keep their fleet of planes under the radar, and the first one to sneak 3 planes of one color into the center zone is the winning commander.

In turn, players will first move the radar beam at their own station forwards. The beam speed depends on the activity within the zone. Any planes that get caught by the sweeping beam have to abort their attempt to reach the center, and return to their start location to start another approach.

After that, the planes move, by rolling 4 dice. Planes are under no obligation to move, but when a die gets allocated to a plane, the entire move has to be made. Planes start on the outer rim and move, avoiding the area covered by the radar beam, clockwise or anti-clockwise, along the ring it is currently occupying. However, in the pie-part that touches its neighbor, planes have an opportunity to "flop" radar stations instead of continuing on their current track. When they do flop, they move their plane to the other station's pie-part, but place the plane one ring closer to that's station's radar than the one they just left.

When a plane leaves the most central track and flops right on top of a neighboring radar, called the blitz-field, that plane is then immediately moved to the outer ring of the central radar, which is surrounded by 2 rings. Each subsequent plane of that color that manages to make it to the central zone undetected, arrives one ring closer to its center. When the third plane of a color pops up on the most central ring, that player is the winner.

At the end of a round, the central radar also sweeps forwards, the speed again depending on how crowded the central zone is, and detected planes must abort and start their mission again from the beginning. After each round a new turn-order is established.

This is a fairly abstract race game, using a novel mechanic, that works quite well. It is probably slightly more complex than the average Spielbox game, but simple enough to appeal to a family audience.

Publication history: this game appeared in Spielbox magazine (4/1984 oct-dec), as one of the earlier entrants in the "Spiel zum Herausnehmen/Game to Remove" series. Its novel movement mechanism made it the winner in Spielbox' "Invent-a-Game" competition. Some assembly required.

This is not the first "dodging" collaboration between Bernd Brunnhofer and Karl-Heinz Schmiel. A year before the pair had given the start signal for "Hans im Glück" by self-publishing Dodge City, in partnership with Bernd's wife Margaret.

name: Monopoly: Reading
description: An edition of the commercially successful board game, Monopoly. This edition takes in the English town of Reading. Popular and well known landmarks are for sale including the Madejski Stadium, the Abbey Ruins and The Oracle shopping centre. Local companies and organisations logos feature prominently on the gameboard.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Sternenschweif: Der steinerne Spiegel
description:
One of a series of Kosmos games based on the My Secret Unicorn books by Linda Chapman.

In Germany, the series goes by the name, "Sternenschweif" (Star Tail) and the books are also published by Kosmos.

Der steinerne Spiegel is based on the third book in the series, with the same name. There are 16 cards showing a combination of people, ponies, places and activities. There are also 16 tiles, each of which shows the individual people, ponies, etc. Players use the tiles to win the corresponding cards and the player who has the most cards at the end of the game wins.

name: Landlord
description:
Two landlords are fighting over a piece of land. They decide to make a deal. To Take turns they can move across the land horizontally, vertically or diagonally. The player who manages to enclose the most pieces of land becomes the owner.

HOW TO PLAY LANDLORD

1. The two players put their landlords in the starting position.
2. They take turns moving the landlords over one of the paths. As soon as a player succeeds in enclosing a triangle, the enclosed land becomes the property of that player. He then covers the triangle with a playing piece of his color. The land is now his and can never be recaptured.
3. Take note: it is also possible to enclose several triangles at the same time.
4. The game ends when all triangles on the playing board have been claimed as property. The winner is the player who owns the most pieces of land at the end of the game.

Not to be confused with:

Landlord! (1992), a card game from Rio Grande Games
The Landlord's Game (1904), a progenitor of Monopoly

name: Winnie the Pooh Friends of the Forest Game
description:
Winnie the Pooh : Friends of the Forest Game
2-4 Players
Ages 5+

Overview
Down in the Hundred Acre Wood, Pooh and his friends have fallen on hard times. The once crystal blue river has long since clogged up with rubbish and the trees which provide warmth and shelter for the animals are fast disappearing.
Woozles and Heffalumps are mischievous creatures, who wreak havoc in the wood chopping down trees, tossing rubbish in the river and generally making a nuisance of themselves.
Your task is to help Pooh clean the river and plant three trees.

Contents
1 Playing Area
27 Pooh Cards
28 Woozle Cards
4 Wooden Playing Pieces
1 Wooden Spinner (Top & Bottom)
12 Self Assembly Interlocking Trees
12 Jigsaw River Sections
2 Interlocking Woodland Sections
1 Dice

Object of the Game
To be the first player to clean up the river and plant three trees in his/her area

Gameplay
Players roll a die and move around the board planting trees and cleaning river sections.

When a player lands on a Spin the cloud space the weather cloud is spun and effects are applied to the players areas

Sunny – Take a tree
Stormy – Lose a tree but clean a river section
Pollution – Lose a tree and a clean river section
Gloomy – Your area is unaffected

Trees and Rivers can also be lost and gained through cards and other board spaces

name: Monopoly: Manchester Edition
description: The great property trading game finds its home in the heart of the North West. You can now play this classic game with the street names, landmarks and locations that give the city its distictive character. With its exciting, cosmopolitan atmosphere, galleries, theatres, Victorian architecture and sports clubs, Manchester is the liveliest of cities. Its comprehensive travel links will speed you around from Old Trafford to Granada Studios, the Museum of Science and Industry and, bustling Chinatown. As the hub of the North West, Manchester provides easy access to the moor and lake lands with Towns and Villages bursting with character. All of which makes for a fascinating edition of the world's favourite board game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Parker Brothers, Winning Moves UK Ltd.

name: Monopoly: Newcastle United Football Club
description: The classic boardgame takes on a new shape in this Newcastle United edition. Featuring stars from the current squad alongside heroes from Newcastle's illustrious past and two of the club's greatest managers, this version of Monopoly requires players to accumulate wealth by aquiring stands and stadiums. Community Chest and Chance cards are replaced by Home and Away cards. It's an absolute must for all Newcastle fans!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Mission Antarctique
description:
You and your crew explore Antarctica searching for the Jonas expedition, mysteriously lost 20 years ago.
You'll have to answer questions in 7 different places (about polar regions) or win contests to receive evidence to be the first to find Jonas expedition.

name: MultimillionÃ¦r
description:
Multimillionær (Multi-millionaire) is a Monopoly-like game, but with more advanced economics.

The game includes a stock market, and if one player owns more that 8 (of the 10) stocks of a colour, he or she will get 50% of the income.

Also, there are no prison, only the "Ideal holiday resort", in which the players must pay (progressively more) to stay each round.

There is no income for a completed round, instead there is a dummy pawn traveling around paying rent to the players.

The game ends if all but one player are bankrupt, if one player has 2 million kroner in values, or at a given time.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Der kleine Medicus
description:
The players are hunting the evil robot Gobbot (played by another player) with four mini submarines within the human body. Goal is to catch the robot while spending as little energy as possible. Rules suggest that each players gets to play as the robot once, and then the scores are added.

Each turn, the players first choose an action card. There are cards which cost a different amount of energy (victory points); they cause the evil player to give more or less precise information about his current hiding place. Another type of card leads to some dexterity/sports contest between the evil and one of the good players; if good wins, they can make a guess where the robot is now.

After this, the players move their submarines; but they are restricted in the paths they may use.
Then the robot moves; he may use all paths, but can never return to a place he was before, which limits his moves as the game progresses.

Game ends with a victory of good when the players reach the robot, when the robot has no legal move left, or when the players guess right after winning a dexterity challenge. The robot player wins if he survives until the action card deck is exhausted after 16 turns.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Deduction, Educational, Medical, Novel-based
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Point to Point Movement

name: Raze the Castle!
description:
Free print-and-play game about expanding your kingdom and protecting it from opponents' attackers and special invaders.

Each turn resolve events, pay upkeep, build structures and hire defenders. Play until one player's castle has been destroyed in combat, then largest and strongest kingdom wins.

name: Moon Shot
description:
It's the mid-1960s, and the Space Race is heating up. You are the launch commander of a mission to land on the Moon and, eventually, to colonize it. But your opponents want to plant their flags there first and claim the high ground as their own!

Players take turns trying to "launch" a small pyramid into a Treehouse tube that is resting on its side. Each successful "landing" earns points for the launching player. The game ends when a player establishes a "colony" or "cracks" the Moon.

Moon Shot is a game of dexterous strategy for any number of players. Full rules can be found on the Icehouse Games Wiki:

http://icehousegames.org/wiki/index.php?title=Moon_Shot

name: Tourne-case
description:
A seventeenth century French game played on a Backgammon board. Each player only uses three pieces. The pieces race in the same direction along opposite edges of the board rather than circling the entire board as in Backgammon.

The pieces start off board. Entry and movement are determined by the roll of two dice. The number on each die may be used separately to move two pieces or combined to move a single piece, except when doubles are rolled in which case the player is only allowed to move the amount shown on a single die (i.e. on a roll of double sixes, the player is allowed to move only one piece six spaces). Rolls which may not be played are lost.

Each player's pieces must remain in their order of entry - there is no passing - and two pieces cannot share a space except when they reach the home space (the twelfth point) at the end of the board. When a piece is moved to a space which is immediately opposite a space containing an opponent's piece (except the home spaces at the end of the board), the opposing piece is sent back off the board to re-enter on that player's next roll.

name: Pyramid Power
description:
The goal of Pyramid Power is to play all of your Pyramid tiles and to score points. A pyramid tile is a triangular tile with each corner of the triangle being one color.

When a Pyramid tile is played, the corner colors must match the corner colors of tiles already played. Players score the value of the tile played. If the Pyramid tile matches on the more than one side, bonuses are scored.

If a player has unplayable tiles, the player draws one tile to try and play. The first player to play all of their Pyramid tiles ends the game and scores as a bonus the value of the other players remaining Pyramid tiles. High score is the winner.

name: Multi Score
description:
Move as in "Chinese Checkers" (e.g. pieces jump over other pieces) trying to score as many points as possible by occupying your opponent's most important positions with your most valuable counters. The object of the game is to attempt to do this while avoiding your opponent's efforts to occupy YOUR most valuable bases. At the same time, you must try to box-in his/hers most important counters. To find your score, you must multiply the figure on the counter with the figure on the square. Simple rules.

—description from the back of the box
publishers: Arxon, Invicta Games, N.P.T. A/S: Oslo

name: Lucy & Pepe
description:
One in a long line of Haba's games in a tin series.

This is a children's variant of the classic Parcheesi. The rules can vary to make it more forgiving, the board is much smaller and there are two sets of cute wooden pieces: Cats & Dogs. As in many of Habas' games the rules are in multiple languages. For Lucy & Pepe includes German, English, French and Dutch.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Chinese Word Building Game
description:
Players build a chain of words using tiles containing Chinese words, radicals and strokes. Each adjacent pair of tiles must combine to form a word.

By way of comparison with English, it is akin to creating a string of compound words where the second part of the first word is the first part of the following word. For example: seahorse -> horseman -> manpower -> powerhouse -> household.

This game is similar to Chinese Characters Puzzle (Radicals V1.0).

name: Hollywood
description:
Trivial Pursuit like game: the aim is to collect 6 tokens (called stars) of different colors. Once collected, 1 final correct answer is needed to win after landing on one of the 6 Oscar fields.
The questions linked to the red stars are provided on a DVD, containing 165 original movie fragments.
The other stars use typical questions cards similar to Trivial Pursuit.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Dog Races
description:
Dog Races is a family friendly card game. You earn points from each race that the dogs take part in.

Players place scoring tokens of various denominations against each dog, then play cards to race the dogs. Cards may increase or decrease a dogs journey to the end of the race.

Players score points based on the tokens they placed against the winning dog.

The game is web published...
publishers: (Self-Published), (Web published), Book Ranger, Print & Play Productions

name: Seii Taishogun: Sengoku Karuto
description:
Seii Taishogun: Sengoku Karuto is the seventh title available in Small Box Games' Pure Card Line.

Sengoku Karuto loosely borrows from the theme and mechanics of one of Small Box Games' most popular games, Seii Taishogun. Players are rival daimyo in Sengoku era Japan attempting to cleverly outwit eachother to gain control of various locations scattered across Japan's four main islands.

Unlike the original, each card represents one to three (1-3) samurai belonging to one of four clans and one of the following locations: temple, pagoda, or castle on one of the four islands of Japan. Players secretly assemble armies comprised of Samurai from one of four clans to conquer new locations. Armies constructed of Samurai from the same clan are more powerful than armies using various clans. Additionally, players can persuade locations to rally under their banners or attempt to conquer another player's locations.

Players are awarded points at the end of the game for the locations they've conquered, with additional points being awarded when various conditions are met.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Hasenjagd
description:
Description from BoardgameNews.com:

Hasenjagd ("Rabbit Hunt" in English) has players take turns moving a rabbit through the grass, trying to avoid foxes along the way. The hare card that a player chooses uses arrows to show where the rabbit moves – and if you can't lay hare cards to move the rabbit to safety, then you're out of the round. Hop the right way, and you'll run away with the golden carrot.

name: Laskutaituri
description:
Fast-paced calculation game for 1 to 8 players. On their turn, player throws 14 special 6-sided dice with numbers ranging from 1 to 15. Then player tries to place them in a grid of four rows, so that all rows show correct calculations. Correct calculations score points. Time for placement is limited with a hourglass.

The grid looks like this: (X = places for dice).
X + X = X
X - X = X
X * X = X +- X
X / X = X +- X

Similar to Minutspelet which is for 2 players only.

name: Vimto Cluedo
description:
C.I.A.
Cordial Investigation Agency

CASE FILE:
The Case of the Missing Birthday Cake

Exactly one hundred years ago in 1908 (John) Noel Nichols invented the delicious drink that we have all come to know and love as Vimto. To mark this very special occasion and to celebrate Vimto's 100th Birthday, a party has been planned and will be held at the Vimto Factory.

Unfortunately, the Birthday Cake has disappeared and celebrations are on hold until we have solved the mystery of the Missing Birthday Cake.

Search each of the nine rooms in the Vimto Factory to find clues and be the first to solve the mystery. Who ate the cake, in which room and with which Vimto drink?

Good luck Detective.
mechanics: Hand Management, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Monopoly: York Edition
description: A version of the classic game Monopoly, with names and images of board elements taken from York, England.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: DrÃ´les de Mamans
description:
The goal of the game is to collect and assemble parts of moms

the tiles represent moms in different colors and style.
Each mom is split in 3 parts (head, body and legs).

All the tiles are shuffled face down, this is the board.

Like in Memory we must remember were the tiles you want are, and you collect them to build hilarious moms.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Educational
mechanics: Memory, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: Volcanic Disaster
description: This is a rummy-style game. Players play from and then replenish their hands of cards. The goal is to be the first player to play five volcano cards. You obtain and play a volcano card when you discard three different precursor cards from your hand simultaneously. Meanwhile, various action cards played by you and the other players can help or hinder your progress.

name: Wo ist mein Futter?
description:
Game description from the publisher:

In the cooperative game Wo ist mein Futter? ("Where's My Food?"), night is falling on Sunshine Farm, but Farmer Tim has been dreaming all day and has not yet brought all the food baskets to the barn. Thus, all the players need to help the animals quickly collect their own food. By working together, can you and the other players bring the food to the barn before night has fallen completely?

The rulebook includes a competitive variant.

name: Where Is Sock Monkey Board Game
description:
Can you find him? Follow the clues and search through the jungle before time runs out. The player that finds sock monkey wins.

Comes with a real Sock Monkey. One player hides the Sock Monkey in the house. Players turn over a tile on their turn. If it is a question (Where is Sock Monkey? In a room with a bed?), the hider answers "Yes" or "No", and the clues are set face up in that pile. If the player turns over a Go Look! tile, the timer is turned over and the player has 40 seconds to look for Sock Monkey. If the Sock Monkey is found, the player wins. If the Sock Monkey is not found after three "Go Look!" searches, the hider wins.

Great game for preschoolers. Kids will have lots of fun with their friends. Sure to become a classic for your family game night.

name: Karmabusiness
description:
KARMABUSINESS, a game to stimulate the Entrepreneur that lies within us all, is a simple and realistic simulation of the world of business in which the creation of a successful company is not the objective, but merely the means by which we attain a far less prosaic goal: the realization of our Dreams.

In KARMABUSINESS you will:


Start up Businesses at different levels.
Develop your Negotiation skills.
Undertake exciting tests for your Personal Development.
Use your Resources to generate employment and wealth.
Detect and take advantage of business opportunities.
Set aside part of your profit for Social Well-being (Karma).
Invest in Advertising to increase your market share.
Secure the capital to drive your projects through Loans.
Acquire Shares in your opponents' companies.
Discover your Dreams and make them reality!

name: Der Fette Pinguin
description:
The Fat Penguin is an ice-breaker. In the game, players take turns to ask a question of the others. Players secretly choose their answer (red/no or green/yes). Then the asking player has to guess individually what the other players answered for themselves. If the player is correct, then its penguin advances.

The questions varies from everyday-life tendencies and preferences, to life/death and ethical dilemmas, and funny/dirty questions. E.g.: "Have you in the past year used someone elses toothbrush?", "Would you rather give up your mom's love (green) og the respect of your friends (red)?", "What is more unattractive: Too self-confident (green) or too shy (red)?", "Routined sex three times a week (green) or exciting sex once every third week (red)?"

The game is intended as an ice-breaker at parties. The drinking-game variant makes the players take a shot of booze/beer if they are right or wrong.

The game is published in German "Der Fette Pinguin", in English "The Fat Penguin" and in Danish "Den Fede Pingvin". There is also a smartphone App version of the game (available in Danish for iPhone, and soon in English and German and also for Android).

name: Show do MilhÃ£o 2
description:
From the box: the biggest TV success in a new sensational game for all family!

Show do Milhão 2 is game based on a brazilian Q&A TV show. The player is presented with a question and four possible answers, but only one is correct. The player must choose the right answer or he loses the game. Addionally, the player may skip up to 2 questions, randomly excludes 0 to 3 wrong answer in 1 given question, or ask the other players about their opinion in 1 given question. As the player advances, questions begin to become more difficult until the final answer, where the player must answer without any help.

name: Shadow Days: Dark Star
description: Dark Star is a mini-expansion that adds a total of 30 cards. It introduces two new card types: Villain and War Machine. It also provides the first Stronghold for the protection of Villains.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Paradox (fan expansion for Dominion)
description:
Paradox is a fan expansion for Dominion.

Wait, all of a sudden playing this card might help my opponent more? But yet, if they choose to let it help them, it will push me over the top to get an early Province lead. While not all cards involve decisions quite this Paradoxical, it was the driving inspiration for this Chapter to the Dominion Fan Universe. Consider printing this fan expansion if you are interested in:
A) heightened player interaction;
B) more variety in win conditions;
C) additional powerful card combinations depending on setup;
D) shifted timing, with once strong early game cards becoming strong only late game (in certain setups);
E) non-obvious cards which involve more critical thinking than “do I have any actions left” to play;
F) and just generally re-thinking how best to play.

New mechanics (and further exploration of existing mechanics) to accomplish this include:
Curses – A greater variety of curse cards, some of which you’ll actually want (in controlled quantities).
Loops – Sustain a card ability as long as you can meet the trigger.
Vulnerability – A new type of interaction with other players and increased occurrence of Attack – Reaction plays.
Guilds and Variant Rules – New goals to aim for to mix up the rather abstract strive for victory point cards.
Reaction cards – A higher saturation than normal of reaction cards that respond to more than just attack cards. Some you may choose to reveal only at the right times they are triggered rather than at every opportunity. And others are simply beneficial to all, in a somewhat reverse attack fashion.

_________________________________________________________________
Components:
Total Expansion Size (with all options)
587 cards – 36 mats – 46 tokens – 1 rules document

Kingdom cards – 404 cards (40 decks: 38 decks of 10 cards, + 2 Victory card decks of 12 cards)

Other cards / components: optional (breakdown in rules)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: HundraÃ¥ringen
description:
Sharp centenarian Allan Karlsson embarks on an amazing adventure across the world, meeting various historical figures and playing a crucial role in many world events. The players act as narrators, moving Allan by playing cards and collecting points. Let your skills take over, earn points and travel around the world together with Allan! (Translation from the box back)

The game is based on the best-selling book "Hundraåringen som klev ut genom fönstret och försvann" (The Hundred-Year-Old Man Who Climbed Out the Window and Disappeared) by the Swedish author Jonas Jonasson.

Players play cards to move the common Allan figure on the world map and to trigger events (related to the book storyline). Events score points for the player and move the time marker forward on the time track. When the marker reaches the end, the game ends and the player with most points wins. The key to winning is to have Allan in the right locations in the right time, as most events can only be played in a certain city at a certain time.
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Textra
description:
Textra is word game, that consist of a plastic container, 206 letter tiles and 4 letter trays - clearly inspired by Scrabble, but the main gimmick here is the plastic container with clever mechanism to separate vowels and consonants. In the container you have trail where you put your letter tiles to make words. And when the trail is full (something like 15 tiles), the first used letters drop in to two departments one for vowels and other for consonants.

When you start the game, the first player puts one vowel and one consonant in any order in to the trail and then every player gets six letter tiles to make words. You can choose the distribution of vowels and consonants at the start of the game and always when you refill your tile tray. At the players turn you try to make a word using as many already laid letters in a trail as the first letters of your new word. Rest of your word consists of letters you have in your tray. You just put the letters from your tray to the trail to make a new word. Then you multiply newly added letters with letters you used from the previous ones and that makes your points. You fill your hand and then it is the next players turn.

Example: "AUTO" becomes "autoMATIC" (4*5=20 pts.), then "ticK" (3*1), then "tickLE" (4*2) etc.

In a four player game you play to the end of the round, when someone gets total of 60 points. Winner is the player who got the most points. In three player game you play until 80 points and with two players until 100 points. When playing alone you just decide number of rounds and try to make as many points as as you can.

You can play this game as long as you like, because the used letters are dropping back to containers departments, which is the same place where you take the new letter tiles. There is 100 vowel tiles and 100 consonant tiles and six wild tiles in the game. There's quite a few letters missing, that are used in Finnish language. Letter distribution of the game is: vowels: (40*A, 10*E, 20*I 15*O, 15*U) and consonants: (5*H, 5*J, 15*K, 15*L, 5*M, 10*N, 5*P, 5*R, 10*S, 20*T, 5*V). You can play the game in any language, where you can make enough words with these letters. Because of "the clever" mechanism, the vowel tiles are bit smaller than the consonant tiles.

name: Combo
description:
A super-quick game of super-quick thinking!

Play and move the cards around, and try to create a chain of five matching symbols before anyone else. Get the combo and steal the win!

name: Monopoly: The Smurfs Collector's Edition
description:
Publisher Blurb:

It's the Smurfiest MONOPOLY ever! The Smurfs edition of Monopoly allows fans to buy, sell and trade classic locations in the Smurfs' village such as Papa Smurf's Lab, Smurfette's flower garden and Hefty's weight room. Tra la la la lala your way around the board with Smurf character tokens while buying up properties with Smurfberries and reliving your favorite Smurfy memories. It's the Smurfiest way to play your favorite game, MONOPOLY!
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Mutiny
description:
The goal of Mutiny is to stay alive while eliminating your opponents. Keeping your allies safe is also a good idea. But... better them than you right? You’re a pirate after all!

Players are given role cards to determine their allegiance and who they will play as for the game. Players can be divided into 3 groups, Traitors, Loyal shipmates and the captain.

Traitors try to eliminate the captain, who is known by everyone, and the loyal mates while the shipmates try to defend the captain and kill all the traitors. The captain's goal is simply to stay alive, but since he's the only one oblivious to the other players loyalty, it can be harder than it looks.

The two main groups will then decide, one after the other, which meal they want to poison and once this is done the round can start. One after the other, players will switch their meals with one another. Once everyone did their action, everyone will reveal their meal card. Those who have been poisoned are removed from the game and those who survive continue to the next round.

This goes on until every traitors or mates has died or until the Captain dies.

name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Einsatz im Shellraiser
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Set the pizza aside, collect your weapons, and get ready to go as Splinter and his ninjas are here!

In Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Einsatz im Shellraiser, each player needs to collect Master Splinter, April O'Neil, and a complete set of turtles as quickly as possible in order to oppose the chosen villain. Whoever first gets his team together wins the round — but shuffle the cards quickly and prepare for the next round because the villains keep coming...
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Whole Armor of God
description: It's time to put on your armor, pick up your sword and shield, and get ready to battle! In Whole Armor of God, your quest is to be the first player to build a warrior by collecting all six armor tiles. When it's your turn, use the Faith in Action cards like Prayer, Follow the Prophet, and Attend Church to earn each piece of your armor. But watch out as your opponents use their Fiery Darts cards to keep you from winning. Whole Armor of God is a game the whole family will enjoy playing again and again!
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Whac-A-Mole Treasure Game
description: Four little moles are in a race for treasure! Each player must follow the colorful trail to find the cave of jewels at the end of the line. But watch out - other players can use the hammer to SMACK you back several spaces! The first player to reach the treasure is the winner.

name: Monopoly: Mexico City Edition
description: This spin off of Monopoly includes popular streets and locations within the Mexico City region. The game board, cards, and instructions are printed Spanish.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Rocca Classic
description:
Rocca Classic is a hexagon-shaped card game designed to look like a cube.

You can play original games Card Tower and Rocca The Monster.
It has the same deck as ordinary playing cards, so traditional card games such as poker and sevens can be played with it, too. Rocca has another face that is to be used as flat building blocks that give us an optical illusion of a three-dimensional blocks.

The object of Card Tower is to be the first player to run out of cards.

Card Monster (4-6 players) has two objectives. It is similar to the game Werewolf. The player with the monster card tries to kill more than half the village before being caught. The villagers try to kill the monster before more than half of them are caught.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Number, Puzzle

name: No Exit
description:
Official description:

"It's a mad dash to get your car to exit the street as fast as possible. One player is the Road Builder. He extends the road on every turn by placing a new tile down. The other players are Drivers They roll the game die and decide which way to move, hoping to speed off the board before another tile is played. It's a frantic race to the finish!"

In each round, a different player takes the role of the Road Builder, and all of the other players become Drivers. The Road Builder's goal is to lay down all of their tiles before a Driver can Exit the roadway. The Drivers are trying to exit from the roadway before any other Drivers, as well as before the Road Builder lays the last tile.

The road tiles have special features, including tunnels (which allow the player to "warp" to any other tunnel space when landing on one by exact count), or the dreaded "No Exit," which blocks the road.

Recommended to play enough rounds so every player has a chance to be the Road Builder. Rules are included for both "Road Builder versus everyone else" and team play.

name: Cranium Playground
description:
Welcome to CRANIUM Playground, the game where you race around the monkey bars matching,drawing, dancing, and making letter shapes as you do!

On your turn players will roll a die and move their playing piece around the box and complete a task based on the colour they land on. These consist of Red Data Head (Counting), Yellow Star Performer (Dancing), Blue Creative Cat (Drawing), and Word Worm (Letters) The first player to make it all the around the playground (board) wins!

name: Smiley Action Game
description:
Each turn in Smiley Action Game, someone turns over one of the 52 cards, then everyone checks which green and red smileys are visible. Grab the cards where these smileys are, but do not take the card if smileys from the red side are on them.

The player with most cards in the end wins.

name: Formula 1 vauhtipeli
description:
In this Finnish Formula racing game the car is represented by two standard pawns. The game starts so that everyone has one on the board, then a special die is rolled. If you get 1, 2 or 3 you put your other pawn on the board - now you are on the move. But beware, as your moves always affect your next move as well. The basic idea is that you always move by putting the pawn that is behind in the exact opposite spot (called "A"-spot) in front of the other pawn. You do however roll the die on each turn and that tells you how many grid points you can deviate from the "A" spot (from 0-3). Deviating sideways represents steering while deviating the two pawns closer or further apart represents deceleration and acceleration. Thus, the two pawns form a vector which represents the car's speed and it goes without saying that if you approach a tight curve with a too long vector (=too high speed) you won't be able to make it within the possible die results, but will crash out of the track. Crashing will cause you to pass a number of turns equal to your speed, which is doubled if the crash happened in a particularly difficult spot, as marked on the board. Rolling a "NO" will force you to pass the turn while rolling a "FREE" gives you an extra turn. Rolling 0 means that the car simply keeps it speed and direction for that turn (with possibly disastrous results if it happens many times in a row).

Hitting a green spot on the track causes you to pick a Turbo card (good) while hitting one of the more plentiful yellow spots means a Danger card (bad, surprisingly). Hitting one of the red spots gives you a free move, which is somewhat limited by the blue lines that divide the track into shorter "race areas".

After a pre-agreed number of laps, the winner is the player who first manages to cross the finish line AND bring their car to a controlled full stop.

The game promises to give "a surprisingly realistic feel of racing".

The game comes with the basic track of Monza. Additional tracks have been published for Hockenheim, Las Vegas and Monaco (1983).

name: UnnÃ¼tzes Quizzen: Wissenschaft & Unsinn
description:
Unnützes Quizzen: Wissenschaft & Unsinn ("Useless Knowledge: Science and Nonsense") is a German Trivia Game with obscure facts about science and nonsense.

From the Publisher (translated):
"Test your unuseful knowledge! Why won't you get sunburn at the dead see? What speed does a popping champagne cork reach? And how many time of our lifes do we spend on the toilet? The big questions of the animal kingdom - in this quiz from the popular section of the NEON magazine, they will all be answered. For at home, on the go, for in between: 99 quizzes to always have."

From the publisher (German):
Teste dein unnützes Wissen Warum bekommt man am Toten Meer keinen Sonnenbrand? Welche Geschwindigkeit kann ein ploppender Sektkorken erreichen? Und wie viel Zeit unseres Lebens verbringen wir eigentlich auf der Toilette?Die großen Fragen der Menschheit – in diesem Quiz zur beliebten Rubrik aus dem NEON-Magazin werden sie alle beantwortet! Für zu Hause, für unterwegs, für zwischendurch: 99 Quiz-Fragen zum Immerdabeihaben.

name: Follow that Car!
description:
Follow That Car is a fun transport-themed matching game which can be enjoyed by all the family! Build a road by matching either the colour, animal or vehicle type and be the first to get rid of all your cards. However, watch out for roadblocks, which other players can put down to block your path! You can also use roundabout cards to extend the road layout and add more cards.

This is a great game not only to develop matching skills but also colour recognition as children can be encouraged to name and match the brightly coloured vehicles. Children will also love the fun animal transport illustrations, from elephants driving cars to sheep riding tractors!

Contents:

36 vehicle cards
1 roundabout card
3 roadblock cards (police car, flood, roadworks)
1 instruction leaflet
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Caro Cane
description:
Description from the publisher:

Caro Cane is a reworked design from Alex Randolph in which young players are presented with cards that show a watercolor illustration of a dog along with two other items — tree, ship, hat, car, cat, moon, ball, girl or boy — and players try to place cards with matching characteristics in the right location as quickly as possible in order to empty their hands.

name: Cornered
description:
Feeling cornered?

Match corners of your cards with the targets on the table to get rid of your cards first.
Best Elements
- Very simple game play : Extremely fast paced / Using both sides of the cards makes the targets change constantly
Contents
1 set of rules 48 double-sided cards
Object of the Game
Get rid of your cards first by finding corners that match the target shape.
The Cards
Both sides of the cards show one shape (of 4 possible) in one color (of 4 possible) at the center. At each corner, part of a shape is shown in one of the colors with each shape and color represented once on each side of the card.
Preparations
Shuffle the cards, place one at the middle of the table and distribute the remaining cards evenly between the players. Surplus cards are discarded.
The Game
There is no taking turns in this game; everyone plays as fast as they can to get rid of your cards.

When everyone is ready; flip over the card on the table. Now everybody races to find a card that has a corner matching the shape and color at the center of the card on the table (remember that you are allowed to use both sides).

When you find a card that matches; put it down on top of the card on the table and continue with the new card.
The first player to get rid of all his cards wins the game.

name: Egyptian Architects
description:
Gather your idols and prepare your workers, it’s time to construct a monument to your Pharaoh!

In Egyptian Architects players compete to prove who is the greatest architect in the Nile valley by playing cards to construct holy shrines and lay the bricks of the mighty pyramids. But only one will rise triumphant and receive the blessings of the gods.

Egyptian Architects is a card drafting game over 3 rounds. Each round players picks cards, and then take turns playing them to build pyramids and score points. The player with the most points at the end of the 3rd round wins!

—description from the publisher

name: Murderopolis
description:
Welcome to Murderopolis, detective! A place where there is a shitload of killing going down. It’s time to solve some murder cases, get paid, get laid, and get out alive—if you can.

How To Play
Shuffle and deal each player 8 cards. If the "Death" card is dealt, the recipient is to exchange it for a new card, and it be inserted back into the deck. Set the deck face down between all participants. The player left of the dealer takes the first turn.

For each turn, players draw 1 card and try to match 4 cards: the Suspect, Weapon, and Evidence cards featured on any Location card. Witness cards are wild and may be used in place of any Weapon or Evidence card. When a player has all 4 cards to make a match, he or she is to set it down on the playing surface, and announce a murder case has been solved. An opponent may inspect the cards to verify the match. If a player is unable to solve a case, and has more than 8 cards, he or she must discard 1 card into an open field of cards. Another player may take any discard, rather than drawing from the deck. A turn ends when a player solves a case, discards, or can do neither.

When the Death card is drawn, the player dies and is to add all cards held to the discard field.

The first player to solve 3 cases, wins!
categories: Card Game, Horror, Mature / Adult, Murder/Mystery, Print & Play

name: Metka Avaruusmatka
description: Bingo with a twist. Throw two special dice and each player checks the color and number for what space they can cover on their astroboard. Player who first covers the whole route of one spaceship and yells "Ignition" wins the game.

name: Monopoly: Star Wars â Han Solo Edition
description:
Enter a world of smugglers and adventure! Explore the galaxy with Han Solo and his group of fellow scoundrels in this Solo: A Star Wars Story Monopoly game. Journey from the Battlefield to the Spice Mines and beyond. Take control of the Millennium Falcon and make it through the Kessel Run. Players aim to buy as many Star Wars Locations, Vehicles, and Power Sources as possible and take risks with the Smuggler and Scoundrel cards. The last player with money left when all other players have gone bankrupt wins!

—description from the back of the box

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: DC Spyfall: Comic Book Convention promo cards
description:
A new location for DC Spyfall.

Given out at GenCon 2018
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Wedding Ring
description:
You are a bride and a bridegroom and relive a game that was played at wedding ceremony in a long time ago.
In that game, roses and rings were used. The first player that moved a ring to the opponent's ring finger became a winner.
Then a loser had to tell a point he/she loved.

In this matchbox game, there is no rule like that a loser has to do something.
But how about telling your heart if you play this with a significant person?

—description from the designer

name: Rubamazzo
description:
Rubamazzo is a game with 40 cards representing 10 toys (each toy appears 4 times).
It reimplements classic card games like Rubamazzo (Stealing Bundles), Asso piglia tutto and Memory.
The first 2 games have the same rules of Rubamazzo and Asso piglia tutto, but it's easier to play because of there are pictures (toys) instead of numbers.
The third game is a variant of Memory: if a player makes a couple of a trunk or the same toy of an opponent, he can steal his bundle.

—description from the designer

name: Octopus
description:
A GAME OF DEXTERITY, MANIPULATION AND COOPERATION
OBJECT: to catch fish to transfer them from one board to another.
The players work together in pairs to catch a single fish, lift it up and move it into the lagoon. If the players drop a fish on the way because they bumped into one of the giant octopus’ tentacles, or for any other reason, they will have to catch the same fish again, wherever it landed. When the sand timer runs out, if all the fish have been moved to safety, the players win; otherwise, everyone has lost!

+++ A magnetic fishing game.

—description from the publisher

name: Action Pups!
description:
Action Pups! Compete to tell the secret life story of a dog.

Action Pups! contains a deck of 170 cards, each with unique picture of a dog on one side and the elements of a story on the back.

Each turn a judge draws a dog card and names the dog, while other players combine two cards from their hand to build an absurd story they pitch to the judge. Is that sassy retriever a tech mogul with a secret plan for world domination? Is that posh poodle a runaway model? Make a story, impress the judge, and may the best story win!

—description from the publisher

name: Warlock's Eye
description:
The baleful gaze of the dread Warlock is spreading evil throughout the realm. As your halfling hero advances towards the eventual confrontation will you persevere or succumb to the darkness?

Warlock's Eye is a roll and write game in which the Warlock's darkness grows with each roll of the d8 as the players decide whether to use the result to advance down a spiral path toward the confrontation with the Warlock or to spend precious actions crafting the magic items that might help your little hero survive the journey.

The first player to reach the Warlock's Eye and plunge the dagger into it, wins the game.

-description from designer

name: Aquaman
description:
Aquaman is a one-vs-many card game featuring the prominent characters of the Aquaman 2018 movie.

Each turn, the villain player must lay a given number of cards face down in a row and the heroes players must lay the same number of cards so that each individual hero card faces a villain card.

Cards are then revealed one by one, and damage is dealt according to a rock-paper-scissors mechanism. If one side is out of health points by the end of the turn, the game ends and the other side wins, otherwise a new turn begins. Ties are won by the heroes.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Action Queue, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Switch
description:
The objective is simple: Be the first player to arrange four of your game pieces in a two-by-two square. But winning this clever two-person game requires both a keen memory and cunning strategy.

There are 10 total player pieces: 3 orange, 3 green, and 4 two-color pieces.

Setup:
Turn five of the pieces orange side up and five pieces green side up, which will ensure the right distribution of two-color pieces. Each player then chooses a color and takes their five pieces.

Moves:
Player 1 starts by selecting a piece to play, after looking underneath to check its color, and places the piece anywhere on the board. Player 2 can then decide to PLACE one of their pieces on the board, FLIP any pieces on the board over while keeping it in the same space, or MOVE any piece of their color to a different space (you cannot move a piece that is not your color, only flip it).

Winning:
The game continues while each player tries to wager between placing, flipping, or moving the pieces on the board to create a two-by-two square of their color.
mechanics: Area Movement, Grid Movement, Memory, Square Grid

name: Mugrugni
description:
A game of battles and conquests in which only Mugrugni can be heard.

In this board game perfect for an evening with friends, you will lead one of the five tribes of wild boars to conquer the 40 districts of Genoa. You can choose the Sciacaeli, the Scignuri, the Beline, the Besughi and the Legere to defeat your enemies with cards, dice, strategy and ... fangs! Immerse yourself in a game of conquests and battles where only your skill as a strategist will determine the winner.

During his turn, the player moves his boar armies to take possession of the districts under the control of the opponents.
Battles are resolved by rolling dice and using cards to help the attack succeed. The player who manages to conquer all the territories designated for him at the beginning of the game or the player who has scored the most points wins

(Publisher's description)
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination

name: Krev a PÃ­sek
description:
In Krev a Písek (Blood and Sand), players are gladiators who are trying to come out on top in the arena.

Each player starts the round with a hand of cards, and everyone secretly chooses and reveals a single card to serve as their starting attack value. In turn, each player plays a card to add to their attack, repel an opponent's attack with a defense card, or modify an attack or prevent a defense; alternatively, a player can pass to skip one turn. If all players are out of cards or pass in turn, the round ends, and whoever has the highest attack value wins. If, however, a player would increase their attack value to 5, they win the round immediately.

The round's winner receives Roman denarii, and whoever first collects 5 Roman denarii wins.

name: Escape Game Verschollen im Bermuda Dreieck
description:
You are stranded on a remote island in the middle of the Bermuda Triangle where strange experiments seem to be taking place... Solve the mysteries you come across! Find out what's going on on the island! And fight the dangerous secret organisation ARES to escape from there!

Contents: - Adventure cards to explore the island and solve the puzzles! - Door lock code cards to gain access anywhere! - Encrypted records to uncover the secrets of the island!

Ihr seid auf einer abgelegenen Insel mitten im Bermuda-Dreieck gestrandet, auf der offenbar seltsame Experimente stattfinden … Löst die Rätsel, auf die ihr stoßt! Findet heraus, was auf der Insel vor sich geht! Und kämpft gegen die gefährliche Geheimorganisation ARES, um von dort zu entkommen!

Inhalt: - Abenteuer-Karten zum Erkunden der Insel und zum Lösen der Rätsel! - Türschloss-Code-Karten, die euch überall Zugang verschaffen! - Verschlüsselte Aufzeichnungen, mit denen ihr die Geheimnisse der Insel aufdeckt!

name: Soulfall
description:
In Soulfall, the 6 powerful Lords brought the world back from the brink of destruction and are worshipped as gods. In this combo building card game for 2 players, each player leads a fledgling tribe rebuilding after the near end. Using 3 Action cards and multi-use Lord cards, players will call upon the Lords for help, expand their tribe, and search for shards of the old world.

Each Lord card can potentially be played 4 different ways: played for its ability, as a Devotion, as a Shard, or as a Nomad.

There are no points in Soulfall; the game ends and a player wins if they have a certain number and/or type of cards.

This is a card only, two player adaptation of the original 2015 Soulfall board game. This adaptation, while it loses the board, as well as some of the original game's timing weirdness and confusing scoring, utilizes multi-use cards and the same action system to replicate the original in a quick playing, combo driven, card only game for two players.

—description from the publisher

name: Comet: Superhero Add-On
description:
Includes 5 new Comet heroes with very strong abilities to explore unique strategies and synergy combinations. New play patterns will emerge while saving animals from the threatening comet.
Shuffle the superheroes with the base game heroes and start the game as usual - or dedal one random superhero to each player at the beginning of the game.
Also includes 20 hero card sleeves to protect all your hero cards (including the base game heroes) from wear, tear and comet damage.
Use the savior board extension and savior token with the Giant Hare.
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Prehistoric, Racing
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Multi-Use Cards, Resource to Move, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Skyjo Junior
description:
Skyjo Junior is a card game aimed at children, designed as a simplified version of the original game "Skyjo".
The objective is to score the most points by making columns of cards of the same value to form a 3x4 grid. The cards represent fruits with values ranging from 1 to 5.

The game aims to teach children the concepts of numbering, strategy and decision-making while entertaining them.

name: Camlyn's Destiny
description:
Camlyn's Destiny is a boardgame for 2-4 players, developed by Caleb Ferling and Scott Holgate. Players fight for control in the land of Camlyn. To achieve this goal they have to balance their economy, make and break alliances, and wage war. Each player has a realm. He sets taxes to collect money and keep his realm alive, forms armies, and tries to keep his barony alive and his realm's people happy.

Game Components:
1 Game Board
1 Rulebook
60 Battlecards
20 '1' King's Note Bills
10 '5' King's Note Bills
1 Production Die
1 Mercenary Die
1 Economy Die
2 10-sided dice
30 Red Chips
30 Black Chips
20 Purple Chips
12 Crusader Chips
24 Kingdom Status Chips
10 Wood Production Chips
10 Iron Production Chips
8 Stone Production Chips
24 Knight Tokens
24 Archer Tokens
24 Swordsmen Tokens
24 Peasant Tokens
24 Catapult Tokens

name: Black Stories: Spiel 2018 Edition
description:
A promo pack with five Black Stories. It is contained in the Deutscher Spielepreis 2018 Goodie Box and was also given out at SPIEL 2018 for free at moses. Verlag GmbH's booth.
The promo stories feature art previously released in other Black Stories editions, but the text is new. Thematically, the five stories are about the SPIEL fair at Essen.

Black Stories are tricky, morbid, sinister riddle stories. The players try to reconstruct the particulars of each incident, piece by piece, by asking yes-or-no-questions.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Humor, Murder/Mystery, Party Game

name: ç¡è¯åäºº (Darkminded Merchants)
description:
Whoever in Darkminded Merchants is most conscienceless, most unscrupulous will make the most money and win the game? Using "fresh" tofu as substitutes in your dishes? Putting unsavory sauces in the shrimp? Adding plasticizers to the drinks? If you can be this darkminded, you might just win the game.

In this war between businessmen, you must see through the black-hearted tactics of others while also being able to reap the maximum benefits possible from a time of crisis to dominate the industry and prove that your heart is the blackest of all.

name: Mother Sheep: The Wolf
description: This expansion includes a single tile labeled "The Wolf." A player may, by capturing the wolf (in sheep's clothing), then capture any of the other sheep in its place.

name: Weird but True!: The Game
description:
Weird but True!: The Game is a trivia game for 2 to 5 players aged 8 years and up. Based on the National Geographic Kids app and book series, players take turns reading wild facts from over 200 questions for everyone to discuss, debate, and decide the correct answer.

Each player gets a chance to answer every question for the chance to move ahead on the spiral game board. Some questions allow for multiple winners; others only allow one winner. The first to the Winner's Circle wins.

There are five categories of questions, including:

Fact & Fiction compares two seemingly unlikely facts for the players to determine which is true.
Brain Blitz is a timed elimination challenge for each player to name items from a given topic without hesitating or repeating one already mentioned.
What's Your Number? seeks for each player to guess as close as possible to an outrageous number included in a fact.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Monster Hero Academy
description:
Welcome to Monster Hero Academy! In this 30-minute game for 2-6 players, you and your friends play as academy teachers. You will select the best student to partake in a major test every season and gain reputation as they excel in it. Gain the most reputation by the end of the year, and you'll be crowned the Teacher of the Year!

Monster Hero Academy features a drafting mechanism in which each player chooses the best student to represent him. Players also guide their chosen students with numbered cards, which determine the score to earn the rewards in every test. But choose wisely as the numbered cards you select each turn will be removed from the game!

name: Dinobones
description:
From the box:
The bones have been uncovered. Time to build the dinosaur. Race around board collecting bones to build the dinosaur puzzle. Every time you place a bone you receive a score equal to the total number of bones played. Hang on to your bones for a higher score, but in doing so you risk losing them to another player who is hot on your heels.

1 to 4 players represented by a dinosaur pawn. There are 14 bones spaces with matching bones and scoring markers from 1 to 14.

When it is your turn you roll a die and move in the direction your pawn is facing. Depending on the space you land you can take a different action.
- Find bone can pick up a bone on the space, At the beginning of the turn, can play a bone for the next number score marker. You do not have to play a bone you have, can keep for future play.
- Bonus space – can play a bone for the next number marked and pick up a bonus marker worth 5 points.
- Lose bone – replace on map in the matching space
- Go to any bone change direction
- If you land on another players marker you may take one of his bones he has not played into the puzzle.

When all bones have been played sum all scoring and bonus markers for high score.
publishers: Random House, Inc., RoseArt, Warren Company

name: Red Christmas
description:
From the Back cover of the game:
Given a small but desperate force and the knowledge that America's future is on the line, can you maintain control of the underground Cheyenne Mountain Air Force Base long enough for a relief force to arrive from Ft. Carson? If not, it might just be a ... Red Christmas!!!
In Red Christmas, the Russian player starts the game with a fixed strength force composed of Regular Army and elite Spetsnaz troops. The Spetsnatz troops are ready to use their nuclear moles to get behind the blast doors and into the core of the complex. The Regular Army units make up a rearguard force that must stall a continuously growing American force approaching from nearby Ft. Carson. Inside the complex itself, a smaller American force anxiously awaits the arrival of the Russian nuclear moles. It's a race against time as the Russian forces try to get inside and secure the complex before the American relief force can save the day.

This Zip-Lock game contains:
A full color 22x34" mapsheet
352 back printed 5/8" counters
52 event cards
A Play booklet
An Order of Battle card
A Cheyenne Mountain A.F.B. Fact Sheet

Time scale:
10 minutes per game turn
Unit scale:
Squad level infantry, platoon level mechanized units
Map scale:
1" = 75' ft. within the complex
suitable for solitaire play
mechanics: Area Movement, Point to Point Movement

name: Flurry!
description:
Flurry! The Ultimate Game of Race and Chase

Race to get all five of your markers around the board into the home spaces before your opponent does.

Instead of rolling dice, you draw from a deck of 162 cards. You choose which card to play from your hand and move your pieces the number indicated on the card. You can knock your opponent back to start, trade places with them, or play as teams if you have four players.

name: Worm Derby
description: Work Derby is a game of worms racing through a changing maze of obstacles, around a distant pylon and back to the starting line. It is a game for James Kyle's piecepack system. A worm is a line of six piecepack coins, where movement is done by taking coins from one end of the worm and adding them back to the other end, similar to Alex Randolph's game Wurmeln. Movement and moving obstacles are control by die rolls.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Dice, Maze, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Think: Logik Trainer
description:
This is one of the the Ravensburger "Think" games, a brainteaser/mental exercise game-series.
These games are good for mental training, e.g. in creativity, concentration, imagination, logic and so on.

name: Petcha Didn't Know
description:
From the publisher's web site:

The pet trivia game with a puzzling twist!

Get to know our friends in the pet world as you race your human friends to complete your jigsaw puzzle in this question and answer game.
