The categories of Birds & Fish, Cats, Dogs, Horses, Reptiles & Amphibians, and Small Animals are packed with information that we Petcha Didn’t Know! True or false: a frog can breathe through its skin. If you said “true” you get to add a piece to your puzzle. Some easier questions are designated especially for younger pups.

For 2 to 5 Players

No. 6613
Ages 6 & Up

name: Monopoly: Kassel
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Kassel, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Fotoleo
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Say cheese! Lion, giraffe, or zebra? As wildlife photographers in Fotoleo, players are sent out on mission after mission to photograph new animals. Who will be the first to find the right animal?

name: Tic Tac Toe Times 10
description:
The playing board consists of nine individual games of Tic Tac Toe which are played with small cards. However, each of these nine games is in itself a square within one Master Game. Thus, when a player wins an individual game, he or she will also be winning one of the large squares in the 10th or Master Game.


In Tic Tac Toe Times 10 each cell of the 3x3 grid of the master-game is broken into a 3x3 grid for a mini-game of Tic-Tac-Toe. You play each mini-game of Tic-Tac-Toe normally to try and win that cell in the Master grid.

There is a twist to normal Tic-Tac-Toe play however. The first player can place their piece in any of the 91 min-board squares on the board. After that each player must move to the mini-game which their opponent sends them.


So if the first player plays in the top right square of one of the 9 mini-games, then the opponent must play their move in the minigame in the top right Master cell. Subsequent play follows the same rule.



There are two exceptions to this however for which you get an open turn and you may place your piece on any tile you like.



Your opponent sends you to a tile that has already been won (either by you or them).
Your opponent sends you to a tile which is full, and hence a tie.



Winning Condition

The first player to win 3 cells in a row in the Master game wins.

Contents:
Playing board
39 small "X"
39 small "O"
9 large "X"
9 Large "O"
(Instructions printed in boxtop)

name: Trivial Pursuit: The Vintage Years
description: This stand-alone Trivial Pursuit spin-off features questions covering the 1920's through the 1950's in six categories: Products & Progress, Entertainment, History, Personalities, Sports & Leisure, and Wild Card.

name: Sorry! Spider-Man 3
description: This is a re-theme of the classic game, "Sorry!" Based loosely on the movie, you can play as Spiderman, New Goblin, Sandman, or Venom. The cards have been altered from the original game to give additional options, including many cards that will only help certain players (if those players happen to draw them).
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Monster Mash
description: Monster Mash requires players to match monster color or card color or monster type before other players. Be the first to grab the squishy monster in the middle of the table, and you win the round, which allows you to add cards to your opponent's hand. Whoever first rids themselves of cards wins!

name: Clades
description:
A "clade" is a branch of the evolutionary family tree such as mammals, arthropods, and sauropsids that are thought to have evolved from a common ancestor.

In Clades, players must quickly scan an array of cards on the table — along with their own private card — to make triples as quickly as possible. Whoever spots the most triples wins.

name: Cranium Matching Madness
description:
In this game, you vie to be the first to play all your cards. The game components consist of a deck of 81 cards, each with a different combination of shape, number, pattern and color.

Each player is dealt 7 cards, and one card is placed face up. One player rolls the die and the each player tries to be the first to play a card, matching the trait that the die indicates. The player who played the card takes the die and rolls it. The first player to run out of cards wins the hand. The first player to win two hands wins the game.

name: Happy Holidays!
description:
Happy Holidays is a small-box, kid-friendly party game about giving good gifts and horrible gifts.

-The game takes place in rounds. Each round, one player is the Gift-Recipient and the others are Gift-Givers.

-The Gift-Givers submit cards from their hands with gifts on them.

-The Gift-Recipient chooses which gift she likes most and which she likes least, and the players who submitted them keep those cards as points.

-First player to 5 points wins.

It's a very simple game which can be played and enjoyed by anyone.

name: BEARanoia! Princess Promo
description:
A stand-alone two-player version of BEARanoia that can also be used to expand the player count of the base game to 16.

The Princess can be used as a generic Camper to up the player count in the base game, and both can be used for their alternative art.

Primarily given away as a pre-order bonus or at various conventions.

name: Metalcorps
description:
Description from the publisher (Translated):
Metalcorps is a game of cards and dice.
Players become metalcorps pilots ("mech" or "mazinguer z"), and must fight for control of the world.

Each Metalcorps has been created by corporations from different parts of the world; USA, Japan, Europe, ..

But being a pilot will not be easy, as your metalcorps will have 35 energy levels that represent the resistance of your machine, as well as use them to attach weapons and shields to your metalcorps and execute metalsofwares.

Description from the publisher:
METALCORPS es un juego de cartas y dados.

Los jugadores se convierten en pilotos de metalcorps ("mech" o "mazinguer z"), y deberán luchar por el control del mundo.
Cada Metalcorps ha sido creado por corporaciones de diferentes partes del mundo; USA, JAPON, EUROPA,..

Pero ser piloto no será fácil, pues tu metalcorps tendrá 35 niveles de energía que representa la resistencia de tu máquina, además de usarlos para acoplar armas y escudos a tu metalcorps y ejecutar metalsofwares.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Dino Dominoes
description:
No reading is required and dinosaurs rule in this dino-domino matching game for kids ages three to eight. It includes twenty-eight extra thick colorful dominoes and represents yet another fun way to improve matching skills. Children can learn color-matching, social interaction, recognition and concentration skills. These Dino Dominoes also help kids pronounce the dinosaur names.

Ages 3 - 8

name: WhatchamaDRAWit
description:
The box contains:
- a deck of cards describing objects or scenarios to draw
- an hourglass timer

Two modes of play are available:
- a competitive mode wherein one player draws a card, and the rest draw whatever is on it. The first player acts as a judge and awards the card to whomever he believes drew the "best" picture.
- a free play mode where you just draw what's on the cards and have fun.

From the publisher:

The fast-action, fun-filled drawing game.
This isn't a game that makes you draw inside the lines or asks you to draw pictures of things that exist in the real world. Big yawn. This is creativity gone wacky. Drawing gone wild. Fun gone crazy. WhatchamaDRAWit is as much fun to say as it is to play.

WhatchamaDRAWit is fun for one...or one hundred. All you need is paper, pens and your imagination...no talent required.

110 WhatchamaDRAWit cards with outrageous concoctions to imagine and draw (plus 1 How To Play card).
A 60-second timer for competitive game play
Pick a card, turn over the timer and draw--just for fun or to win.

name: With Fire and Sword: A Strategic Game of the 30 Years War
description:
From the Rules Booklet (of around '8'-pages in length):" With Fire and Sword is a game type simulation of the Thirty Years War period. From 1618 to 1648 most of Western Europe was engulfed in a brutal dynastic struggle. The game is an operational/strategic Level simulation with each turn representing one year and military units representing armies of various types and strengths." This is basically a (2) player game with (1) player having the "Habsburg" forces, while the other player has the "Anti-Habsburg"(or 'Coalition') forces. There are (3) Scenarios presented, beginning the Game at either '1618', '1630', or even '1636'. Players will need to provide their OWN '6'-sided DIE, before commencing play. This game is described as: "A medium complexity strategic game of this period of turmoil." The TROOP 'strengths' can be considered as 'hidden' since the FRONT of the 'counter' depicts ONLY that it is a TROOP, while on the REVERSE of them is the actual 'strength' denomination. The scale is given as '48'-kilometres across EACH 'Hex' and "Yearly" Game Turns. This Game was produced in either a "Plastic Baggie" form, or as a "Boxed" edition, for those that might find one of these versions.

The gamemap(of '3'-colors~BLUE, TAN, GRAY or a combination of those) depicts an area encompassing Eastern France & the 'Benelux' countries, over to mid-Poland/Hungary, and from Northern Italy up to the Baltic Coast. As is usual with the excellent production values of the fine folks at "Simulations Canada", this gamemap has plenty of useful information contained upon the 'Gamemap', such as: a 'Terrain Key'; a 'Victory Point Track'; (3)~"Resources Available" Charts(for EACH of the '3' Scenarios); an 'Event Generation' Table; 'Movement & Winter Attrition' Tables; with 'Field and Siege Combat Results' Tables. There are '200' Game counters(printed on FRONT and BACK) in quite a large variety of COLORS, such as: RED; Dark RED; BURGUNDY; BROWN; PINK; YELLOW; GREEN; BLUE; Dark BLUE; Light BLUE; TAN; GRAY and WHITE. These mainly consist of TROOP and LEADER counters, with small silhouettes for them, while there are other 'Informational'(with appropriate 'silhouettes') ones as well, such as: 'CONTROL'; 'Siege'; 'Plague'; 'Famine'; 'Barren'; 'Sacked'; 'Rebuild'; 'Game Turn'; numbered counters from '1~6'; and (2) sets of 'Victory Point Track' markers('1' SET for EACH player).

The "Sequence of Play" is as follows:
A.-Payment and Recruitment Phase:
1.-Pay Units on Map. 2.-Recruit new Units. 3.-Place new Leaders. 4.-Wounded Leaders recover.
B.-Flip 'Sacked' Markers and Remove 'Rebuilding' Markers.
C.-Event Phase: 1.Roll Yearly 'Event' and any Scenario *Special* 'Event'.
D.-Initiative Phase
E.-Movement and Combat Phase: [1st Player]
1.-Movement 2.-Field Combat 3.-Siege Combat
F.-Movement and Combat Phase: [2nd Player]~same as 1st Player.
G.-Siege Maintenance Phase
H.-Removal of 'Barren' counters placed previous year.
I.-Winter Attrition Phase
J.-Control Phase
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Jeopardy! Remote
description:
The popular television quiz show is once again duplicated in a format that allows players to signal when one is ready to respond to a challenge. Each player uses a wireless remote to respond.

The game master holds the main console and reads the answer aloud as is appears on the screen. The console notes who has signaled, keeps score and enforces a time limit to keep the game moving. Rules from the television show apply in most cases.

The Final Jeopardy round is multiple choice and wagers must be made in $100 increments.

The game also has mode to make the entire game multiple choice.
categories: Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Obnoxio
description:
From Tom Jolly's website:

The rules are simple; Put the board together as a 3x3 grid in anyway you like, as long as the 'WIN' tile is in the center of the board. Each player takes a playing piece and starts anywhere on any of the 4 edges of the board (just off the edge). You can move one space per turn. When you land on a space, you must perform the instruction on it. If you land on a space with an arrow, you must move that direction on the next turn.

The object is to be the first player to the center of the board. The various spaces you land on while you move there are meant to throw the other player or players off course.

Download the rules and board here:
http://www.silcom.com/~tomjolly/obnoxio.htm
mechanics: Modular Board, Point to Point Movement

name: Battle: The American Civil War
description: This is an updated version of the game originally published by Yaquinto Publications in 1979 and out of print since 1984. It is an abstract war game for novices and veteran gamers alike, using variable “battlefield tiles” and wooden playing pieces. Unit combat values depend on the terrain they occupy and change as they are moved. The game depends entirely on skill, with no dice used.

name: Monopoly: Lionel Postwar Era
description: This is a version of the game Monopoly based on the theme of Lionel trains (postwar era). The game has custom money based on vintage Lionel Stock Certificates, Crossing Gate and Banjo Signal Cards, and 6 Collectible Pewter Engine Tokens.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Verschwindiwutz
description:
Components: 12 pigs, 4 boards, 36 maps, 48 chips Presentation: The twelve pigs are manufactured from wood.
There are 2 variants.
In the first one, each pig is represented on three cards.
Players play a card and take the pig of the corresponding color. the player with the most piggies is the winner.
In the second variant, you also have to collect small cardboard disks,which fit in the holes on the board.
Winner is the player with the most disks at the end of the game.

name: ÐÐ¾Ð¹ Ð»ÑÐ±Ð¸Ð¼ÑÐ¹ Ð¤ÑÐ°Ð½ÐºÐµÐ½ÑÑÐµÐ¹Ð½
description:
A simple game in a small box which suites perfectly for trips or chat-ins with the guests. One of the players becomes a mad professor, others – his bachelors. All together they try to create a monster Frankenstein of different body parts (arms, legs, heads, horns, tails, etc.) The person who has made the monster first wins the round.
The game process consists of two main parts: making professors tasks and independent investigations. In the first part you have to four-flush a little and to make measured decisions about components pass, in the second part you have to consider the variants of the situation development for all parties. Finally you’ll have asoft and easy game with a short set where either everything may be computed beforehand, or you may just enjoy the game.

name: Yam's Naval
description:
LET'S ROLL AND BOARD!

OBJECTIVE : FIRE YOUR DICE AND SINK THE OTHER PIRATE SHIPS

CONTENTS:
6 dice
4 game boards
69 cannonball tokens
1 skull and crossbones token

Each player has a game board with 8 pirates, 5 cannons labelled one to five and 2 hull zones. To remain afloat, the ship’s captain must still have at least one pirate, one cannon and one hull zone. The objective is to sink your opponents’ ships by rolling dice combinations:

two of a kind (2 identical dice) wounds one pirate.
three of a kind (3 identical dice) breaks a cannon.
four of a kind (4 identical dice) damages a hull zone.

name: Zilence
description:
In Zilence, you are all survivors of the zombie apocalypse and have set up camp on the roof of a skyscraper, which is located in the middle of the game board.

Twelve flight paths start from this skyscraper, three of which are active each round as indicated by the symbol marker. Some of the paths are longer than others, some shorter, and some end up nowhere in particular. Each path begins with one of the four symbol icons and each icon has a red, a yellow, and a blue path.

Using only your eyes, your task is to scan the three active flight paths in order to find the best path, that is, the one on which you can find most of the items for which you're looking.

—description from the publisher

name: Trivial Pursuit: World Cup Edition
description: Its the Trivial Pursuit Version published for the Soccer World Cup 1998 in France. 1,800 Questions about soccer. Its not an expansion, its a full game version.
publishers: Horn Abbot Ltd., Parker Brothers, Parker Spiele

name: Marlowe
description:
There's been a murder at the Palace Hotel flophouse. Determine which of the 6 suspects is the culprit by seeing which of them have alibis. Win the game by collecting the most Clue and Statement cards against the correct suspect.

One of the first two games designed by Uwe Rosenberg.

name: Squod
description:
Guess this one can be easiest described as "Rock-Paper-Scissors" meets "Tic-Tac-Toe".

Each of the 2 (or 4 players in two teams) gets 2 pawns of each type (rock, paper, scissors). Symbols are hidden to the opponents first, but become known once the game progresses. Players move their pawns and battle other players pawns by using the rock-paper-scissor order (what a surprise! :) and try to be the first to get three pieces in a row.
publishers: Brand X Games Factory, Goliath Games

name: Photo Trek Exploration Game
description: In this Discovery Channel game, players spin the spinner and move around the board. They answer animal-related questions to earn film cards, which they then answer questions to turn into photo cards. The first person to make it home with 5 different photo cards is the winner.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Munchkin Bobblehead Edition
description:
Munchkin Bobblehead Edition is a special release for Barnes & Noble that contains both the Bobblehead and the base Munchkin game. This version also contains a translucent red d6 instead of the standard white die that comes with every other Munchkin base set.

The Munchkin Bobblehead adds a new rule to any game of Munchkin. By having him present, you are able to re-roll one die per game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Stray Thieves
description:
Stray Thieves is a very short game of stealing treasure and outwitting the other players.

A full game is completed in 5-10 minutes. Each player is given seven cards: 4 Nobles, 2 Thieves, and 1 Knight. The game also includes 6 Treasure cards. (Also included in the box is an expansion adding additional roles with other effects on the scoring and gameplay.)

The game starts with as many Treasure cards as there are players stacked in a face-down pile. Players then take turns playing a card from their hand face down on top of the stack, announcing it as one of the cards it might or might not actually be can be (Knight, Noble, or Thief).

After all players have played all their cards, the deck is flipped over and the cards are scored in order.

Thieves will take all cards played before them, unless the next card (played right after it) is a Knight. The Thief (or Knight), and all the cards taken are given to the player who played it, and then the remaining cards are scored - up to the next Thief.

A Knight by himself does not take any cards. Only Knights right after Thieves can take any cards.

Treasure and Noble cards do not have any effect, but do count toward scoring when they have been taken.

If you look at them left to right, with the bottommost treasure cards on the left, a sample game might look like this:

An example 3-player game, with Red, Blue, and Green, using K, N, T, and X to represent Knights, Nobles, Thieves, and Treasure





X

X

X

N

T

N

T

K

N

K

N

T

N

N

...




Blue's Thief is not beaten by a Knight (Green played a Noble after it) so Blue gets 5 cards.





N

T

K

N

K

N

T

N

N

...




Blue's Knight beats Red's Thief, and Blue gets 3 more cards.





N

K

N

T

N

N

...




Red's Knight does nothing. Green's Thief takes 4 cards. And so forth, until the deck is emptied.

name: The Game of Nancy
description:
The Game of Nancy is a betting, trick taking, and partially co-operative card game played with a seventy-eight card tarot deck. The game is frequently played by people of the video game universe of Dishonored (published by Bethesda Softworks). The official rules are included with the Dishonored Tarot Deck which was included as a pre-order bonus of the video game in some regions.

It is mostly co-operative in so much as it is a turn-based game in which players change teams from round to round based on which player bets they can win the most tricks with the card they have been dealt. The winner of the betting round, or the Taker, then plays against the other players to win as many elected tricks before the round's end. At the conclusion of a round, the Taker's ability to completed win the required tricks is scored and the inverse of the Taker's score is given to each of the remaining players. The player left of the previous round's Taker deals a new round and bidding begins once again.

The Game of Nancy has no set winning end score and thus, duration is unknown. The rules state that a target score should be set, and agreed upon, prior to game commencement.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Trick-taking

name: Heroes of the Maze
description:
Players move fantasy pieces through a large, circular, ever-changing, plastic maze to reach the center and battle an ogre for magic rings.

On your turn, roll 1d6 and then rotate the walls of the maze to clear a path for yourself, with the aim of reaching the center of the maze, moving as far as you want/can before moving the walls again.

The first player to defeat the ogre at the center of the maze takes his place and can then use the ogre to rampage through the maze, attacking other adventurers.

Each time you win a fight you gain a treasure ring. The winner is the first person to gain three rings.

name: Avalanche Fruit Stand
description:
from game website

Are you steady enough to work at this fun fruit stand? Spin the wheel, then use the jumbo tweezers to pick or place fruit. In Avalanche Fruit Stand players are stacking small fruit-figures on a pile with the goal to not be the one who causes it to tumble.

Includes 40 fruit counters (5 different fruits), 2 jumbo tweezers, picture spinner, and adjustable cardboard fruit stand/storage box measuring 6"L x 9.5"W x 13.75"H

name: Legion
description:
From the packaging:

"An addictive game of strategy versus risk for any number of players. Roll the dice and build your score... but learn to judge when to stop!"

The game comes in a plastic blister pack. It contains a "velveteen" dice pouch, six dice with roman numerals, a black-and-white rule book with historical notes, and a black-and-white score pad.

A turn consists of the player rolling all six dice. If he scores any points, according to a list of scoring combinations (e.g. three "D"s score 500 points), he may then set aside these and roll again, getting the chance to accumulate more points. Alternatively, he can stop rolling and keep his accumulated score. If he rolls a no-scoring throw, then he scores zero for that turn, even if he had set aside scoring dice from previous rolls. His points are then recorded, and play passes on to the next player. The game ends when someone scores 5000 points; everyone else "with a turn left" then gets a chance to better this player's score.

The historical notes claim that this is a real ancient Roman game, originating from the late republic.

As of writing, this game is being sold in museum shops in the UK, at historic sites related to ancient Rome (e.g. sites on Hadrian's Wall).

name: Horse Race
description:
A horse-racing game that uses dice for horse movement and cards for your "bets".

Summary: There is no wagering in this game. You simply gain money by the cards you have in your hand. The numbered card you have in your hand corresponds to the horse on the track (horse #2 is a 2 on the card, horse#11 is a Jack, etc.) Movement of the horse is rolled for (if you roll a 3, move horse #3 one space). Play goes on until one horse reaches the end. Whoever has the most cards in their hand of the horse that has won wins the pot.

Poker chips are needed for this game, but they are to keep track of points. At least 4 variants are needed.

Contents:

11 horses
1 deck of playing cards
2 dice and a set of rules

name: Trivial Pursuit Singles: Sports & Games
description: 600 questions about sports, computer games, and board games in a wedge-shaped storage container.
categories: Party Game, Sports, Trivia, Video Game Theme

name: Bunul gospodar
description: Another Romanian communist era Monopoly clone. In this incarnation of the game players are encouraged to buy an apartment and furnish it with various items instead of the usual properties management.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Pantomime
description:
This game of charades contains 972 Mime Cards with 6 charades on each card, an electronic timer, 2 reference cards with common charade gestures and a six sided die. Teams take turns rolling the die to determine which charade category will be acted out. Categories of charades include: movie, song, quote, play, book, and poem. Game length is determined by the number of rounds teams decide upon at the start of the game.

Additional information is provided on the cards to assist the acting player associate a song with the performer, a book with the author, a play with the playwright, and a poem with the poet.

name: Rebel Rails
description: Run the Confederate railway network as the Union army descends upon the South. Keep your important railways running by tearing up less important tracks. Make the most money and win.
categories: American Civil War, Economic, Trains, Transportation

name: Nuclear Escape
description: A game with an obvious political agenda (arms reduction) that succeeds anyway (at being an entertaining game). Each team plays either the U.S. or the U.S.S.R. with a large nuclear weapons stockpile. Most of the fun comes in the negotiations and voting. Both sides win if they succeed in reducing the nuclear stockpile, Nuclear Escape. One side can win by having less than 100 million in casualties, AND significantly more nuclear weapons than the other side and the rest of the world, Nuclear Domination. The "game" wins with massive nuclear war, Nuclear Suffering (some of humanity survives) and Nuclear Annihilation (no humans survive). Status quo is maintained (Nuclear Tension) if the world ends up on the "end of game" space with none of the other conditions having occurred. In my limited experience, the last three scenarios occur half to three-quarters of the time.

name: Camp Wanagi
description:
Camp Wanagi challenges you to be the first to make it out of a maze like forest while being chased by two hockey mask wearing psychopaths.

Along the way you'll get a chance to run into mountains, lakes, dead ends, and cabins (where you can get weapons). You'll also get a chance to trample over your friends as you race blindly to escape the scary forest.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Extrablatt
description: Players try to make the best newspaper. Note that this is not the same game as the Mosquito game Extrablatt.

name: Galeone Galeotto
description:
From the Kidult Homepage:

Enroll your pirate crew, hoist your anchor and set sail for the conquest of seas. Don’t forget to charge up your cannons to shoot down your enemies’ sails. Galeone Galeotto is a game of luck and memory.
You first have to try and pick up from the table your four pirate cards with different colors, before forming the ship crew.
Pay attention, if you pick up a pirate in a color you already have just put it back on the table... then try and recall where your enemies have put them, one never knows!
Once your crew is recruited, the whole staff is completed and you can start firing at the enemies’ galleons. You pick up cannon cards that allow you allow to hit other sails with a given color: the yellow cannon hits a yellow sail, the green cannon a green sail...
Yet you have to set the strategy and decide which galleon you want to shoot at.
Sail before the wind and... fire!

Available as pdf download on the Kidultgames Homepage.

name: UNO: The Dog
description:
Standard Uno-themed card game.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The 'Fetch' card. When this card is played, everyone has to scramble to get hold of it first. If you get it, keep it! Everyone else must draw cards.

2006 Version replaces the 'Fetch' Card with the 'Roll Over' Card. When this card is played the player who plays it chooses a player to reveal his hand to all. That player must play his hand exposed until his turn. The 'Roll Over' Card is also a wild card.

name: Vittoria
description:
Wargamer #8 included Vittoria and Albuera.

Vittoria is a simulation of the Peninsular War battle of that name. The game description for Albuera appears to apply to this companion game also.

One 17" x 22" blue on tan map, 60 red British and 51 blue French counters, played in 14 turns.

name: Southern Flank
description:
Date: August 1982
Place: Istanbul, Turkey
Southern Flank - The Battle for Istanbul
Swedish Game Production - Combat Series No. 4

Southern Flank - The Battle for Istanbul is a two player simulation which hypothesizes a Soviet/Bulgarian thrust into Turkey sometime in the troubled near future.

The game includes a 30x42cm three-color map, 130 three-color back printed die cut counters, typeset rules, charts, tables and ziplock bags for parts storage. Realism is enhanced by special rules features, such as:


Air Superiority * Four air combat zones * Two fronts for supply * Unique Terrain Effects * Concentrated and dispersed combat modes * Paratroops and armor engineers * Aircraft ECM * Optional Ankara box *


Also included are a Historical Background and Designer's Notes for your full playing enjoyment of this exciting game, which could all too easily happen in reality.

name: Die kecken Recken
description: Each player represents a knight who attempts to steal four gems from the caves of the dragon. The knight who gets four jewels first, wins the game. On the way a vicious dragon has to be conquered.

name: America in-a-Box
description: America in-a-box is a game that celebrates our great nation. Buy properties such as the Golden Gate Bridge, the Rocky Mountains, the Statue of Liberty, the Grand Canyon or Niagara Falls. Collect slices of All-American Apple Pie and trade them in for the American Dream. Land on the Liberty Bell and scoop up everything in the center of the board. Pick up $200 each time you pass Uncle Sam, but beware...you may end up in a traffic jam and lose three turns. Or worse yet, you may be audited by the IRS! Whatever happens, America in-a-box is good, healthy, American fun for family and friends
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Spectrum
description:
The objective is to move all your pieces from one side to the opposing side.
Board contains a grids of 6 colors, and you move your pieces using cards with a multi-color code.

name: Hentacle: Three's an Orgy
description:
Three's An Orgy is the second supplement for the gooey and nonsensical game, Hentacle.

This expansion expands the basic game with two new girls and their associated cards but doesn't make any drastic changes or major introductions to the game.

This set was completed with the aid of our new artist, Darkzel, whose style should compliment the previous cards well, while creating a fresh new image for the game.

Enjoy your perversity!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Monopoly: New England Patriots Collector's
description:
Experience Patriots excitement in and out of the stadium in the New England Patriots Collector's Edition of the Monopoly game. Buy, sell and trade the Patriots all-time greatest players from Tom Brady, Steve Grogan and the legendary John Hannah.

Own the most memorable games like Berry the Bears, Squish the Fish and the Snow Plow Game.

Compete to own the ultimate Patriots team in this completely customized version of the world’s best selling board game.

Dimensions: 26 × 51 × 4 cm
Ages: 8+
Players: 2-6

Pewter Tokens:

Quarterback
Linebacker
Football
Cheerleader
Patriots Helmet
Whistle
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Norwich Edition
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Norwich, in the United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Parker Brothers, Winning Moves UK Ltd.

name: Princess Sleeping Beauty
description:
In Princess Sleeping Beauty, the players portray princes hoping to awaken the sleeping princess. In order to do so properly, a prince must have three roses when he's scaled the tower to kiss her. The princes can collect a rose by rolling it on the die, or by picking one from the tower.

Ages 4-10

HABA game number 4494
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Fantasy, Novel-based

name: Zwerge
description:
This is another charming key-chain game from Haba. An unusual feature of this range of games is that the name of the game that appears on the packaging (and only the back of the packaging) is different from the name of the game in the rulebook. So while this game might be labeled as Zwerge, the rules call it Schneewitten und die sieben Zwerge (Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs).

Described as a cheeky die game for 2 dwarfs aged 4-99, the authors are Wolfgang Dirscherl (who has designed several games in this series) and Markus Nikisch. The illustrations are by Stefan Fischer.

You get 7 wooden dwarfs in 3 colours (divided 3-2-2), and a special die with spots of the 3 colours (the colour with 3 dwarfs is repeated), a side showing Snow White and a side showing the wicked witch. Players take turns rolling the die. If the die shows a coloured spot, the player takes a dwarf of that colour from the centre, or from the other player if there aren't any more of that colour in the centre. If the die shows Snow White, the player gets to take a dwarf of any colour from the centre or the other player. If the die shows the wicked witch, the player nominates a colour and both players return all dwarfs of that colour to the centre. The game ends when there are no more dwarfs in the centre and the player with the most dwarfs wins.

name: Go Ape!
description: Go Ape! adds a hilarious twist to the traditional game of Go Fish! Instead of asking other players for a card, you’ll act out the funny monkey picture on the card you want without talking! For example, if you need a card that shows a monkey covering its eyes, you’ll cover your eyes to see if another player has a card that matches. If you want a card that shows a monkey standing on one foot, you’ll stand on one foot. Collect the most monkey matches, and you’re the winner.

name: Turism
description: The game is an unlicensed and simplified clone of Monopoly themed as a touristic trip through Communist Romania that can be made by 2-6 participants. Picturesque places will be visited, and the hosts will be 25 units receiving tourist - inns, hotels - which we are sure that you will then want to visit in real life.

name: Das Taschengeld Spiel
description: Das Taschengeld Spiel is a roll-and-move game that teaches kids the value of money.
publishers: ASS Altenburger Spielkarten, Espenlaub, Schmidt Spiele

name: Ratz-Fatz ist Weihnachten
description:
This Christmas-themed game in the Ratz-Fatz series features similar games but with holiday pieces and stories. It can be combined with other editions for some of the games.

In the basic game, one person reads a story. When the name of an item appears in the text, each player tries to grab the corresponding figure. Goal is to get most items.

Expands:

Ratz-Fatz

name: Tipi
description: Players assemble a circle of tepees (tents), each made from two slotted playing cards. Dice are rolled, and players race to claim a tepee with the most matching symbols -- both inside and outside the tent! However, if an "X" (taboo!) is rolled the goal is reversed.

name: Munchkin Cthulhu 2 Kult-Mitgliedsausweis
description:
Willkommen im Klub!

Lege diesen Ausweis vor dir hin. Wann immer jemand vorbeikommt, der dieses Spiel nicht spielt, kannst du ihn einladen, deinen nächsten Zug für dich zu spielen. Willigt die Person ein, steigst du nach dem vom anderen übernommenen Zug eine Stufe auf. Du darfst der Person natürlich bei dem Zug deine munchkinmäßige Hilfe anbieten. Gib dem netten Helfer als Dank für die Aktion diese Karte – es ist jetzt seine. Du darfst nur einmal pro Spiel versuchen, diesen Ausweis einzusetzen – auch dann, wenn du mehrere dieser Kult-Mitgliedsausweise in der Tasche hast.
________________________________________________________________________

Welcome to the club!

Put this card in front of you down. Whenever someone comes along who does not play this game, you can invite him to play on your next turn for you. If the person plays your turn, get up a level. You can of course offer the person in the turn munchkinly your help. Give the nice volunteers in appreciation of the action this card - it is now his. You're only allowed once per game, try to use this card - even if you have more of these cult membership cards in your pockets.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Humor

name: Flugreisespiel
description:
Objective: be the 1st to bring 3 of your 4 planes down to the airport
merely a 'Roll and move' game with one exception:
the action 'Positionswechsel' which means 'change of position'
the more players the better because if the board is 'crowded' this action can be worked out easily
==> even if your plane(s) trail behind there's a chance to win

name: 1,000 Year Beard
description:
For many, many millennia you & your fellow Dwarves of MOUNT FUZZELBRÛSH have been on a quest to break the ancient spell of the Whisker Wizard!

"I have the longest, most majestic beard of a thousand years!
And until a beard is grown as long as my own,
No dwarf shall have no Queens or Kings... or mine any more Silver things!"

As the legend says, the wizard grew mad with jealousy over your mighty dwarven beards & the Enchanted Silver your people possessed- he so cursed the mountain with his magic. His spell clipped away your rule of the land & the wealth of the magic metal that lay beneath... but a dwarf & his/her beard should never be underestimated!

Using your own natural ability to grow a facial hair at will & some of your own “Silver Sorcery”, you now compete among the other dwarves to vanquish the Whisker Wizard's spell!

Take turns building your own 'fuzzy column' by playing cards from your hand. Cards can only be added to the Very-Bottom of your beard. Special Grooming Cards let you break some rules and even discard cards from the other dwarf's beard! The first player to grow a beard with a total of 1,000 years or more wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Math, Number, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That

name: My Love
description: MY LOVE is the exciting foreplay for all those who have newly fallen in love, intimate couples, or just anybody who has butterflies in her or his stomach! The 240 questions for HER and HIM in the areas of love, sex, and affection bring the players closer to each other and encourage them to playfully deepen their erotic knowledge together.

name: Double Spot
description: A quick two player pattern matching game using a double-sided connect-four-esque board. Each turn, players roll a die to determine what color token they can add to the board, and then try to match one of the shown 3-token patterns. The board and pattern cards are circular, and each of the tokens are double sided with two colors, creating pleasing aesthetics.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition

name: Trouble Game: Star Wars Edition
description:
The Trouble: Star Wars Edition game combines classic Trouble fun with the thrill of the Star Wars Universe. Give the bubble a pop and move around the board, following BB-8's journey on Jakku. When BB-8 shows up, everyone can move a pawn out of home for a fun and fast-paced game. Be the first player to get all 4 pawns to the finish spaces to win!

Includes plastic game unit base with Pop-O-Matic dice roller, cardboard gameboard insert, 16 plastic pawns (4 of each color), label sheet, and instructions.


Play as Rey, Kylo Ren, Finn, or Chewbacca
Rescue BB-8 in this exciting game
Classic Trouble game meets the Star Wars Universe
The first player to Home wins


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Scrabble Trap Tiles
description:
Lay hidden traps to sabotage opponents in Scrabble Trap Tiles.

This word-tile game gets an explosive twist on regular Scrabble thanks to the addition of trigger and trap tiles that set off special abilities like stealing points or removing tiles, giving clever players an advantage. Build words to score points, but beware the premium squares! A trap may have been set there, turning the game on its head.

name: Monster Crunch
description:
Each players have monsters cards with teeth. The cards can be flipped.

When a player successfully make a set, he must say crunch! He gets a point if he is correct, and lose one if wrong.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Cargo: Dead in the Water
description:
A pick-up and delivery game based on Atlantic Trade in the 17th Century. The object of the game is to ship cargo from port to port in exchange for victory points; the first to 25 victory points wins.

During your turn you draw 2 cards from the deck, move each of your ships a maximum of 5 spaces, and play any number of cards. You can also load or unload cargo at port. When the turn ends battles are resolved with a roll of the dice.

There are many different types of cards in the deck to keep the game fun and exciting. Wind cards allow you to increase ship movement. Battle cards increase your odds in battle, or can be used to escape battle altogether. There are also wild cards which allow you to adjust the value of the cargo, or summon pirates to attack an opponent.

name: Auf Achse Junior
description:
The game board depicts a city map. Each player has a plastic truck which can hold up to four goods (plastic cubes). There are also mission tiles which either ask the player to pick up pieces or to deliver them.
On a turn, a player rolls a die and moves his/her truck forward the corresponding number of fields. When a truck reaches a building, the player can load or unload goods. There is no 1 on the die, but a stop symbol. A player who rolls this symbol can move the stop sign to any street field, thus blocking the street for all trucks. Trucks can also block each other. The goal of the game is to be the first player to deliver 11 goods.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Transportation

name: Intriguing Castles
description:
A three-dimensional children games around the theme of kings, knights and sieges upon castles. The point of the game is to build the most (and longest) finished castles by the end of the game. Castle tokens are won from successful sieges of different castles throughout the game, as the king travels across the country evaluating the knights' skills. Whoever wins shall be king!

The game includes a large board with four cardboard castles (square spaces closed off with walls) with turrets, upon which ladders with differing numbers of knights are hung. The king moves on a track in the middle of the board. Different spaces on the track may indicate different castles upon which sieges will be scored. In order to score for a siege, a player must have the appropriate amount of knight tokens on the spaces under the castle walls, as well as ladders with knights. To place a ladder or token (or draw an 'intrigue' card), dice are rolled by the leading player in that turn, and each player takes off a die and resolves the appropriate action.

name: UNO: Disney Frozen II
description:
It’s the classic card game you know with a Frozen II theme! UNO Disney Frozen II features magical icy graphics from the highly anticipated sequel including the beloved characters -- Anna, Elsa, Olaf and more. The special “Forces of Nature” card lets you choose the ONLY color that may be played until your next turn (even if someone has a matching number or action card)! Just like in classic UNO, match cards by color or number and play action cards like Skip, Reverse and Wild Draw Four to shake up the competition. Score points by being the first to get rid of all the cards in your hand and don’t forget to yell “UNO!” to freeze out your competition.

—description from the publisher

name: 1876 Centennial Baseball
description:
A unique game based on the early (c. 1860-1890) days of baseball. Games can be played with generic players or with the ratings for the 1876 National League.

Game play is simple, with each player rolling a die, applying individual player modifiers for the pitcher and batter, and then consulting a chart to arrive at an outcome of the at bat. If a "hit ball" results, then another die roll comparison is made between the batter/runner and the fielder the ball is hit to.

In some cases, a play will be resolved after consulting a card that also describes an event in 19th century baseball.

The components are of high quality.

name: Passport to Culture
description:
In Passport to Culture players travel around the world map depicted on the game board, with the goal of filling their passport with stamps. Along the way players must attempt to answer questions pertaining to the diverse peoples and countries of the world.
The game's components are: a 20" x 20" game board, 370 question cards, 30 culture cards, 6 passport play cards, 60 passport stamps, 18 answer cards, 6 playing pieces, 1 six-sided die, 1 correct answers score pad, and playing instructions.

name: Cards & Punishment: Vol. 1 (fan expansion for Cards Against Humanity)
description:
Cards And Punishment is an unofficial, unauthorized, underground, black market expansion pack for the most excellent party game, Cards Against Humanity (TM).

This deck includes 35 black cards and 80 white cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: Alexander's Generals: The Diadochian Wars 323-281 B.C.
description: With the death of Alexander the Great in 323 BC, the empire he had conquered became the source of contention between the generals who had helped lead his troops to victory. You are one of these generals with various armies at your disposal. Attempt to unite Alexander's empire under your own rule.

name: Topscore
description: A Dutch game based on the now canceled TV-show "Topscore." Try to make new one-letter longer words with the letters from the last word one step higher on the pyramid. Clear the pyramid to win the game.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: Jumbo Zoo
description: Collect peanuts for your hungry baby elephant by taking part in exciting challenges. Guess in which hand your opponent is hiding the peanuts, be the first player to find the right combination of animal and color, or be the first to trumpet "Toot!" when a peanut appears on the die. But also watch out for the zoo keeper who wants to steal your precious peanuts! Who will be the first to collect a complete meal of 15 peanuts for their baby elephant?
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Gator Golf
description:
Tee up for action with this motorized golf ball gobblin' gator! His giant jaws are open wide - can you hit your ball inside? Take turns with a friend trying to putt your ball into the gator's mouth. When you hit it in, he'll flip it out as he spins wildly 'round and 'round! Who knows where your ball - and the gator's mouth - will end up? Each putt you sink is worth a point. Keep track of your score on your unique score-keeping putter. First to score 4 points is the greatest gator golfer!

Note: Updated Goliath version does not have a motorized gator unit and does not spin. It does use spring action to return the ball.
publishers: Goliath Games, Hasbro, Milton Bradley, Parker Brothers, Playskool

name: Immortal
description:
Immortal is a strategy game of warring mythologies, combining area control and card battle play. The war of the gods has begun... Born from the dreams and nightmares of mankind, mythic beings are gathering forces to crush their enemies. They have put their fate in the hands of mere mortals like yourself, granting you the power to lead them to victory. Capture your opponents’ forces, turn their powers against them, and forge your own legend!

In Immortal, ancient gods, heroes, and monsters battle for control over mythic realms. 2 to 4 players assume command of powerful pantheons summoned from world mythologies - Master Set One features the Norse, Greek, Japanese, Celtic, Egyptian, and Native American pantheons. Each pantheon of character cards offers unique abilities and strategies to be mastered. Battles take place on a battlefield created from modular board tiles, representing the nexus of mythical realms. The goal of the game is to control the most cards on the battlefield by capturing your opponents’ cards and defending your own.

During the game, players take turns placing their character cards on the spaces of the board. Each card has a distinct combination of battle strengths, represented by numbers on its four edges. When a card is placed on a space adjacent to the north, south, east, or west edge of an opponent’s card, an attack begins and the strengths on the cards’ touching edges are compared. If the attacker’s strength is greater, then the defending card is successfully captured, giving the attacking player more control over the battlefield. Special abilities can influence the results of an attack, and set the board up for future combos by strengthening allies, weakening enemies, and bending the normal rules of the game.

After the first battle, players upgrade their pantheon decks with more powerful cards, and expand the battlefield with additional modular boards. Victory goes to the player who controls the most cards at the end of two battles. Game variants allow players to form teams, change the rules of engagement, or play faster matches. Once players have mastered the basic strategies of the game, they can mix and match characters from different pantheons to build their own custom decks. As Immortal evolves, more pantheons will be added from the myths and legends of distinct cultures. These expansions will introduce new boards and cards, and new abilities and playing styles to the game.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology, Number
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Hand Management, Modular Board, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: MasterChef
description:
The official board game of the MasterChef TV Show. The players challenge to the Mystery box, Invention test, Pressure test, and have to undergo the judgment of the opponents.

Mystery box: each player has to create a dish using some ingredient cards drawn from the deck.
At the start of the challenge, they can exchange the ingredients, giving to the opponents the useless ones.
The players vote the best and the worst dish, and score points accordingly.

Invention test: each player has to create a dish using a fixed ingredient and choosing the cards by grabbing them from the middle of the table.
The players choose the ingredients simultaneously and they have to be fast to grab the best ones before the others!
The players vote and gain points like the Mystery Box.

Pressure test: the players have to guess the ingredients of a dish, looking it on a card.
The players score points according to the number of guessed ingredients.

The player with the most points will win and can wear the chef hat!
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Play Me: Alice in Wonderdice â Tea Time
description: Expansion for the dice game Play Me: Alice in Wonderdice, so you can play the original game with up to nine players.

name: Unicorn Surprise
description:
Create magical mischief with Unicorn Surprise! In this whimsical game, players are transformed into pixies on the hunt for colorful unicorn gems. The only problem – unicorns drop their Gems but once a year! Race against other cheeky pixie players to collect the most gems before the smiling sun sets. Unicorn Surprise combines board game suspense with a silly unicorn figure that pixie players can interact with. Will she drop a colored gem or a clear one signifying the end of the day? Find out when you play Unicorn Surprise!

—description from the publisher

name: Kappa Bros!
description:
Depending on the roll of the fish dice, each turn in Kappa Bros! (ã«ããåå¼), you either add more water to the plate, move the plate to another Kappa, or do both! Whoever breaks the surface tension and spills any water loses.

Kappa Bros! is an authorized reworking of KAPPA-TAN, first released by Itsuka Tanaka and ASOBI.dept.

name: Spy Fight
description: Lethal spies. Explosions. Deception. A fun, fast-paced strategy card game for 2-4 players. Each turn players draw a card to add to their hand. Your goal is to use these cards to reduce your opponents HP down to 0. With 5 different types of card you can expect each game to be filled with all sorts of combinations.

name: Triball
description:
Triball is a three player, three dimensional version of tic-tac-toe (naughts and crosses). An acrylic shell serves as the base and multi-colored balls are dropped into the grid of nine columns. The goal is simple, be the first to get three of your balls in a row.

Visit http://www.triball.co.uk for more information about this game or play an online demo there.

name: ëì§ìë (Rush Girl)
description:
Description from the publisher:

The girl who oversaw morning!

You have to get to the school quickly to avoid obstacles to school!
ëì§ìë ("Rush Girl") is a real-time game that requires fast pace and awareness.


All cards are mixed well and divided into 7 cards.
At this time, players should not look at the cards they have received.

Place a 'safe' card in the reach of everyone.
Pick one of the remaining cards at random and put the safe card
Leave it aside. (In case of 5-player play, one card is left.)

Take the card you received at the same time in your hand.
The game is played in real time.
Check the last obstacle!
Check the card in your hand!
If you can fix it, shout out the next obstacle!
Only the first card you put on the old card is accepted.

name: Casanova
description:
Venice, Italy , 1756. Casanova has escaped from the dungeon! Some italian ladies in love plus their chambermaids start a search to rescue the fugitive from the bloodhounds of the doge.

Casanova has disguised himself with women's attire (a pin is inserted into one of ten pairs of women playing pieces - it can only be felt or seen from the underside of the playing pieces). It is the task of the players to secretly figure out, under which pair of women Casanova hides, to get him into the player's palazzo via a gondola, and finally to bribe the doge to make sure Casanova can escape into freedom.

1 playing board
10 plastic figures
1 Casanova marking pin
12 plastic gondolas
5 colored necklaces (in fact small metal rings)
5 jewellery cards

name: Bible Mad Gab
description:
Laugh yourself silly solving these puzzles based upon the Bible.

It may seem like you’re in the Tower of Babel, but remember, “It’s Not What You SAY, It’s What You HEAR!®” Read a group of simple words aloud, like: “Know Ozark.” Do you “hear” what I hear? Quick, your team has 30 seconds to sound out 3 puzzles! Did you hear yourself say “Noah’s Ark?” All puzzles are fully referenced from the New International Version of the Bible. This game is so much fun you’ll want to play for 40 days and 40 nights!

name: Guet-Apens
description: Guet-Apens is a medieval wargame. It contains quite heavy simulation rules for knights, soldiers, bowmen, etc... and a book of 12 scenarios.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Banditos
description:
Players earn their money by making Bandito raids.

At the start, all the Banditos are four miles away from the banks. Mile cards are played in turn order so as to reduce that distance. The player who places the appropriate "4" mile card is finally able to rob a bank and get the dollars it holds. But you won't always have the necessary matching cards needed to reach that goal. Then, small gifts of money to the other players will help the right cards to come your way.

At the end of the game, the player who makes off with the most dollars wins.

name: Crush! The Dice Game
description: The saying goes that a good vintage deserves good company to share it with. The same can be said about Crush! The Dice Game. In Crush, players take turns rolling special vino dice to try and score points. Each round a player must weigh the risk between banking their points or rolling again for even more points. If you roll and do not increase your score, you've been Crushed! The first player to bank 5,000 points wins.For 2 or more players, ages 18 and up. (Official product description)

name: Convoluted
description:
Convoluted - it sounds complicated. But it isn't.

Convoluted is a card game that can be picked up in minutes and then enjoyed for hours. Complete the word 'Convoluted' while using action cards to disrupt your opponents. Why not steal their best cards? Or just destroy anything you don't like the look of. To throw a spanner in the works take some cards from play, shuffle them and deal them back out at random.

Play as nicely as you like but if you have a mean streak it might just help you win. Play with two to four players or shuffle together multiple copies of the game to play with even more people.

name: 10,000 in My Pocket
description:
10,000 in my Pocket is a print-and-play solo game. It was inspired by Zombie in my Pocket, designed by Jeremiah Lee.
10,000 in my Pocket: It is the estimated number of Persian soldiers from the Achaemenid Empire who threaten your kingdom. Sparta is in danger and its troops are already fighting another battle. You are a Hero and you must save your city. How ? First enroll the bravest men of the city and then go to Athena's Temple. There you'll be given the White Sword, a lengendary weapon to give heart to your troops while there are so few of you and the enemy is so numerous. Try to get some Favors from the Gods. Eventually leave the city to the Black Mountains, and find a place called « The Throne ». That is the lair where the Persians are hiding. And now the hardest is to come: defeat the enemy!

10,000 in my Pocket is played with Event cards on an easy-to-make modular board, ensuring you that all the games are different. Will you manage to save your city from the enemy?
categories: Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play
mechanics: Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Colomino
description:
You and your opponents take turns placing multi-colored tiles on the board, arranging them so that their colors match the colors of neighboring tiles. If you use strategic planning, you can block out areas where you can score with a three-sided or four-sided match. When you think you've built up a large enough score, you can race to the finish by playing tiles that connect the two opposite sides of the board.

Colomino was published in the Ravensburger Casino Series.

name: Draw Something Party
description: One person draws an image on a special see-through, glowing handheld device while their team tries to guess the answer using the picture and the list of letters on the back of the word card. One "coin" is awarded for guessing the card within the time limit. Teams alternate drawing and guessing until one team earns 15 coins.

name: PolÃ©mique
description:
Party game where controversy (polémique) is inherent, welcome and, even, provoked.

Each player is given three cards: one I agree, one I disagree and one question mark card.

In turn, each player draws an affirmation card, reads it aloud and tells everyone if (s)he is in agreement with it, paying attention to the other players' reaction. Then, each player choose, without lying, the card that describes best his opinion of the affirmation (I agree or I disagree). The question mark card is used to hide the chosen card. The player who read the card then choose three players and tries to guess their opinion. Each good guess earns him one token.

name: Master of Television
description:
From the publisher homepage:

MASTER OF TELEVISION
This is the perfect board game about the box! So turn off the telly and turn on the fun in this fast-paced game, where your knowledge of the biggest and the best series of Television are at stake. Stop fighting about the remote control – Fight to become the Master of Television.

Background
THE ULTIMATE TRIVIA GAME FOR EVERYONE WHO LOVES TELEVISION.
In MASTER OF TELEVISION it’s all about how well you know the famous series of the television – You have to know a little about a lot – From "Friends" to "Big Brother". From "McCloud" to "The Eurovision Song Contest", everything can show up on your "screen".
You play to become MASTER OF TELEVISION. The 8 categories cover Drama, Comedy, Shows, even gossip, scandals, strange TV-facts and much much more.
At the very end it comes down to a memorable Quote from a famous TV Series – Who said it and in what series.
MASTER OF TELEVISION is fun, exiting, entertaining and you can never predict how it ends.
MASTER OF TELEVISION can be played by everyone – age is no limitation.

Gameplay
Just like any good night in front of the television MASTER OF TELEVISION entertains from the moment you open the box. You’re ready to play right away, without complicated rules or introductions. You simply play your way through 7 of the 8 categories and when you’ve gathered 7 "Flat Screens", you’re going to face the final question – Recognizing a quote from a TV series and you have to tell your fellow players which TV Quote originated from what TV Series. Then you’ve earned the title MASTER OF TELEVISION.
MASTER OF TELEVISION guarantee you the best TV night without TV.

MASTER OF TELEVISION is the second game in a series of games with the title "Master of….". Next games will be "Master of Music" and "Master of Sports" – More to come…

name: Der Kleine Prinz
description:
"One sees well only with the heart. What is essential is invisible to the eyes."

Game Idea
"Tame me", said the fox to the Little Prince. "What is tame?", the Little Prince asked? "To Tame means to make themselves familiar, to establish ties", answered the fox. Completely in the sense of Saint Exuperys' poetic world of thought the participants make themselves familiar with each other in this game. Can you guess the secret desires of your fellow players? Did you see the fantasy behind the obvious things? Can you draw the favorite hiding place of your childhood? By the fulfillment of the different tasks the Little Prince travels from Planet to Planet and as reward the players may set stars in the sky. When a player fails at their task, the fox moves farther away towards his home.

Goal of the Game
If the Little Prince and the fox meet on the earth, the players succeed, and the winner is the player who could bring the most stars to the sky. On the other hand, if the Little Prince does not reach the fox, because it disappeared into its home, all players lose, since they failed to tame the fox.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Novel-based, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Line Drawing, Memory, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Recognition, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Voting

name: Fitz
description: A game of strategy and chance that you'll play again and again. You try to fill in a square with tiles of various shapes and sizes, but you must depend on the roll of the die to tell you which tiles you can use. Fit your tiles into your square as you receive them, or save them for later use. But be careful. Another player may steal a valuable tile from you and really give you Fitz! For two to four players, Ages 8 and up

name: Where's Waldo? Waldo Watcher Card Game
description: Players watch for Waldo as cards are played face up into the center of the table. They hurry to be the first to slap down their "I Found Waldo" cards when they spot him. They then cross off one of the letters in "WALDO" on the score pad. Cross them all off and you win the game.

name: Mico
description:
This game is played with 2 or more players, and 1 or more standard decks of cards.

After shuffling the cards, one card must be hidden. Then each player receives 9 cards, and the remaining cards forms the stack. Each player must try to make combinations of 3 cards, either 3 of the same number, or 3 cards in sequence. The combinations must be discarded. After make all possible combinations with the cards in hand, the players must take cards of the stack in order to make new combinations. All players can play simultaneously; there is no order of play.

When the stack run out of cards, the players, starting with the dealer and continuing in clockwise order, take cards of the player to the right (without see the cards of the player).

At the end, one player will remain with the last card in hand, and this card must be the same of the card hidden at the start (if not, somebody have make a mistake). This player is the winner.

name: Life As A Blackman
description: Life as a Blackman is a game with a political message: It's harder than you think to be young and black. Players all start as 18-year-old black males either in Glamourwood, Black University, the Military, or in the Ghetto. Through die rolls, players work their way through the randomly selected starting areas and into Downtown, an approximation of life in the real world. Players may find themselves going to Church to right past wrongs, or spend time in Prison for making bad decisions. The first person to reach the Freedom space at the top of the board wins.

name: VCR College Bowl Game
description:
Players roll dice to determine yardage and results are determined by "Play Action Cards" or Video Cassette

From the box:
See plays of your favorite teams. Enjoy hours of fast-paced college football action, the CFA College Bowl game includes hundreds of exciting plays of your favorite college teams nationwide on a VHS video cassette. Enjoy the thrill and rivalry inherent in college football. You interact utilizing 120 actual plays each game making crucial decisions such as whether to punt the ball or go for a field goal, and declining or accepting penalties. This is the most realistic football game ever. Pick your opponent and let's play VCR College Bowl Game.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Zippidy Zoo
description:
Be an animal at the zoo!

4 Baby-elephants, -tigers, -bears and baby parrots are lost in the huge zoo and far from home. If you are the first to bring these babies home, then you will win the game! Wind your way through the zoo maze. Take short cuts on boats, bridges, and trolleys-whenever you can!

The game board consists of separate pieces that can be put together differently every time. And so every game is different because the game board constantly changes. Also
contains animal playing pieces, animal baby tokens and a spinner. For 2-6 players.

name: The Exciting New Game of the Kennedys
description:
In the Exciting Game of the Kennedys, players each assume the role of one member of the Kennedy clan and strive with each other in a contest for national prominence.

Game equipment includes:

6 pawns
2 dice
72 Turn of Events cards
36 Category cards
36 Official Blank cards
Instruction sheet
game board
play money


The earlier "Harrison and Winter" version of the game features a more prototypical looking game board (fewer colors, less artwork) and cards with uncut corners. When Transco bought the rights to the game, they upgraded the board art and slightly upgraded the cards.
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Wie Du Mir...
description: Players roll a die and move that many spaces along a track. Spaces indicate that a player either collect or pay a certain number of chips, or draw and execute an action from a deck of cards. The twist is that you can move any pawn, not just your own, and if a player goes over 10 chips he loses all but 4 of them. Winner is the player with the most chips after all pawns complete the track. And just because you've reached the goal, do not assume your chips or pawns are safe from the random action cards! A very quick game, short on tactics, but long on being mean to your fellow players.

name: 100 Acre Wood Stamp Game
description:
Based on Disney's Winnie the Pooh this game consists of a board representing the Hundred Acre Wood, six rubber stamps of each of Pooh's friends and a deck of cards. Players draw cards to determine movement around the board. If they land on one of Pooh's friends houses they get to put that stamp on the appropriate spot on their score sheet. The score sheet is set up like tic-tac-toe with each of the nine squares designated for a certain stamp. The first player to get three stamps in a row wins.

Fun for all ages. The stamps are also fun to use on other things as well.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Babylon
description:
Babylon is a game, played in a 5x5 grid, in which two players use limited resources to build lines of towers, aiming to achieve a certain pattern in which the towers are built.

Players take turns to place one of their discs to start 3-disc-high towers, which must be built with the biggest disc at the bottom and the smallest at the top. Players may place their discs onto their opponent's. Alternatively, players can take their turns to move a tower or the top part of it to another position if the tower's topmost piece is theirs.

The goal of the game is to build and move the towers such that a line (vertical, horizontal, or diagonal) of three towers exists, in which a player has his or her disc in the middle section of the center tower, one top disc at one end of the line, and one bottom disc at the other end. When a player has achieved such a configuration, he or she wins the game.

name: Landwehr 1438
description: Tactical, topological tile game. It's set in medieval Northern Germany where four merchants set off to sell their goods in other towns and have to discover the safest and shortest roads for themselves, thereby avoiding many obstacles and roughness.

name: Spartanopoly
description:
A Monopoly variant using locations in East Lansing, Michigan instead of Atlantic City. Tokens are wood "text books". Houses & hotels are red and white plastic push pin tops. Chance & Community Chest cards are replaced with "Contingency" and "Campus Mail" cards.

The board is identical to Monopoly except for Park Place ("The Union", in this case) is swapped with the Chance space adjacent to it. Other differences are: the colors are switched around for many properties, the price of the dark purple properties is $80 instead of $60, and Vandervoort Sporting Goods (Vermont Ave.) is $120 instead of $100 (most likely an error by Late for the Sky).
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Clutch Football
description:
Clutch Football is a very simple basic football game. Players use a deck of cards (116) and specialty decks for field goals, punts and returns. There is some hand management involved as basically, the offense shows a play result and the defense can then respond with a card negating the play. This continues a the marker moves down the field.

Published in Maine by Maine-ly Games in Biddeford, ME. The designer originally worked on the game while he served with the Air Force in West Pakistan (1968 to 69)

name: Ewoks Save The Trees!
description:
Phlog monsters have come to chop down and steal the Ewoks trees. The players act as young Ewoks, racing to warn the village elders.

This Star Wars track game takes place on a 3-D game board depicting the forests of Endor. To move, you turn either one of two dials and check the window next to it. If it shows a color, move ahead to the next empty space of that color. If you dial a hole, you may open or close either of the two secret doors (representing the Phlogs) to block or unblock a path, and then dial again. If your path is blocked by a Phlog or secret door, you must move backwards to the color you dialed. Sometimes when you dial, you'll open up one or more mud holes. Players falling into a mud hole must move back two spaces. The first player to reach the top step of the tree house and enter the door (which you must dial to open) warns the village elders of the monster assault and wins the game.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Infinifield
description:
In every round one player builds a playing field from 24 blocks of different length. Each player gets a pawn and chooses a starting position. Then players take turns moving their pawns from block to any adjoining block, trying to capture opponents by going onto the same block with them, until only one player remains on the field.

Every five turns one player chooses a block to remove from the playing field, so the field is reconfigured throughout the game (because fewer and fewer blocks remain). This ensures that the game never ends in a draw and provides additional strategy opportunities. The game set includes an extra pawn and a move counter to help keep track of who makes every fifth move.

There are no random events in the game, the outcome is entirely based on players' skill.

The rules specify some restrictions for building the playing field to prevent the person who constructs it from gaining an unfair advantage.

name: Marvel Comics Super-Heroes Card Game
description:
This trick taking card game is basically a variant of Old Maid with a Marvel Universe theme tacked on. Deck contains 19 pairs of Heroes (including Spiderman, Captain America and Daredevil) and 1 Dr Doom on oversize cards. Like Old Maid, you draw a card from another player and try to match it to a hero in your hand. Match and discard. First to discard all of their heroes wins; if you're stuck with Dr Doom, you lose.
The best reason to have this game is that the Heroes are drawn by such artists as John Romita Sr, Jack Kirby and John Buscema.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip

name: Mega Raider
description:
From the promotional blurb:

"Wealth and power beyond your wildest dreams are yours...by building a fortune in companies and cash. Outwit and out bluff other players when you secretly bid to takeover their companies. Top secret information and late-breaking news add to the excitement."

Contents:
board, 2 dice, 6 player tokens, spinner, bid forms, play money, rules, stock cards, and event cards.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Over-n-Out
description:
According to Sid Sackson's a Gamut of Games:

Players secretly place fifteen numbered cylinders into holes. Then in turn they lift one of the opponent's cylinders, returning it if not a 1. When a 1 is found the player continues and looks for a 2, etc.

This game is part of the Hi-Q series

name: Pretwa
description: A traditional game from Bihar, India. It's played on a circular grid; players may move along the circles or along the lines connecting them. Opposing pieces may be captured by jumping them, and multiple captures may be made on a turn, even in different directions. Cspturing is compulsory but a player does not have to maximize their captures.

name: Wild Cards
description: A hilarious children’s game with cards, in which you search for differences and similarities. Each player is dealt three cards. A roll of the die shows the amount of differences to be found in the cards. For example, if the die shows number 2, you try to find 2 differences in your cards – as quickly as you can. The codes at the back of the cards reveal whether you have found a matching pair or not. If you have, place them aside and continue with new cards. The winner of this funny and frantic game is the player who finds the most matching pairs!

name: Mini-Mercado
description:
A classic Majora game, probably first published in the sixties and remaining in print until the eighties.
The object of the game is to purchase all the items on a player's shopping list by heading to the appropriate section in the supermarket. The game intends to familiarize children with the advent of supermarkets.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Tumble Bug
description:
ORIGINAL BOX: 22 ½” x 6” x 3 ½”

“The unpredictable…
TUMBLEBUG
sensational race”

The tumblebugs are individually colored, small capsule-shaped objects about 1” high with a small mobile lead weight inside. The game components, apart from the lead weights and scoreboard/instruction sheet, are composed entirely of plastic. The ‘gameboard’ consists of a gently meandering 4-laned track which is almost 2’ long. The track is raised at one end by a 5” high stand. Above the stand is a starting gate which holds the tumblebugs prior to release. A finishing gate located at the other end of the track is designed to shut as the first tumblebug passes, preventing the remaining ones from reaching the finish. The edges of the interior lanes are incomplete, allowing the tumblebugs to change lanes randomly.

Before the tumblebugs are released, each player tries to predict which color will reach the finishing gate first. The first player to guess five results correctly is the winner.

(N.B. game was re-released in the early 1970s in a smaller box with the distinctive string handle favored by Schaper during this phase of their history. The track came in pieces and required assembly).

name: Fire Drill
description:
