In Fire Drill, each player takes turns placing one of their pieces on any square on the board. The only limitation is that each piece must be at least one square away from a piece of the same color. Once all the pieces have been placed on the board, the starting player chooses any of his pieces to move. Play then alternates between opponents, each moving one of their own pieces. Pieces are moved in the fashion of the robots in Ricochet Robots. A piece travels in a straight line until it hits a wall or another piece, at which time it can turn left, right, or stop. A piece may make any number of turns and travel any distance in a turn, but once it stops, play proceeds to the next player.

The first player to align four of his pieces in a row orthogonally wins.

name: Eastern Front (fan expansion for Axis & Allies: Europe)
description: This is an unauthorized expansion and variant kit for Axis & Allies: Europe: It contains additional plastic playing pieces plus an expansion including technology development, special historical rules, Italian and Axis minor special forces, marines, panzers, and more.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Modern Warfare, Wargame, World War II

name: Affenstark
description: Bausack light for kids. Roll a die. Place one or two wooden bananas on a pile of bananas which are held by Carla (bigger monkey) or do nothing or place Alfons (smaller monkey) on top the banana pile. If you can manage it you’ll get 2 victory points, if not (pile crashes) you’ll lose one. First one with 9 VP wins.

name: The Book Game
description:
"The Book Game" consists of 4000 questions and answers (1000 designed especially for children) taken from "The Book" (a version of the Bible).

A "Question & Answer" game (ala Trivial Pursuit). Correctly answer a question and advance your pawn one space. Be the first to reach the "Finish" space by advancing your pawn seven spaces. On your turn, instead of answering a question to advance your pawn, you may choose to "block" an opponent by correctly answering a question. Blocks are removed by correctly answering questions. Advancement only occurs if a pawn is not "blocked."

Questions are divided into two sets: The Old and New Testaments. A die roll (50-50 chance) determines which set of questions a question is drawn from on your turn.

name: Colorful Ottokar
description: Each player tries to be the first to thread his disks onto Ottokar the Octopus. The one who does this most quickly wins.

name: Asterix & Obelix: Die Lorbeeren des Caesar
description:
'Explore Europe' (aka Europareise} meets 'Malefiz' - two (almost) classic German games combined to form an Asterix travel game across Europe.
Players have to visit 5 locations before they can pick up Caesar’s laurels in Rome. Before they can deliver them to their village they have to visit another 5 locations. Blocking pieces simulate the 'evil Romans'.

name: Alpha Brik
description: This abstract strategy game plays on 9x9 black and white board. Each players control 3 peons which can be displaced in straight line according to the result of a single dice roll. The object of the game is to capture bricks located on the center or bricks which have already been collected and placed at the opponent’s side, of the board and bring them back on his own side of the board. In addition to collection bricks, one's peons can be used to directly attack his opponent’s peons, with the effect of sending back the attacked peon in on his originating camp.

name: Music Maestro
description: This is a game that lets a person learn about the musical instruments of the West. It has five different games for various age ranges, ranging from 4 years to adult.

name: 20 Questions: Nature and Science
description:
20 Questions Nature and Science Edition challenges players to guess well-known Animals, Vegetables, Minerals and Natural Wonders.

Everyone plays on every turn, as fun and factual clues reveal mystery topics from the exciting world of nature and science. The goal is to figure out the mystery topic in the fewest number of clues, but watch out - clues can be deceiving!

name: Dave Garroway's Today Game
description:
The players take on the role of television show producer vying to book the best guests for television’s “The Today Show”. The deck is divided into four suits. Each suit represents a category of guest. Each suit has cards valued one through twelve; one being the greatest value and twelve having the least value. There are also four wild cards, valued at thirteen, to bring the total number of cards in the deck to fifty-two.

All players place their pawns on the start space. Each player chooses a card secretly. All players reveal their chosen cards simultaneously. The player who played the highest valued card gets to advance one’s own pawn the number of spaces equal to value of the winning card. The rules do not state what happens if two or more players tie. If two or more players play wild cards, there is no winner and the hand is replayed.

Certain spaces on the track assign a player who happens to land on them a personal trump suit. This trump stays in effect until the player moves on.

The hand is over when someone lands on the “Off the Air” space at the end of the track. The value of the cards remaining in the hand of the players is totaled and added to the score of the player who ended the round. All players receive the value of the cards in tricks each has taken. The first player to score five hundred points is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Television Empire
description:
The aim of Television Empire is to build your own Television Network, buying resources and earning ratings, until your network has achieved supremacy.

From the publisher's website:

Choose the Shows... Build a Network...
Create the ULTIMATE Television Empire.

So you don't like what's on TV these days?
Think you could do a better job?

Well here's the chance to do it your way...

Television Empire is an exciting game of strategy and skill for 2-6 players. Compete to secure hit shows, hire trustworthy anchors and build network ratings.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Kock 1939
description:
The battle took place from October 2 through October 5, 1939 in eastern Poland. It was the last battle of the 1939 invasion of Poland and was fought between the the Polish Independent Operational Group 'Polesie' and the German XIV Motorized Corps.


Wikipedia: Battle of Kock

name: The Transformers Card Game
description:
The Transformers Card Game consists of four games using a 36-card deck containing 18 Autobots and 18 Decepticons. The following are the four games that can be played and a brief summaryof each:

1.)The Transformers Truth Game: The object is to get rid of all your card by placing two, three or four cards on the table and declaring that they are all the same numbered card. If any opponent thinks you are bluffing then he declares this. The player than shows the cards. If the player lied than he takes all the cards. However, if he was telling the truth then the opponent takes all the cards.

2.)Robot Battle: This game is played like the game "War" where you want to be the one with all the cards at the end.

3.)The Transformers Brainpower: This is a matching game where all cards are placed face down on the table and then two cards are flipped. If they are the same, then the player takes the pair and goes again. However, if the cards are different then the players turn is over. The player with the greatest number of pairs wins.

4.)The Transformers Shout: In this game, each player flips over cards one at a time. When a card is duplicated, the first person to spot this and yell "transformers" gets all the cards on then table. This continues until one player has no cards. At that time, the player with the most cards is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Prost
description:
Prost is a funny entertainment game for 2-4 people.
The idea is to tap a barrel of beer and to fill your 40 beer steins as fast as you can. Much depends on the luck of the dice rolling of your co-players.

name: Monopoly: New York Yankees
description:
Play Ball! Licensed by Major League Baseball® we bring you the ultimate collector’s edition of the MONOPOLY game featuring the best of the New York Yankees.

Compete to own the greatest Yankees assets which include Yankees Hall of Fame™ players like Yogi Berra, all-time greats like Roger Maris and the 1926 World Series® championship and current stars like Alex Rodriguez, Jason Giambi and Jorge Posada.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Lords of Cannabis
description:
A strategic game of reaping, corruption, and conquest! Players build, trade, and steal their way to becoming the true Lord of Cannabis.
The game includes 125 Stash Cards, 2 Dice, 38 Crop Cards, 6 Building Tiles Per Color, 6 Over-sized Reference Cards, 2 Reward Cards, 1 Sheriff Badge, 24 Numbered Chips, and 14 Tunnels Per Color.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building

name: Zen Flower Showdown
description: You are arranging flowers because your master says it will lead to enlightenment, but all of the other students want enlightenment too. You need to arrange flowers quickly and with greater harmony, so that you can be first to become enlightened!

name: Jenga Girl Talk
description:
Jenga Pink Girl Talk is the original Jenga (1986) with pink blocks containing questions orientated for young girls.
The tower consists of 54 wooden rectangular bricks, in layers of 3, placed at right angles to each other. Each player in turn, removes one brick from anywhere below the highest complete story. The player that pulls the block out of the Jenga tower needs to answer a question before she stacks the block on top of the tower, at right angles to the blocks immediately below it. A complete 3-block story must be completed before starting another. Only one hand may be used at a time.

The last player to stack a block without making the tower tumble over wins.

The questions are:

â What is your favourite flower? â What is your worst fear? â Name someone you have a crush on right now. â What is one goal you would like to achieve this year? â What is your favourite clothing store? â What is your favourite song? â Describe one of your secret talents? â What is your favourite food? â What is your favourite sport? â What is your favourite colour to wear? â What was your favourite vacation? â What is your favourite restaurant? â Who was the last person you talked to on the phone? â When was the last time you cried? â Name your favourite music group or singer. â What do you like most about yourself? â What is one of your favourite TV shows? â What is your favourite holiday? â Who is the last person you were angry with? â What is your favourite season? â What is your favourite movie? â Who is the last person you said "I love you" to? â What is your dream car? â What is your favourite book? â What do you want to be when you grow up? â What is your favourite hobby? â What is your nickname? â Who is your favourite movie star? â If you were an animal, what would you want to be? â What is your favourite cereal? â If you had one wish, what would you wish for? â What is your favourite subject at school? â Who is the last person that made you feel good about yourself? â What is your favourite candy? â What is your most embarrassing moment? â What is your favourite magazine? â What is your favourite game? â What is your favourite sport to watch? â Who is your closest friend? â What is your most overused phrase? â Who is the last person that text messaged you? â What is your favourite reality show? â What is one thing you wish you never did? â What bothers you most about other people? â What is your favourite drink? â Who is the most daring person you know? â What animal would you most like to have as a pet? â What country would you like to visit? â What is the last thing you spent money on? â Who is the last person you text messaged? â What is your weakness? â What is your favourite website? â Who is the funniest person you know? â Who is your hero?

name: Humpuuki
description: The hysterically funny party game in the spirit of Rappakalja! Altogether 400 double-sided cards full of pictures of the weirdest objects in the world, and you will have to make up crazy explanations of what the objects are used for. All the explanations are then judged by all the players – the catch is that you never know beforehand what argument the judgement will be based on – it might be, for example, the most old-maidish, the most fashionable or the saddest explanation that wins on this round. The winners on each round get to move forward on the game board. The first player to reach the finish wins the game! So… pull out your best and most absurd explanations, and you might be the Master of Mumbo Jumbo!
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move, Voting

name: Shuluri viadal
description: This game is based on the Hungarian rpg M.A.G.U.S. Players control teams of fighters in an arena. Different characters, weapons, sorceries, amulets, traps give the game great diversity.

name: Monopoly: Amsterdam
description: The famous Monopoly game. In this version you can buy, sell and trade property of the Dutch capital Amsterdam.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Lerne Bayern kennen
description:
This is a trivia game about the German federal state of Bavaria.

Players roll a die, move around the trails on the board across Bavaria and answer questions about the state. The first one to make it back to the starting space after collecting 8 cards from the different Bavarian regions and answering a final question corretly wins.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Stadt Buch Verlag Wolfgang Giesche MÃ¼nchen

name: What Everyone Should Know About TRAVELLING IN EUROPE
description:
From the publisher:
This game will take you on a trip to Europe. Everyone knows the leaning tower of Pisa, but do you know why it doesn’t stand straight? If you don’t, find out with What everyone should know about traveling in Europe!
On each turn players take one card and try to answer to the question on there! When getting the answer right you get 10 of the money the game uses! Then you have another change to go! Get it right again, you get 20, then 50, then 100 and then you have to give away your turn!
You win the game when collecting amount of money agreed with other players at the beginning of the game! For example you win, when you get 250 that money!

name: All About Town: Milwaukee
description:
All About Town: Milwaukee is a unique board game with a map that takes you "all about town." Travel along the freeway system, visiting familiar landmarks, and test your knowledge about Milwaukee County . There are 1,500 brain-busting questions that challenge your Milwaukee County I.Q. Impress your family, friends, total strangers - and yourself - with all you know about people, business & industry, sports & entertainment, places ,and events - from the past to the present. What you don't know, you can learn - and have fun in the process!

Up to six teams/players can play All About Town: Milwaukee. Start at General Mitchell Airport in your vintage mode of transportation and the race is on! Travel around the game board answering questions about Milwaukee County from six different categories. Be the first to correctly answer questions corresponding to six landmarks and return to Mitchell Airport – and you win!
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Now What? Senseless Solutions to Strange Situations
description: Now What? is a storytelling party game. Players read out strange Dilemmas and then take turns telling a story to solve the dilemma using the object cards laid out for everyone to see. Players who come up with the most unique stories score points.

name: Arena Assault: Robot War
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Battle as a powerhouse Crusher or a fusion blasting Robozon. Grab a group of friends, blast, pound and bash them into dust on your way to victory. Arena Assault is an expandable card game compatible with all other Arena Assault games and decks. Games are fast and furious, even with large groups, allowing for many battles to be played in one game session. Includes two 50 card decks, rules and 20 Arena Gear cards. So, gear up and get ready for battle.

name: NHL Big League Manager: Junior Edition
description:
Among the new features: player cards featuring NHL teams which allow Junior GM's to earn extra points by matching three or five of a kind ( from the same team). This game was also where we first developed the simplified scoring system which we liked so much, we used it for the Platinum Edition.
Junior General Managers draft players, makes trades and can even grab a free agent from rival General Manager. Finally, the perfect board game for young hockey fans!

The object of the game is to build the strongest team of players best able to win hockey games all while balancing the difficult task of being a general manager. Your team is then pitted against your opponents. The winner of 5 games wins the game.

name: Wer weiss mehr und traut sich auch?
description:
Wer weiss mehr und traut sich auch? ("Who knows more and will dare too much?") is a party game for 2-5 teams (2-15 players) that will test their powers of concentration and cultural knowledge. In each round, the teams first bid on how many items they can name from a particular category – flowers, car brands, fish, alcoholic drinks – then the team with the high bid sees whether they can live up to their claim. If they fail to do so, the other teams could score points instead. The team that collects the most points wins.

The Box Contain:

1 Board
5 Pawns in different colors
6 Gray token used to mark the category choosed during the game
1 Black token used to mark the number of terms declared
110 Category cards: total of 660 categories!
1 Mechanical timer

The Game will be presented at Essen Spiel 2011 - Booth 5-34 at the W&L SpielSpass stand.

name: Chazz
description:
Game description from the publisher:

In Chazz, you play the role of intrepid cats and show your claws to mark your territory.

Just like in musical chairs, walk around the table and when the leader gives the signal, dash to a seat. Be on the ball because one of the players will be left standing. Keep a close eye on what your opponents are doing and you could the first tomcat to take control of two chairs thanks to your "claw", "spit" and "rub" cards.

A few tactics and a lot of cattiness make this game unforgettable!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Real-time

name: Interview Challenge
description: Interview Challenge is an educational board game designed to teach important job interviewing skills. In the game, players compete to give Paula, a fictitious job applicant, the best advice on how to succeed in her interview. In the process of playing the game, players learn eight vital skills for successful interviewing, as well as seven major types of questions and how to answer them. The game contains many excellent answers to typical interview questions that students can use as models for their own answers. Preparation for the interview, interacting with the receptionist, and other topics are also covered.

name: Activity Lifestyle
description:
As in the other games of the Activity family, the aim of the game is to guess as many words as possible in order to reach the finish line on the board first. The game is played in teams, and the words from the cards have to be described in one of three ways: drawing, pantomime, or describing the word in other words.

Differences to Activity: The active player has one minute to make his/her team guess the word from the card. If they are successful, they get to move the corresponding number of spaces on the board. If not, the other teams take terms making one guess, and if correct, get to move their pawn. (This replaces the rule from standard Activity, where the opponent teams can only take part in the guessing during 6-point-questions.)

name: Das versunkene Logik-Land
description: It's all hands to the diving station as you make your way to Das versunkene Logik-Land. Watch out, though, as the residents of this underwater world will allow visitors to their mysterious city only if they manage to solve all of their tricky puzzles...

name: Monopoly: Alan Turing Edition
description: Available in November 2012, this version of the famous property game was developed from an original board designed by William Newman, son of Turing's mentor, Max, over sixty years ago. The spaces, Community Chest Cards, and Chance Cards tell the story of Alan Turing's life. Photos of the Turing family adorn the game board. Alan Turing's face is on the play money.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Evil Spares None
description:
Evil Spares None is a 2-4 player Cooperative Survival Horror game. Players are teens in a slasher movie escaping a masked psychopath.

The goal of the game is for players to survive until dawn while the Psychopath hunts down you and your friends. While on the run, your characters can come across crime scenes and gather evidence to hand over to the authorities and add to their investigation. Meanwhile, the Psychopath, independently controlled by a deck of cards, is busy adding to his score by killing and stealing evidence. If the player’s investigation reaches 16 points first, they have a chance to defeat and destroy the Psychopath permanently. If they fail, well then it’s a mad dash race for the exit, go ahead and throw your friends in the path of the enraged unstoppable madman.

name: Pubcrawler: The Pub-themed Card Game
description:
Pubcrawler is a virtual Oxford pub tour in the form of a card game. It takes players on a virtual Pubcrawl through historic Oxford, scoring points by sampling drinks in some of the city’s most iconic pubs. All this without leaving home or having a drink - unless they’d like to, of course! The game also includes quirky and interesting Pub Trivia about each pub.

There are three types of cards in the game: Pub Cards, Drink Cards, and Action Cards.

Pub Cards showcase a selection of Oxford’s finest pubs. They are colour-coded by region on the Pubcrawler Oxford Map, and range in value from 20 to 100 points.

Drink Cards comprise Beer, Wine, and Cocktail cards. They are also colour-coded to match the regions where they are served as Local Drinks. Generally you can only play colour-matching Local Drinks on pubs of each region. However, there are also multi-coloured Guest Drinks which you can play on pubs of any region.

Action Cards add extra fun to the Pubcrawl but can be unpredictable! There are three types of Action Cards: Bonus, Bother, and Between cards. Bonus cards help you score extra points, Bother cards cause problems for other players, and Between cards take effect between players.

Turn by turn each player builds up their own virtual Pubcrawl by playing Pub Cards and Drink Cards, while trying to slow down other players’ progress. Through the Action Cards you can also earn bonuses through events like Happy Hours and Quiz Nights - but watch out for dangers like Punting Mishaps or Dodgy Kebabs which could end your night on a bad note!

Players can bank their points by Calling the Crawl after visiting three pubs, or double their score by visiting at least four pubs. The player with the most points at the end of the final Pubcrawl wins.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Set Collection

name: Triangular Dominoes
description:
Triangular Dominoes was granted a patent in 1885 and is an early instance of the concept of Dominoes applied to triangular pieces. Along the side of each piece is a number from zero to five, expressed with a blank or a number of dots. (Later games like Tri-Ominos would place the numbers on the corners of the pieces.) Also, in the center of each piece is a digit representing the sum of all the piece's sides. The smallest number of unique combinations of pieces results in a fifty-six piece set, plus a special fifty-seventh piece marked with a star and called “the boss.”

The game's inventor, Franklin H. Richards, included in his patent application several games to be played, involving matching the sides of the pieces or matching by the central (total) digit, and trying to outscore the opponent to win. The boss piece may or may not be used in these games as a kind of joker, matching up to any number. Also included with the patent is a description of a smaller set of triangular dominoes, with only the numbers zero through four, resulting in a total of 35 pieces, including the boss.

name: ÎÏÎ½Î®Î³Î¹ ÎµÏÏÏÎ®ÏÎµÏÎ½: ÎÎ»Î»Î¬Î´Î± (Quiz Hunt: Greece)
description:
A competitive game with 600 questions about Greece and the whole world focusing on Greece.

The game play is simple: Each player rolls the dice and according to the outcome of the dice he is being asked the corresponding question. If he answers right, he collects the card.

The player or the team with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

It belongs to a series of trivia games ΚυνÎ®γι ΕρωτÎ®σεων
1.History
2.Animals - Plants
3.Science
4.Culture
5.Sports
6.Geography
7.20th century
8.Greece

name: Love Hotel
description:
Love Hotel is a party game with teenagers, mainly girls, being the target audience. In the game Love Hotel you choose a (fictive) partner. Your goal is to get to the love suite before any of the other couples for some private time. You are only allowed to enter the love suite after you've collected four types of cushions for your bed. Let the race begin!

You and your opponents move around the board, answering questions and acting out tasks for each of the four categories. Doing so correctly will earn you a cushion of the corresponding color. Helping your opponent with a task will earn you a heart. Hearts can be used to buy cushions or to mend broken hearts. If you land on a broken heart tile and don't mend it (by choice or because you don't have any heart tokens) you risk losing one of your cushions. The first person to collect all four cushions and make it to the love suite wins the game!
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Zombia
description:
Your story - your rules!

Zombies wherever you look. Nobody knows Where they come from and what they want. Mindless, hungry and unstoppable, they hunt the living. Zombies! All that's left is to arm yourself to the teeth just to see another day. You are part of a group of survivors, trying to fight against overpowering Undead. All for one, or maybe sacrifice one for all? Where do the Zombies come from, and how can you get rid of them? Maybe they are part of a bigger plan? Make your own story and see for yourself what happens.

Zombia is a narrative card game in the Mini Story series by Noris Spiele. Cards determine their role, their relations to each other and their secret goals. A game last over five rounds, after which the winner(s) are identified as related to their goals.

name: Ninja Bowling
description:
Set up:
Pick a color.
Set up the bowling pin cards in a triangle like shown. Put your strike/spare cards off to the side. Hold your star cards in your hand.

Play:
Each player throws a card at their pins to see who goes first.
Whoever is touching the most cards gets to go first.
If there is a tie, keep throwing to someone gets more.

You take turns throwing your cards. Your hand can not go past the front pin of the pins in front of you.
The winner of the previous round goes first.
If you get a spare (win a round), then win another round. That spare becomes a strike, just flip it over.

Scoring:
Each round each player throws 3 star cards. Whoever touches the most combined cards wins a spare. If the player touches all the cards over the course of the 3 throws, they will get a strike card. First person to get 3 strike cards wins. All ties void each other out for each round.

Alternative.
If you want to add a new challenge use the numbers on the back of the cards to score points. You get points for the cards you land on. You can play to a predetermined score. Or you can win unless you have more points than your opponent.

name: Mauseschlau & BÃ¤renstark: Wissen & Lachen â Deutschland
description: How well do you know Germany? Earn cards and state crests by answering questions and carrying out funny actions. Whoever collects the most cards and crests will win this exciting trip around Germany.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: éäºº -TATSUJIN-
description: In éäºº -TATSUJIN-, each player has a hand of cards, which come in three colors and are numbered 1-8 in each color. Players take turns playing cards, and they use the color and position of the cards played in order to predict what else the opponent has in hand.

name: Monopoly: Jurassic World
description:
Description from the publisher:

Monopoly: Jurassic World delivers more dinosaurs, more attractions, and lots of buying and selling as you attempt to rule Jurassic World. Collectible tokens, Jurassic World money, and a custom Jurassic World dinosaur-inspired game board provide an exciting twist to classic Monopoly.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Schnapp die SchÃ¤tze
description:
Description from the publisher:

Honorable Sultan Semih wishes to reward his most able counselors with gold from the royal coffers. The Sultan has ordered amazing rare objects — a silver column, a flying carpet, a magic lamp, and more — to be carefully stacked upon a magical silver column.

In a thrilling contest in Schnapp die Schätze, players vie for the magical silver column. Only the one who fortune shines upon most — granting him speed, agility and luck — will earn his weight in gold and the title of Grand Counselor. A breath-taking, fast-reaction game.

name: Quibble
description:
Quibble is a quiz game, where you have to name differnt numbers of items in a specific category. You get different point for different difficulty levels and also the time is different in these levels.

Each difficulty level is represented by a pile of card, worth 2, 4, 6, 8 or 10 points and on these cards is written how many items need to be named to win the points (e.g. you have to name 8 movies that won an Oscar).

The player can offer points to other players to get help and moves foward the won points on the scoreboard, when the needed number of items was named. First player to 42 points win the game.

name: The Maze
description:
In the distant future, the biggest entertainment event on the planet is The Maze. The Maze is an ever changing labyrinth where up to 4 contestants compete for fame and riches. Each maze is made completely differently than the other. Contestants have to try and navigate to the finish and claim their victory. You are one of those contestants. Will you become the victor and claim your spoils or be lost and forgotten in the ever changing labyrinth of The Maze?

The Maze is a fun, fast paced game where you create a new maze each time you play. Once The Maze is created you and up to 3 other friends try to escape The Maze, but there can be only one victor. Everyone takes their turns together using a fun dice mechanic, so no one is waiting for their turn to come around again. Your roles on the dice determine how The Maze changes each turn.

Each game of The Maze uses a little bit of luck and a little bit of strategy. You can create a large maze using all of The Maze cards or just a few to create a smaller maze. The possibilities are endless. For even more unique maze creations consider purchasing The Maze: Teleportals, an expansion to The Maze, which adds the ability to play with up to six players and incorporates a new teleporting mechanic to the game, which allows you to make islands in The Maze as well for even more maze possibilities.

The Maze Contents:
48 Maze Cards
4 Player Pawns
4 Six Sided Dice
1 Set of Rules
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: ZORP: Zombie Oblivion Response Pack
description:
ZORP is a shoot-em-up strategy game that combines fast-paced action with chess-like strategic maneuvering and decision-making. It's easy to learn and has both recommended and randomized board arrangements.

One player is a zombie master who controls a steadily growing horde of zombies. Every other player is a human who has been infected by the zombie virus. Humans have nine turns to get to a cure. Along the way they will gather weapons and events to help them survive.

In a two/three player game, there is only one cure on the board and in a four player game there are two. This means that in a three/four person game, one human is always guaranteed to not get a cure. Humans will want to work together, at least somewhat in order to overcome the odds, but in the end, one person cannot be rescued, so humans may turn against each other to slow each other down.

Each human begins with one random weapon and their turns consist of two movement phases and an attack phase, which they can use in any order. (Move/Move/Attack, Attack/Move/Move, Move/Attack/Move) A movement is one tile in a non-diagonal direction and an attack lets you use all of the ammo at your disposal during the attack phase. Each weapon has different properties and the ammo is reloaded each turn.

When a human lands on a weapon tile, they add it to their inventory and are able to duel wield weapons. If they land on an event, they trigger it immediately. Some events persist throughout the game (like finding fast shoes, etc.) some are one time use (like finding a live grenade, etc.).

The Zombie Master's turn begins by moving all of the zombies on the board. Different zombie types have different movement abilities. After moving existing zombies, he/she spawns new zombies to add to the board. Certain turns will also trigger a zombie event after the new zombies have been placed on the board. Zombie events are generally good for the Zombie Master, but expert humans can find ways to exploit certain zombie events.

The players take turns until either all the cures have been acquired, or time runs out and none of the turns have been acquired or if the zombie master can zombify all the humans in the game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Video Game Theme, Zombies
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Area Movement, Grid Movement, Worker Placement

name: PlayProp
description:
PlayProp is a game for everyone,
PlayProp is a hilarious, quirky and different game – and also a social business project. It’s the game that can make the kids let go of their sticky iPads – and the grownups drop their beloved Smart Phones.

Great moments will arise, while you are laughing at each other and with each other. Creating the most intense and attentive space of connection and feeling of togetherness. PlayProp is the greatest offline experience – and a game you will love to play with 3-8 other people, whether you are 6 or 106 years old.

name: Tangoes: Card Set 3
description: Tangoes Card Sets provide hours of additional play variety for the Tangoes tangram-based games. Each pack includes 54 challenging puzzles and solutions, on 27 cards, in a slim resealable plastic container. There have been a total of 11 expansion card sets released, numbered 2 through 12 because they count the original game's cards as set 1. The card sets are not numbered by order of difficulty; each set simply contains new and different puzzles.
publishers: Rex Games, Smart Toys and Games, Inc.

name: Football Wooden Travel Game
description: The Football Wooden Travel Game is a dice game that uses pegs on a solid wood board. The players roll 2 dice simultaneously and consult the board to see the outcome of the play. As in normal American Football, each player gets 3 downs before they have the option to go for it on 4th down or punt. The first to 28 points wins!

name: Ranter-Go-Round
description:
Ranter-Go-Round (also known as Chase the Ace, Cuckoo, Bohemian Poker, Screw Your Neighbor, Stick or Swap, Bring the King, or Chicago Shuffle) is a card game with bluffing elements.

Any number of players, 52 cards. The object is to not have the lowest card at the table. The ranking of cards from highest to lowest is: K Q J 10 9 8 7 6 5 4 3 2 A, or alternately A K Q J 10 9 8 7 6 5 4 3 2. Suit is irrelevant.

Each player has an equal number of counters placed in front of them - usually from 2 to 4 - to mark his or her "lives". (Alternatively, a dollar bill or other note may be used, and players use the corners to mark their lives, folding a corner in when a life is lost.) Cards are dealt, one card to each, face down. Starting to the left of the dealer - each in turn examines their card. If they are satisfied with their card they may keep it, usually simply by announcing, "I'm good." or similar. However, if they are unsatisfied they may pass it to the player on their left while announcing that they are "not good", receiving that player's card back in return. The player to the left is obliged to exchange for the unwanted card unless they currently hold a King at which time they can refuse the card by showing their King. That transaction completed, privilege now passes to the player to the left who may or may not have a new card to decide on. (Players who have shown a King in defense are considered to have completed their play.) Play continues to the left as such. Once we reach the dealer the dealer has the same decision as any other player except that they exchange with the top card on the remaining deck instead of another player.

All exchanges completed, the players' cards are then all turned face up, and the lowest at the table loses a counter/life - which they place into the central pot. Ties lose a life each. Once a player loses all their lives they are out of the game, and only remaining players are dealt in for the next hand. Each hand the dealer rotates to the next player to the left.

Play continues as such until the only player with live(s) remaining takes the entire central pot.

Of special note, if it gets down to just two players and they each have one counter and they tie, they both lose and place their existing counter into the pot and all players re-ante and start the round over again.

name: Pop Rocket
description: In Pop Rocket, you place the rocket in the middle of the playing area, pull the fuse, then wait for the rocket to pop! Quickly place your colored bowls around the rocket. As soon as the rocket opens, a colorful shower of stars flies through the air! Catch the most stars when the rocket pops to win!

name: La Cavale des Daltons (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories Revolution)
description:
I'm a poor lonesome cowboy
I've a long long way from home...

Stoooop ! There will be no Lucky Luke in that scenario!

Welcome in 1872, in the far far far west. A mysterious radio signal has been identified and you are requested by the Agency to locate it.

Be ready, Agents ! Because your first task will be to help 4 dangerous desperados to escape from jail. And it will be the easiest part of you mission...

—description from the designer

Please remember that these scenarios are meant to be a bridge between the Time Stories and the Time Stories Revolution cycles. So, you are expected to find old and new mecanisms (including Azraks). The basic box is not mandatory.

CHAPTER 1 : Bons Baisers du pénitencier (.DOCX):
https://drive.google.com/open?id=1tecpsZN1TgMo59P-_-Ur5tXCLX...

CHAPTER 2 : Poker Gulch (.DOCX):
not yet available

CHAPTER 3 : Plume au vent (.DOCX):
not yet available
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fan Expansion
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Mindblowon
description:
Avoid the Bomb! Survive this deck full of Bombs and other hazardous instructions while players push each other to the brink of explosion! Say your prayer and utilize the unique double-sided Action/Ability cards to increase your survival chance to be the last player alive and become the Mindblowon champion!

Just flip a top card face-up from two available decks & perform the instruction. If you survive the round, take all opened cards (alongside its awesome ability on its flip-side) to use on your next turn. The game continues until one player survives, while others were blown to smithereens!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: 15 Go!
description:
Get rid of your cards as quickly as possible, by playing the numbers subsequently. You make rows on the table but you can also play the cards on your opponent's deck. A tactical game where you have to trade and count. With 2 playable possibilities: the basic game and the advanced game. Who is the first to get rid of his cards?!

—description from the publisher

name: Adder: Realtime Chase System
description:
The Vurdes Aerial Combat Institute has emerged as the premier pilot training facility in the galaxy. In order to gain admission, you've passed written tests and aced your interviews, but one final hurdle lies in your path: Adder. Can you best your rivals in this game designed to test your wits and reflexes?

—description from the rulebook


Adder is a real-time strategy dexterity game in which players place cards to extend their own stack of cards to chase and catch the opponent's cards while the opponent is doing the same thing.

—user summary

name: Times Table Heroes
description: Master times table from 1 to 12 with these games. Practice 2, 5 and 10 times tables with Multiplication Bingo, or flip over the board to play Times Table Heroes. Save the city by solving multiplication sums, overcoming disasters with your unique superhero powers, and be the first to defeat the evil robot.

name: ÐÐ¾Ð´Ð²Ð¾Ð´Ð½ÑÐ¹ ÐÐ¸Ñ (Underwater World)
description:
Help your favorite marine reserve take first place in the world ranking in the free, downloadable game.

Each player has their own deck of eight sea animals. Each of them has 3 characteristics: speed, immersion depth and food supply. In each round, players compete on one of these indicators.

During the game, players draw 3 cards from there asymmetrical decks and play one card. Cards from current and previous rounds are used do define the winner of a round in accidence with the scoring mechanic of a current round (three different variations). The winner of a round gains one point.

The game ends when one of a players gain 3 points.
