categories: Animals, Children's Game, Math, Print & Play
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Score-and-Reset Game, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Elementa Arcanum
description:
Welcome to the world of Elementa Arcanum. Hundreds of years in the future, scientific advances have given humans control over the power behind the elemental forces of nature: Fire, Water, Wind and Earth. Through genetic engineering, the richest families of the galaxy have evolved a race of superhuman wizards. The strongest representatives of each generation participate in a galactic tournament once a year called the Elementa Arcanum -- a spectacle so mesmerizing it surpassed the Olympics and rendered it obsolete. As the years pass, the most talented of each generation slowly begin to emerge until a victor is declared. The winner is named the Elementa Prima and dons the Black Hole Robes, forever etched into history. Will you wield Ultima and master the 4 Elements?

Elementa Arcanum is a deck-building card game for 1-6+ players. Players alternate between Combat Turns, where they vie for Stars (Victory Points) and Research Turns where players can improve and optimize their decks. The first player to 5 Stars wins the game. The rules are relatively simple and can be taught to newcomers while the game is underway through the "Teaching Game" system. The game has a very small form-factor and is highly portable. A common shop containing new cards for players to acquire uses a tiered system and uses rules to prevent shop stagnation.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game, Tug of War, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Herding Cats
description:
Felines are causing havoc! Race against your opponents to round up four-of-a-kind. But don’t let the cat out the bag! Bring fun, excitement and lightning reflexes to your next gathering with Herding Cats, the fast-paced card grabbing game.

If you've ever played the classic game of "Signal", this is it but with a cat twist! This game is played in teams of pairs, involves a secret signal, and cat-astrophic mayhem to collect and complete their chosen cat set first! All in real-time!
mechanics: Deduction, Hand Management, Real-Time, Speed Matching

name: Milly Muffin
description:
In this game 2-4 players team up with unicorn Milly Muffin to find the three butterflies hidden in magical trees and bring them back to the meadow.

Players take turns rolling a special die and according to the result move either the unicorn or the butterfly-hunting raccoon.

Whenever the unicorn lands on a space accompanied by a tree the turn player shakes that tree, then all players guess whether there's a butterfly or a dung beetle hidden inside.

Muffins found along the way can be used to distract the raccoon or take Milly to a tree of the player's choice.

The players win if they find all the butterflies and the unicorn reaches the meadow before the raccoon does.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Memory, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Monopoly: English Heritage â Castles
description:
Swap Pall Mall for Goodrich Castle and Mayfair for Pendennis castle in this special English Heritage Castles edition of Monopoly.

English Heritage’s Castles edition of the world famous Monopoly game is an exciting adventure through some of England’s finest fortifications. Starting from GO, discover English Heritage’s most famous sites, while trying to avoid paying tithe taxes or having to repair your battlements after a siege!

Acquire various castles' colour groups to begin building market stalls and barns, increasing the rent and strengthening your purse ready for more acquisitions! Stay sharp- because there’s only room at the top for one. For everyone else, there’s bankruptcy. Compete to take all the sites and become ruler of the kingdom!
mechanics: Auction: English, Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Track Movement, Trading

name: Ð¡Ð»Ð¾Ð²Ð¾ Ð·Ð° ÑÐ»Ð¾Ð²Ð¾: ÐÐµÑÐµÑÐ¸Ð½ÐºÐ° (Word for Word: Party)
description:
The game Ð¡Ð»Ð¾Ð²Ð¾ Ð·Ð° ÑÐ»Ð¾Ð²Ð¾: ÐÐµÑÐµÑÐ½Ð¸ÐºÐ° ("Word for Word: Party") is suitable for a big noisy company, and word games lovers, and for family gatherings! Take a card, choose a word, roll two dice and explain the word without saying both letters. No one will be bored, because while one tries to explain the word, the others have to not only guess the word, but also see if he made a mistake. Get victory points and have fun guessing words and catching the speaker on blunders!

Who the game is suitable for:

Fans of educational board games, as it offers great opportunities to develop vocabulary and eloquence.
Family companies, because it has simple rules, fun gameplay and bright components.
Fans of compact games, because it does not take up space on the table, easily fits in a pocket and conveniently unfolds in any situation.
Large companies, because it accommodates an unlimited number of participants and the more of you there are, the more fun the party.
Fans of diverse parties, as the rules provide several game modes suitable for any company.


Improve your vocabulary with your friends and the board game Ð¡Ð»Ð¾Ð²Ð¾ Ð·Ð° ÑÐ»Ð¾Ð²Ð¾: ÐÐµÑÐµÑÐ½Ð¸ÐºÐ°!

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Cthulhu Cubes
description:
Rely on chance and your malice to raise the mighty Cthulhu and defeat your opponents.

Run out of dice to win the game!
Obtain machine guns to attack your opponents, or send cultists to hinder their objectives.

Seek the knowledge of the scrolls to gain their power and succumb to the will of Cthulhu with his primordial dice.

Will you run out of dice before anyone else? will you win Cthulhu's favor?

At the start of the game, each player receives the same number of dice (ranging from 4 to 6 depending on the number of players).

The starting player receives the special Cthulhu die and rolls all his or her dice plus this last one. He or she first resolves the Cthulhu die and then the normal dice (those showing a result other than a blank face).

Players alternate turns in this way, trying to get rid of their dice and trying to harm the other players. The first one to do so is the winner.

name: Video Village
description:
Another in Milton Bradley's long line of games based on television game shows.

A true roll and move game. Players alternate rolling a single die, moving along each of three paths in the Village. Random events, cash or prizes await every step. When one player finishes, the one with the most money (in cash and prizes) wins.

A simple board with 3D components ("Dice Bird Cage", Jail, Bridge, Card Bins & Store Fronts) simulates what it looked like on TV.
publishers: Chad Valley Co Ltd., John Sands Pty Ltd, Milton Bradley

name: Battle of the Pyramids
description:
(Description taken from their homepage):

The pyramids of Egypt are among the most enduring and mysterious symbols of the ancient Egyptian civilization. The pyramids are considered to be one of the seven wonders of the world. The leaders of this ancient time-the pharaohs were clever strategists who would use all manner of tactics to ensure that their dynasties remained in power.

Two powerful symbols of ancient Egypt; the pyramid and the scarab are combined to create a unique game that will challenge you to think like the pharaohs.

“Battle of the Pyramids” is a strategic game for two players that combine the principles of planning, strategic thinking, memory and surprise.

Not for the faint hearted Battle of the Pyramids challenges you to be the first to have your pyramids reach the other-side unscathed. Conceal the scarabs within your pyramids to impede your opponent’s assault. Plan your strategy and attempt to get your opponent to reveal their pyramids hidden secrets.

name: Bible Balderdash
description: Bible Balderdash is exactly as it sounds. Take Balderdash, add the word of the Lord, and try to bluff people into thinking you are telling the truth about bible events rather than spinning yarns.

name: MindTrap 20th Anniversary Edition
description:
Description from the publisher:'

The original MindTrap game was first published 20 years ago. Packed with puzzles, mysteries, brainteasers, conundrums, and trick questions, MindTrap became an international success, selling over 3 million copies worldwide.

For this limited 20th Anniversary edition, we have taken the best questions from MindTrap and MindTrap II, added two new categories, and loads and loads of new content!

Full of quirky characters, baffling brainteasers, and convoluted logic, MindTrap can be played wherever and whenever you want to exercise your brain. MindTrap is the game that challenges the way you think!

name: Harbour: Klaus â Saint of the North
description:
Promo character card for Harbour. Double-sided, with English on one side and German version 'Klaus - Heiliger aus'm Norden' on the flip side.

Ability: Whenever any player uses the home building of the player with Klaus as a character, collect any 1 resource.

The promo character Klaus is included in the German magazine "Spielerei" issue no. 113 (Oct.-Dec. 2016)
categories: City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor

name: Crypt: The Pharaoh's Curse
description:
Crypt: The Pharaoh's Curse is characterized as a "Trading Board Game", available in Starter Box Sets of 5 hexes (hexagonal tiles), 3 six-sided dice, 3 character cards, 34 action pieces (cards), and 20 life/creature tokens. Booster sets are also available.

Each player selects a character card secretly before the beginning of the game, which will affect which action pieces that the player will be most effective with, determines the minimum and maximum number of action pieces that the player must play with, and describes any special abilities of the character. Next, each player chooses which action pieces they will play with from their collection, subject to the limits of the character card. Finally, each player contributes an agreed-upon number of hexes (rooms) to the game in their own stack.

Gameplay consists of drawing/discarding action pieces, playing any number of free action pieces, taking one action (such as moving, exploring by adding a new hex to the board and resolving the occurrence on the hex, playing an action piece, attacking another player/creature, or exiting the crypt).

The goal is to be the first player to find your key in the action piece deck, find and place your exit tile, and successfully exit the crypt complex.
categories: Ancient, Collectible Components, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Picture This?
description:
Your favorite celebrities from Hollywood TV and sport together with global places events and people that have shaped our world in a fast paced visual trivia board game with a twist. Even if you think you know Kylie Minogue from Jessica Simpson and Lleyton Hewitt from Andy Roddick - do you have knowledge to answer the remaining trivia to win the card The excitement builds with the Challenge and All Play This rounds - gamble your cards and challenge your opponents This fast paced game lasts between 40-60 minutes with the ultimate Double or Quits finale.

One answers as many questions as possible to collect cards, the player with the most cards wins at the end. One can use 1 or 2 dice to regulate the playing time. In his turn a player rolls the die and moves his pawn, then he must answer all three questions from a card in the category reached. One has one try for each question, for the third correctly answered question one receives the card, otherwise another player gets a chance. Creative squares demand drawing or pantomime, on poker squares one can bet cards against another player, the first one to answer a 3rd question correctly wins the bet cards from the opponent. On the Double square at the end of the game one has the chance to double the number of cards
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Falcon Games (I), Jumbo, Picture This, Ltd.

name: Matchball
description: Gameplay in Matchball is straightfoward. Players compete individually or in teams to bounce a ball into a hole, preferably a hole worth more points than any other. You can't bounce a ball just anywhere, however. On your turn, you roll a die that shows either 1, 2 or 3, and you must bounce the ball off the appropriately numbered platform in front of the field of holes.

name: Spuren im Busch
description:
A band of 12 poachers is sought out in Casablanca. Before they can be arrested, they succeed in escaping to the Rif and Atlas mountains. From there, their tracks lead to the south and the east of Africa.

The players in this game represent game wardens who try to follow the tracks of the poachers through Africa to their hiding place in order to arrest them, meeting many exotic animals along the way.

During the game, the players move their pawns on the spaces marked 1 to 36 and pick up the small tracking tiles, which show them, where the tracks of the poachers lead. Each player on his destination sheet draws in the tracks that he has uncovered. With each game, there is only one set of continuous tracks from the space marked 1 up to one of the hiding places (spaces A through K).

The goal of the game is to follow this continuous set of tracks and discover which hiding place the poachers are using. A player that knows or believes he knows the correct hiding place can arrest poachers from that space. The winner is the player who arrests the most poachers from the correct hiding place.

name: Das Perry Rhodan Spiel: Operation Wega
description:
Based on the famous German science-fiction literary series "Perry Rhodan".

From the back of the box (translated):

In this game, the players are piloting a space ship with a set amount of fuel. Pirates will force them into unforeseen maneuvers, so they have to keep track of their fuel supplies.
In many different scenarios up to four players may engage at the same time, while the rules are different each time. The basic rules, though, stay the same in every game, e.g. for flight maneuvers or movement.
In the starting scenarios, they have to deal with navigation and movement, whereas the advanced setting allows for more variation, like different planets, refueling, evasion, freight, etc. The different game phases are navagation, movement, and supply.
Then there are expert scenarios, which add mines and rockets to the battles. Here we have these game phases: navigation, ranged weapons, movement, fights, and supply.

name: Winerd
description:
Winerd is a wine tasting game developed to educate players about wine. The players provide 3 different bottles of red or white wines. Play begins with each player (or team) tasting the 3 wines and taking notes about the wine's color, smell, and taste as well as noting the wine's name, vintage, and region of origins.

Each turn, players draw a trivia card which asks a question about wine. If the player answers correctly, they advance 1 space. Each player also has 3 bonus/challenge cards which can be played to either double their movement (a bonus) or force another player to answer the question (a challenge). If a player correctly answers the bonus they move ahead 2 spaces. If a player is challenged and answers incorrectly, the challenger moves 2 spaces. however, if they answer correctly, the challenged player moves 2 spaces

Spaced around the board are 4 Blind Taste Test squares. Whenever a player lands on one of these, another player secretly pours a glass of any one of the 3 wines. The player who landed on the taste test now must name the selected wine, its vintage, and the region or country it came from. For each correct answer they move forward 1 space.

On the final test you must name the wine selected and poured for you. If you are correct, you win the game.

Here is the description from the back of the box:

Winerd (as in wine nerd) is the wine tasting game that crushes grape fears by presenting amusing wine facts at every turn. With Winerd the steps of wine tasting will be easy to learn, yet telling the difference between your wines might be more challenging than you would think. You'll be amazed at what your taste buds can teach you(tm)! The first player or team to taste their way to the Winerd Circle wins the game and becomes a Winerd. With different friends and different wines it's a whole new game every time!
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Megaman NT Warrior Battle Net Board Game
description:
In the future, internet technology has advanced to usher in the Network Age. Everyone has a portable communications interface device called a “PET” or personal terminal that contains an artificial intelligence program, or “NetNavi,” to navigate the worldwide information network. MegaMan, a NetNavi and his human operator, Lan work together along with their friends to combat viruses bent on unleashing chaos in the cyber network to dominate the world. The most evil Navi is PharaohMan.

The object of the game is to be the first player to complete their mission and defeat the Evil Pharaoman! Players travel around the Battle Network searching for Battlechips that will make their NetNavis more powerful. They must be careful as dangerous computer virus may attack as they search for important Item tiles that will complete their mission cards allowing them to find and fight PharaohMan.
categories: Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sorry! Splash Mountain
description:
Splash Mountain Sorry! is one of the tin boxed Disney Theme Park Editions. They are only sold at Disney resorts and theme parks. The playing pieces represent the log boats that guests ride through the attraction on.

The game Sorry! The Disney Edition a normally boxed version sold in regular stores, with themed “teams” of characters from multiple Disney films.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Swinging Snakes
description: The object of this game is similar to a game like Bamboleo or Topple. There is a ring that balances and you add/balance snakes of your color to the top trying to avoid the top falling off.

name: Herre pÃ¥ tÃ¤ppan
description:
Think of this game as Pachisi in 3D with a twist.

Each player has a set of pawns that start at the bottom of a six-sided pyramid. The dice control both pawn movement and pyramid twists.
You can only move pawns that are on your side of the pyramid, but you are encouraged to twist the pyramid to constantly change the playing field.
If your opponents pawns happen to find themselves in your part of the pyramid they can be moved down, blocked or even converted to your own color.
The winner is the first player to move half of his/her pawns to the top of the pyramid.

name: Egyptian Flood
description:
Egyptian Flood, a card game for 2-6 players featuring city building and destroying.

Designed and ideas by: Benjamin Sperling (Gurken Games), James Casey, Byron Grimes, Erik Lechak, Craig Somerton, August Larson, Jay LaFountain.

Instructions:
You need these items to play:
10 Farm cards, 10 Floods, 7 Settlements, 6 Kingdoms, 5 Pyramids, 6 Soldiers, 7 Riches, 4 Anubises, 4 Sandstorms, 5 Harvests.
Some kind of coins for gold, different color tokens for each player, and another type of token to represent damage to buildings (solider damage and flood damage).

The deck of cards should be shuffled and each player is dealt four cards from the central deck. Choose one player to go first and have each player chooses his or her color. All players take 3 gold from the bank.

The first player draws one card and plays a card from their hand. That player does what the card says, then the turn ends and the next player begins their turn.

The game ends when no one is able to play any further cards.

Winning:
Each player earns 1 victory point for each gold they have plus 2 victory points for each pyramid they control. The highest total wins the game.

I hope you enjoy this game. It was a collaborative effort of the above designers and idea people.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, City Building, Civilization, Political, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Modular Board

name: Huff and Puff
description:
You know the tale of the three pigs and the wolf? The first pig that finishes it's house wins.

The active player rolls the die and moves his pig according to the roll. If it lands on an straw/wood/stone symbol, he adds a tile made from that material to his house. If he lands on a wolf symbol, he can let the wolf blow onto another players house, causing it to lose his straw and (often) his wooden parts.

From the box:
Help out the three little piglets. They have built their houses, but big bad wolf is going to blow them over.
Build you house and place your little pig on the start line. Every time wolf turn for your house and for every window left, you move forward and for every window blown when you're a wolf, also move forward.
Highly luck based game for little kids with great sounds and electronics.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Dujardin, IMC Toys, Jumbo, TF1 Games, Winning Moves France, Winning Moves Germany

name: Pizza Wars Imperium
description:
You and up to 7 friends order a pizza with one ingredient per player.

The game consists of rules and a historical background. You supply the pizza, toothpicks (about 10 per player for eating conquered armies) and six sided die (one per player).

Since you eat your opponent's conquered armies, and it is very unlikely that you will eat your own armies, it is suggested you order an ingredient that others hate. This will ensure that others will think twice about attacking you.

Your armies (ingredients) move from land (slice) to land waging war against the opponent's armies. Last man standing wins.

The game is very simple but does come with optional rules to add difficulty, realism, and flavour (sorry).

Also includes rules for Grubb Chess, using a chess board and various hot peppers; Galactic Gluttons, using pizza, dice, paper, plates, and a ruler (Apparently you said between the lands); and Gulf War, with rules sadly omitted because the designers decided that the average gamer could not afford to fill a bathtub with chili-con-carne.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Knuckling Knights: The Duel
description:
In each round of Knuckling Knights: The Duel, two players compete against one another on the tournament board to see who can hold his ground.

Players start their knights at opposite ends of the game board, then take turns using their cardboard shield to flick their knight (a wooden disk) at the opposing player's knights. The first knight to go off the board and touch the table – whether due to an errant shot or a well-placed blow – loses the round. The winner claims a knuckling coin, and the player with the most coins after all the duels have been held wins the game. (With two players, the first player to claim six coins wins.)

name: Sealife DVD Board Game
description:
Sequel to the popular "Wildlife DVD Boardgame".

The setting has moved from the Serengethi to the oceans.
The concept of the game remains the same though: Answer trivia questions related to the video fragments on the DVD.

This time, the game uses a massive collection of video material from the Cousteau family, famous for their oceanic documentaries.
publishers: Identity Games International B.V., Imagination Games, MINDOK, Trefl

name: Trivial Pursuit: Disney PIXAR Edition â Bite-Size
description:
This is another in the "Bite-Size" range of Trivial Pursuit games. It is intended as a portable travel game. The game is packaged in a wedge ("piece-of-pie") shaped box.

The game does not feature a game board, and thus, there is no roll-and-move mechanic. Instead, players roll the color-coded die, and answers a question matching the color rolled. If a player correctly answers a question, he may "go for a wedge" by answering another question in the same category. If he does so, he keeps that card. If the player answers a question incorrectly, it is the next player's turn. Play ends when a player has collected six cards/correctly answered 12 questions.

Featuring 600 questions from the popular Disney/Pixar movies, including:

Finding Nemo
Ratatouille
Monsters, Inc.
Toy Story 1 & 2
The Incredibles
Bugs Life
Cars


Made in China, released in Australia.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
publishers: Hasbro, Horn Abbot International, Parker Brothers

name: Express Yourself
description: Insert your secret word card into the game unit -- the electronic announcer will tell you what to do next! How will you get your friends to guess the word? Will you act it out? Give verbal clues? Draw it? Only the announcer knows!

name: Teufel nochmal!
description:
Players start with 8 cards and 8 wooden chips of various values (2 each of values 0, 1, 4, & 7). The start player leads a card and then all players place a wood chip face down in front of them. The winner of the trick will take all of the wooden chips and score them as points, so players play chips according to how likely they think they are to win the trick.

Each player then plays a card in order (other than the start player, who has already played a card). The trick is resolved using the paper/scissors/stone mechanism (using cards showing Gretel, Kasper, and a crocodile) [Punch, Judy, & Crocodile in the English edition]. Teufel [devil] cards act as a trump. Whoever wins the trick takes the cards and the chips.

After all tricks have been played, all cards are discarded except the crocodiles and the chips. The chips are positive points for the players; the crocodiles are negative points. Several hands are played, and the winner is the one with the most points at the end.

name: The American Girls Game
description:
A game from the maker of the popular American Girl line of dolls and accessories. Players move around the board trying to collect tokens and sets of matching cards. Trading cards are drawn each turn and several spots on the board provide a chance to trade cards among the players. Trivia cards about the American Girl stories provide opportunities to earn extra tokens.

Comes with six detailed pewter figurines that are used as the player pawns.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Stuff It!
description: Take turns stuffing foam babies into a phone booth! While holding down the roof with one finger, use the other hand to stuff a foam baby into the phone booth. Slowly remove your finger from the roof. If the phone booth explodes you lose, and all the other players win. If it doesn't explode, then the next player takes their turn. Continue until the phone booth explodes.

name: Taxa
description: A taxi game with a map of Copenhagen. Pick up customers (red, blue, green, silver, and gold), deliver them to their destinations and get the next. Whoever delivers at least one customer in every colours win.
mechanics: Area Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: DTC Super Racing
description:
Basic racing game based on the Danish Grand Prix.

The DTC Super Racing game is the official DTC (Danish Touringcar Championship) board game.

Everyone can participate; the game is for contest minded people who like to make a good deal and control the game!

Hire drivers and participate in DTC races, as well as buy shares in the different companies, so you, after all completed races, have the biggest fortune. You have possibilities to make profits on your drivers, your companies and the other companies you have interest in.

The game can be played on the four official DTC tracks; Ring Djursland, Padborg Park, Ring Knutstorp and Jyllands-Ringen.

You are the manager of one out of five teams (Essex Invest, Honda, Peugeot Sport, Toyota and Volvo) and you manage your team with the official racers from the season, including Jan Magnussen (also known from Corvette's Le Mans 24h race).

The drivers race in four groups (A, B, C and D Class) and can also ride in a Free-Class race where all drivers can be used. Each driver has pre-determined number of moving spaces for each turn, which is written on its information card.

Every race cost 2,000 per car to participate in, and there are prizes for number 1 to 4.

The money can be used for betting and improvements.

The winner is the player who has collected most values in money, drivers, shares in a syndicate and obligations after the 8 races, which are run depending on which type of drivers, who are eligible for each race.

name: Balloon Race
description:
Can you get all your balloons safely into the stratosphere? But watch out for falling hailstones!

Each player has 4 balloons and tries to move all of them from the bottom to the top row of the Sky Grid. The first player to do so wins the game. If a balloon hits a hailstone then the balloon is burst and returns to the bottom row. Players may also burst other players balloons by squashing it between their own balloons and/or a hailstone. Balloons can jump diagonally over balloons of the same colour (counts as one move) all the way up the Sky Grid thus being an efficient way of using the action-points allocated each turn.

To begin a game, the 10 hailstones are lined up in the stratosphere (one in each square). Each player places their pawn on the corresponding 'Big Balloon' space on the Flight Path on the outside of the board. Then players place their balloons on any squares on the bottom of the Sky Grid (each player places one balloon in turn until all balloons are placed). Several balloons can occupy the same square for the first 3 rows (green area). Beyond row 3 (in the blue area) - only one balloon to a square.

On a player's turn they roll a 10-sided dice and move their pawn around the Flight Path. When the pawn lands on or passes certain squares it gives that player a number of action-points (1-4) in which to move their balloons in an upwards direction (vertical or diagonal). The action-points may be split among the player's balloons as they see fit. When a player's pawn lands on a 'Storm Clouds' square on the Flight Path the player must move any hailstone of their choice down one square. If a player's pawn lands on a 'Wind Clouds' square the player must move any one of their balloons one square sideways (if that is impossible - their lowest balloon is deemed burst, and falls back to the ground.)

Players can choose to stop their pawn on the Storm/Wind Clouds squares even if the number thrown on the dice could take the pawn past.

When a player's pawn passes or lands on a Kite/Cloud square in the corner of the Flight Path the player also throws the dice to determine which of the 10 hailstones moves down one square.

The game ends when one player has moved all their balloons to the top of the Sky Grid or when a hailstone hits the ground (in which case each balloon carries a score for the height it has reached, the highest total score then wins the game). For a quicker game, players can agree that the first balloon to reach the stratosphere ends the game - then the highest total score wins.

name: Mafia: Tohle je naÅ¡e vÄc
description:
Mafia: This is our business is a board game similar to Monopoly, but only little part.

The game is composed of two games and that is ride on the external circuit and buying companies in one part and the second part is the control puzzle parts on the map of city. The game is played in two teams, each team has 3 characters, are controlled by the same player. - For example in a two player game - the first player controls 3 characters in Bonnano Family and the second player controls 3 characters from the second Famfamily.ilie.

The play that controls most of the city puzzle or forces the other player(s) into bankruptcy, wins.

CZ:
OcitnÄte se v kÅ¯Å¾i mafiána, kterého pÅed zloÄinnými úmysly neodradí ani to, Å¾e stojí proti ÄlenÅ¯m vlastní rodiny. OvládnÄte mÄsto a staÅte se kmotrem!
Hra Mafia vás pÅenese do dob, kdy byla nejen italská, ale i americká velkomÄsta ovládána mocnými rodinami mafiánských bossÅ¯. UmoÅ¾ní Vám zaÅ¾ít pocit moci a penÄz získaných Å¾ivotem na druhé stranÄ zákona, i kdyÅ¾, jak se Åíká, kaÅ¾dý má svou cenu, a tak se hranice mezi „hodnými" a „zlými" Äasto ztrácí.
Ve hÅe Mafia se dvÄ mocné rodiny chystají svést rozhodující souboj o nadvládu nad velkomÄstem. ObzvlášÅ¥ jako zaÄínající mafióso musíte mít všechny smysly napjaté a pozornÄ si hlídat své donary. Nikdy totiÅ¾ nevíte, Äí bouchaÄka na vás míÅí. Boss však mÅ¯Å¾e být nakonec jen jeden a tak poznáte, Å¾e Vaším jediným pÅítelem jsou všemocné peníze, kterých není nikdy dost.

name: Shopping List Booster Pack: Fruit & Veg
description: This is an expansion to Orchard Toys' Shopping List. It features new, familiar, everyday items for your shopping list and is centred around fruit and veg.

name: Zlatohrad
description: This is a tile based game where players are in the role of Knights who venture into the mysterious castle of Zlatohrad in search of treasure. Each player has a cart with four knights. By gradually flipping over the tiles that have been placed in a 9x9 grid, players discover the secrets of the castle and try to find as much treasure as they can, so long as they can transport it out of the castle with their carts.
publishers: Dino Toys s. r. o., Ravensburger

name: Joris en de Draak
description:
"In Joris en de Draak you play as a knight with fire and water! Be smart when heading for the great battle with the dragon. On your way you'll collect the powers of fire and water, fight duals with other knights and follow your own route. Collect a helmet, shield and sword so that you arive at the dragon in full strength. The first player to defeat the dragon is the hero and winner of the game."

The game is played on a circular board. In the middle of this board the dragon, which has to be defeated, can be found. The players start on different positions on the board and try to collect fire and water cards as well as an outfit. When a player thinks he has enough resources to fight the dragon, he may go to the middle of the board and start a battle. You have to hit the dragon three times before it is defeated. In between the hits you may return to the board to collect more cards or to expand your outfit.

Joris en de Draak is a board game based on a roller coaster of the same name which can be found in the Efteling. Therefore the game will only be sold in the Efteling as a souvenir. You can also buy the game at the webshop of the Efteling. Please note that the game is currently only available in Dutch.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Fatal Attraction
description:
Abstract game. Played on a chessboard style grid, your pieces might attract or repel other pieces that you challenge. Feel the magnetic power!

Can you harness the magnets power to outwit your opponent? Feel the power of the magnets as each player fills the board with magnetic stones. You must use their force to your advantage so plot your move: decide where and how you'll play your next magnet. Place it onto the force field. Will you be save... or sorry?

name: Tombs: The Sword of Valhalla
description: Tombs is a quick and easy game of tomb-raiding in both colour and (printer kind) lineart versions. The Tombs board is a brickwork grid of tiles the player must navigate to reach their goal. However the Tomb is always geared against the player, who must keep their valiant band of explorers alive by selling artifacts and managing inventory to argument the trials of the Tomb. To win the expedition must recover the Sword of Valhalla before their inventory runs out or they all meet an untimely end.

name: Kesselchaos
description:
Description from the publisher:

Every year on witching night, a great magic potion brewing competition takes place. All young sorcerers have to gather everything together for their magical recipes. Who can brew their potions the fastest in the fast-paced reaction game Kesselchaos? And also make sure all the ingredients are right? Watch out because the Senior Sorcerer Yorandel will check all of the potion cauldrons at the end.

name: Noclear
description:
A "Nucular" game to restore your bateries!

Build and create your nuclear power plant, improve your machinery and manage your energy to get uranium and win the game.

GAME GOAL

Collect more uranium than your opponents. For that, you have to manage property your energy at the machinery buying time and only with it you can pay the uranium cost.

GAME MODES

“Fast mode”: every uranium card gets one point and requests less requirements.
“Advanced mode”: Uranium cards value is between 2 to 4 points and different requirements.

The remaining cards will be hidden under the first card


Improve the machinery you own:

Paying the improvement cost you can turn around a card each turn. The improvement will result in certain progress and changes in the accumulated energy.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Economic, Environmental, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: HUGERMUGER
description:
It is an insane card game with random challenges.

You will take part in battles, play the game while standing, clap your hands, and even speak with an accent. The goal of all this mess is to follow the rules and get rid of the cards in hand, but keep in mind that failing the challenge or rule makes you to pick more cards in your hand and distances you from the victory. And to raise the bar, you will play on a number of game fields and stick to some unusual rules...

The game is easy to learn and serves as a handy entertainment to you, your friends and your family.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Humor, Party Game

name: Ludus Romanus
description:
Supposedly themed on a Roman game Ludus Latrunculorum, this is a simple abstract game of moving tiles and capture. The board is designed as a Roman mosaic. Rules in English, German, French, Italian and Japanese.

From the publisher:

Ludus Romanus is a challenging game of strategy for two players, the aim of which is to surround and entrap each one of your opponent’s sixteen playing tiles whilst avoiding capture yourself.

Ludus Romanus is based on what is known of the ancient Roman game of Ludus Latrunculorum (the game of brigands), mentioned by Varro, Ovid and Saleius Bassus. Judging by the number of boards and playing pieces found in Roman sites, Ludus Latrunculorum appears to have been an extremely popular game, played extensively throughout the Roman Empire.

In Ludus Romanus we aim to capture the spirit of an ancient Roman pastime whilst providing a contemporary game that is challenging and fun to play.

name: Down the Tubes
description:
Down the Tubes is basically Chinese Checkers with a twist.

The six sections that make up the board can be rearranged in a great number of ways to make play unpredictable. Simply put, some of the spaces you move your pegs to are deeper than the others, so your peg falls out of the game. You may then use this space as your piece stands on the last piece. You must choose your movement carefully and try to remember which spaces are safe!

name: Trench: World War I Trench Warfare Rules
description: A set of rules for World War I land combat at two scales: Divisional Attacks, where each figure represents 40 to 45 men, and Trench Raids, where each figure represents one man. The rules cover Runners, Field Telephones, Mines, Gas Attacks, Artillery, and Tanks.

name: Negamco Pro Basketball Game
description: A stat-driven basketball game for two players. Early Negamco sets offered stats for the NBA and ABA. Variant rules and cards for college play were also available for use with the base game.

name: Staccups
description: Race your opponent against the clock to see who is the fastest at stacking their cups! Colour co-ordinated, this fast-paced game is all about reaction times and hand eye co-ordination. Will you be the first to stop the clock with your cups colour co-ordinated? Great fun for all the family!
publishers: Broadway Toys LTD, Game Factory, Peliko Oy

name: Trivial Pursuit: Welcome to America Edition
description:
A subsidiary card set for use with the Master Game, contains 500 cards and 3000 questions and answers in six categories:
AMERICA deals with geography, landmarks, flora and fauna.
AMERICANS calls foe the names of prominent Americans in a variety of fields.
JOURNEY THROUGH AMERICA is a trip through history, both serious and light.
SHIP TO SHORE reflects early exploration, immigration and the contributions of various groups to American culture.
MADE IN AMERICA draws upon art, literature, entertainment, and inventions flowing from American talent and expertise.
THE MELTING POT embraces the gamut of the American experience, touching upon all walks of life.

NOTE FROM BOX: A portion of the price of this edition goes toward the restoration of the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Regency
description:
Game for 2 to 4 players which combines strategy with a setting of medieval war and intrigue among the Scottish clans.

You are a Clan Chief trying for the regency of Scotland. You can attack other peoples pieces, & depending on whose territory you attack them in they could be injured, captured or killed. Along with attempting to gain the crown, and sabotaging your rivals attempts, you must also try not to get cursed by the witch, for then your lineage would end with your current Heir.
publishers: Baronage Press, Pegasus Associates Limited, Pegasus Spiele

name: Carnival: Wild! Die
description:
NOTE: The Carnival: Wild! Die is an expansion for the base Carnival game.

In the regular (base) Carnival game, players roll three dice and choose two of them to assign to the tableau and take the assigned actions based on the the value rolled:

1 = Deck Draw
2 = Discard Draw
3 = Hand Draw
4 = Hand Trade
5 = Midway Trade
6 = Midway Steal

The Carnival: Wild! Die a way to add even more re-playability to Carnival. This die can REPLACE one of the three used in the base game. It is rolled with the two other regular dice. If Wild! Die lands on values 1-5, then the regular actions associated with the value can be performed. However, if the "!" side (this is where the "6" normally is) is rolled, then any value can be assigned to it and that action taken!

name: Gold Train
description:
Frontier discovery, labor shortages and gold mines are the focus of Gold Train. This game forces difficult decisions and often unpleasant player interaction. Set in the Old West of the USA.

The game board is constructed by the players at the start of the game. During the setup, initial terrain tiles are placed (mostly face down) starting at the center of the board and moving out in rings (similar to Twilight Imperium: Third Edition). Only a portion of the tiles are uncovered at the start and the board is different every game.

Players bid for starting areas and play begins.
Players search (or discover) terrain (similar to the search process used in 2038: Tycoons of the Asteroid Belt). This phase also allows players to apply various counters that affect terrain (help themselves or hurt other players) and to discover mines.
Then players use labor that they have procured to build tracks.
Finally, players get paid. If a player has track to a mine, the railroad services the mine and collects income. Coal mines pay the least and Gold mines pay the most.

But watch out for the Dalton Boys or the Clinton gang.

name: OpenSpace: the game of corporate pawns
description:
OpenSpace: the game of corporate pawns is a board game where players take on a role of corporate employees racing for a promotion and struggling with burnout syndrome during a fast paced gameplay using pawns, cards and a board.

During the gameplay, the actions you take will affect your career and stress levels. You win the game when you reach maximum of your career level before other players do. However, reaching the maximum of stress level, makes you lose immediately.

During each round of the game, you secretly decide whether you will work normally, work hard or relax and have a break. Working hard will get you closer to promotion, but even more close to burnout - that is why sometimes you need to relax during working hours. When relaxing, you are at risk of being denounced to superiors by your fellow players. What is more – each time a denouncing person proves right, his or her career thrives. Still, you can gain an upper hand by using event cards such as air-conditioning breakdown, deadline or annual report.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: First to Find!
description:
First To Find! is a two to four person geocaching themed card game that can be played in 20-30 minutes. The game captures the excitement of the international sport, Geocaching! The game features stunning, original artwork and comes in a collector's tin box!

Object: Instead of standard suits, "FTF!" features cards suited to the seasons - fall, spring, summer, and winter. Players then use a combination of Gear (e.g. bug spray), Movement (e.g. sled) and Obstacle (e.g. spider) cards in the appropriate season of play to out-trick their opponents and race to become the first person to find the treasure, a.k.a "cache."

name: conQUIZtador
description:
The boardgame combines knowledge, luck and strategy and it's been created on 4 levels: beginnner, average, advanced and expert. The game is made up of 720 questions from all areas. 480 of quick questions proove that in order to win you don't require only knowledge.

Try your luck with the quick questions and you may win more territories.

Box contents:

- 1 board, 1 die, game instructions
- 57 counters for the regions
- 9 counters for the castle
- 4 counters that keep track of the round
- 60 game cards: multiple answer questions which contain 720 questions and 2880 possible answers.
- 30 game cards: quick questions which contain 480 questions
- 16 "answer" game cards for the multiple answer questions
- 4 "answer" game cards for the quick questions

name: Box of Lies
description:
Box of Lies is a bluffing game of hilarious objects, based on the Box of Lies game played on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon.

On their turn, a player secretly opens one of the mystery boxes and looks at the card inside. The player will now describe the peculiar object on the card to their opponent—and either lie about it or tell the truth, depending on whether they flipped the Truth or Lie tile.

The challenge for the player is to convince the opponent that they're lying when they're actually telling the truth, or conversely, appearing to tell the truth when they are actually lying. Players who are able to trick their opponent will win the round; failure to do so means that the opponent wins.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Stop the Robots
description:
The chief of the special unit is calling you on a walkie-talkie: "We have a massive problem! A mad scientist has dumped crazy robots in the city! You are the only ones who can stop this threat. I will connect you with your partner on site in a moment. Together you have to deactivate the robots. Hurry up! Time is running out!"

In Stop the Robots, you must communicate with your partner on site to look through the robot cards and figure out which robot you are dealing with. Solve the tricky puzzles and tell your partner which wires to cut in order to deactivate the robot!

name: Chancellorsville
description:
This is an Empires at War series game from Joe Miranda.

Command control, morale, choice of combat tactics are given great attention. This covers the battle for the period 1 May 1863 thru 6 May 1863 in 21 turns. There is one large 34x22 map of which half+ is for Chancellorsville and the remainder is Plevna.

name: One Word
description:
From the Publisher:

To play One Word, players are asked to give correct answers to five separate sets of clues, scoring one point for each correct answer. For example, points are won if the clue “A Reindeer and A Cleaning Compound” lead to the answer “Comet.” Other examples:
A Popular Musical and A Midwestern City
To Remove Dirty Dishes and A Large Motor Vehicle
A Creature of the Night and Something You Swing
A One-Word-Named Pop Singer and A Color.
If the answers given are Comet, Chicago, Bus, Bat and Pink, five points are won. But, players must be quick to shout answers before the unique “Spin Time” spinner stops spinning.

name: DuckTales
description:
Uncle Scrooge and his nephews are after a tropical island treasure. Big Time Beagle, Magica De Spell and Flintheart Glomgold are after them! Can they escape to the helicopter with the gold?

This is a track game based on the DuckTales TV show (itself based on the comic books of Carl Barks, but I digress). On a turn, you spin the spinner and advance along the paths the number indicated. If you spin a number with a picture of a Bad Guy, you move the Bad Guy's pawn the number indicated in addition to your own move. A Bad Guy that passes over or lands on the same space as your pawn captures you and sends you to the Bad Guy's Hiding Space. When you reach the Treasure Space you collect a Treasure token and the first player to reach the Finish Space with a Treasure token wins.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme
publishers: Majora, MB Jeux, MB Juegos, MB Spellen, Milton Bradley, Sallent hnos, S.A.

name: Super Dungeon Arcade
description:
The Midnight Tower, the Arcade Mode standalone game reveals the dreaded armies of The Midnight Queen. Armies of baroque-armored Nether Elves issue forth from the corrupted Tower of the Goddess. Within their ranks, cursed Spider Speakers summon scuttling hordes of spiders, spinning webs of shadow and poisoning their foes. Alongside them march powerful Knights of the Tower on spectral steeds, while Tower Stalkers lurk in the shadows weakening the mightiest Heroes, before their fellows strike the final blow. Three new Heroes take up the call to adventure: the rugged Hearthsworn Tincan, sneaky Cat Burglar, and brutal Riftling Warrior.

Super Dungeon: Arcade is a mighty fusion of The Midnight Tower Level Box, Midnight Tower Dungeon Tiles, and Super Dungeon: Arcade rules.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Ostindien Company
description:
Unowned clipper ships race back to Europe with valuable exotic goods. Players have secret interests in various ships and play cards to move them.

Not to be confused with Dan Glimne's Ostindiska kompaniet.

name: Dragon War
description:
Dragon War is a roll-and-move boardgame in which the board (basically a linear path) is built with cards. Each card depicts a fantasy creature along with 3 board spaces (e.g. the Pegasus card contains a "Safe Haven" space, a "Trade Places with Next Player Forward" space, and a "Fly Forward Three Squares" space). There are several expansions available to extend the basic set.

FROM THE BOX COVER:
The Legend... The ancient King of Dragons, Marloon, has died leaving the Dragon Throne open for the first time in ten thousand years. The surviving dragons are thrust into a war to determine who will be king. As the mighty creatures battle, a few brave adventurers search for Marloon's castle. Legends say that if a champion finds the throne room, before the Dragon War ends, they shall rule the dragon empire. Who will it be?
- Complete game in every box.
- Up to 6 players ready to start.
- Easy game play for beginners.
- 36 Strategy cards challenge advanced gamers.
- Battle each other and the game board.
- Endless pattern feature, never play the same game.
- Explosive fast paced action.
- Unlike any other card game.
- Larger and bolder art.
- Alpha set is singed and numbered.
- 10% of the games come with an orignial fantasy sketch.
- A 40 card art gallery from world famous artist Robert A. Kraus.
- 40 fantasy game cards that form a board.
- 6 unique character tiles.
- 6 unique character cards.
- 6 death counters.
- 6 death grids.
- 1 die.
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Penny Dreadfuls of Victorian London
description:
Penny Dreadfuls were short illustrated periodicals, very popular in the United Kingdom in the second half of the nineteenth century.
They were very cheap booklets, costing just one copper penny and offering short stories with vivid and popular themes narrated with an emphatic and sensationalist style.
Despite the low cultural value, Penny Dreadfuls gave birth to a genre that has constantly evolved to this day.

In Penny Dreadfuls of Victorian London: Sensational Tales of Terror, 1 to 5 players will share bizarre and frightening tales masterfully narrated by our authors, set in gloomy Victorian London in the late 19th century, infamous for the mysterious serial murders in the neighborhoods of Whitechapel and Whitehall.

In each Sensational Tale, specific Characters living in an ordinary Victorian world are suddenly embroiled in shocking events that catapult them out of reality and natural conventions. By joining them, players face a bizarre scenario, investigating, making deductions and choices,
facing trials leading to unpleasant consequences or handsome rewards.

Each game has a variable number of turns with different possible outcomes, ranging from miserable failure to utter and satisfying success, all depending on how the players interpret the story, sharing the fate of their Stars.

—description from the publisher

name: Globo Game
description: Players try to take best shares of audience and, hence, get more money in this game, named after the biggest television network of Brazil.

name: Dashing Donkey
description:
The stubborn donkey has left for the market all on its own! The players hurry to fill the basket the donkey is carrying with their fruits before the Dashing Donkey crosses the bridge. By playing cards that feature the players fruits the players are allowed to put their fruits in the basket. At the same time the bridge is built. The cards will also bring forth surprises that will slow you down or help you load the donkey. When the Dashing Donkey has crossed the bridge the game ends and the player who loaded the most fruits wins. A magnificent three dimensional bridge and wooden playing pieces guarantee many funny moments with the Dashing Donkey game.

Awards

2002 Ãrets BÃ¸rnespil, Childrens Game of the Year Denmark
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Farming

name: Mint Control: Crowdfunder's Hall Promo
description: Exclusive location for Kickstarter backers.

name: World Cup Soccer USA 94
description: This is a fairly simple Soccer game where shots are allowed only from certain positions on the board. There are cards for goals, fouls, and even trivia and rules if you want to add those for learning experience.

name: Bridge for One
description:
A solitaire Bridge variant that uses a partially marked deck that shows the suits on the backs of the cards. Play is organized on a printed plastic play mat and scored on a provided scorepad.

Bidding is very simplified and the emphasis is on card play.

name: Playoff
description:
It's a simulation of basketball game. There are two fields in the box, so it's possible to play two matches together.
Every 3 seconds of virtual time the player can have an action with one of his players. They can throw, pass, move with the ball, move without the ball, try to steal the ball.
After a missed throw it is possible to get the rebound and start a new action.
The players have some special attitudes that make them specialists in rebounds, defending, passing, throwing or moving with the ball.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Phase Order

name: Avis de TempÃªte
description: Following a violent storm, certain marine birds became lost and disorientated: the aim of the game is to find the lost birds and re-group them. The game aims to improve children’s awareness of marine wildlife preservation, while keeping children surprised and amused by the original and innovative idea of the game, including an element of co-operation between players. Information cards are included for each of the eight marine birds used in the game, these have been made with the help of the LPO (Ligue Protectrice des Oiseaux). Three imaginary birds are also included in the game, leaving room for imagination.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Environmental

name: Ausgetrickst...
description: The exciting league game about winning, points and management. For Ages 8 and up. Not a game of luck - good tactics and proper strategy lead to a winning outcome.

name: Motor Mouth
description: Players try to complete a trip around the circular track by successfully reading tongue twisters while competing against the ticking timer. Opponents can secretly set the timer for random periods so players never know how much time remains.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling

name: Leapin' Letters
description: Players try to obtain the plastic letters necessary to spell a nonsensical word printed on the player's card. These letters are drawn from the lid of the plastic container the game comes in. If a player draws a letter that he doesn't need, it is placed into a plastic device which catapults it into the air when a lever is hit, and any player who needs the letter to complete their word tries to catch it as it came down. First player to complete their word wins.

name: The People's Choice: A Presidential Card Game
description:
Based on The History Channel special "The Presidents", The People's Choice features forty-three presidents and highlights their personality, interests, management style, defining moments, and legacy. Learn unusual and interesting facts about the leaders of the USA while enjoying the dynamic of putting "your" president up for election to see if he wins.

Contains:
6 White House Player Screens
43 Presidents cards
15 Category cards
1 custom party die
30 voting coins
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Political

name: Emperor Napoleon
description:
Emperor Napoleon is strategic level Japanese wargame on Napoleon's campaigns .

First published as one of the Series: SS (Sho-Kikaku) in 1989.
Republished in Command Magazine Japan #119 in 2014.

name: Blank Expression
description:
Ages 12 and up


of PLAYERS: 2-4 players or teams


OBJECT OF THE GAME:
Players accumulate points by filling in the missing word or words in quotes or by identifying the famous people the quotes are by or about.

EQUIPMENT:
The game includes a card holder, 64 two-sided game cards, two card screens, seven scoring pegs, and a minute timer.

TYPES of QUOTES:
There are three types of quotes in the game--
1) quotes in which one or more words have been replaced by "[BLANK]";
2) quotes about a person to be identified, which have the nouns or pronouns referring to that person underlined;
3) quotes by a person who must be identified

RULES OF PLAY:
Each game card has three categories of quotes. (EX. History, Author, Movers and Shakers) A player (or team) slides down game screen to reveal one quote in one category. All players can hear and see the quote. The current player can make a guess as to the answer, scoring points if correct, and losing points if incorrect. The player can also pass. If the player passes or is incorrect, play passes on clockwise to the next player.

OTHER NOTES:
The gamebox says that this stand-alone game is "a sequel to 'Quote, Unquote', chosen 'Best New Trivia Game' by GAMES magazine, 1994."

name: Railrally
description:
Interesting railroad race game for children. Players choose a locomotive in one of four colors. The object of the game is to move your loco from start to finish along the rail of your color. The catch? The board is made up of sliding pieces with a section of each of the railroads. When you roll to move, you can either move or move the rail lengths to make your color line as long as possible (or to break up an opponents' line!) and move, depending on the die roll. First to the end of the line wins.
Game components are interesting and colorful. Like all the best childrens games, it teaching simplified elements of strategy and planning. A pretty good game that adults might enjoy playing with the kids.

name: Stack'em
description:
The game's objective is to be the first to place three pieces in a row. A four-ringed board perches on top of a post. Players take time rolling the die, then placing one of their pieces on the ring indicated by the die roll. The uppermost two rings can be twisted. One die result is to twist these rings--without toppling the board and the pieces. Once each player has placed all their pieces on the board, the player with the most lines of 3 pieces wins the game.

Similar to:

Topple
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Stacking and Balancing
publishers: Chad Valley Co Ltd., Maple Toys

name: UNO: New York Yankees
description:
A series of Uno variants based on assorted major league baseball teams.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The Yankee Stadium Card. If a Draw 2 or Draw 4 card is played against you, play this card to block it. After discarding the Yankee Stadium card, designate a color of your choice and play resumes. This card can also be played at any time as a Wild card; you do not need to use it to block a Draw card. This card can also be played as your last card. The point value of the Yankee Stadium card is 50 points.
publishers: Fundex, Mattel, Inc., Sababa Toys, Inc.

name: Ninjas vs. Pirates
description:
Simple trick-taking card game utilizing the UDE points cards of the World of Warcraft TCG.

All UDE Points cards can be used to play a mini-game that will change every few sets. The mini-game for the Heroes of Azeroth release is Pirates vs. Ninjas.

name: Greedy Gorilla
description:
Players compete to be the first one to fill their playing board with the cards that make up a healthy meal.

Players take turns to draw food cards from the face down pile, a healthy food card that matches their board can be kept. A healthy food card that does not match must be put back face down.

However, a junk food card must be posted into the mouth of the gorilla, who gives a loud burp as each piece goes in.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Humor, Memory

name: MathAnimals
description: MathAnimals is an exciting game that teaches and reinforces addition, subtraction and multiplication skills for children of all ages. With the roll of a die, players race around the colorful game board trying to land their playing piece on the animal that represents the highest number. Then they either add, subtract or multiply the number on the die to the number they have landed on. The first to reach the "winning goal", a pre-set number that can change with each new game, is the winner! With more than 6 variations of game play, MathAnimals will continue to stimulate learning and grow with your child for years to come. Ages 5 and up

name: Match and Move
description: Each player must try to move his four pieces across the board to the opposite side. The winner is the first player to do so. There is no "taking" or removing shapes from the board, and there must never be more than one piece on any square. Players have to match shape or color to move.

name: Picture Millionaire
description:
Picture Millionaire is the exciting update to Who Wants To Be A Millionaire and now gives you the chance to test your wits against your friends and family. Containing new picture & question cards in the familiar Millionaire format, now played on a board, includes all the usual lifelines plus answer tokens and a new 'take the money' option.

A game based on the Number One Quiz Show but now with a unique and exciting twist! Adding a new dimension to the tension and thrill of the original game, Picture Millionaire uses a wide range of images to challenge your general knowledge skills.

A game for up to 8 players, where each person takes it in turn to act as the host.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Playmobil: Ritter-Rennen
description:
A mighty, evil Knight has occupied the castle and taken the princess prisoner. Now, the most courageous knight in the whole country try to cross the moat as quickly as possible in order to free the poor princess.

There is a separate track for each player that leads to the castle. if a player rolls a 1-3 he can lay the corresponding number of bridge-cards along his track or move his knight. You can only move your knight on squares on which there is already a bridge card. If the player rolls the symbol "hand", he may steal any bridge-card from another player.

As soon as a player succeeds in moving his knight onto the last square on his track he has won.

The game includes a promotional playmobil(R)-figure.

name: Scrabble: Pirates of the Caribbean Edition
description: This is the same version of Scrabble you would find in any toy store, but this version includes round tiles, and a variant where you can prevent your opponent from taking her turn. One tile is placed on a special space on the edge of the board, and if you can place a word using that tile, you can cause your opponent to lose a turn.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: Loose Change
description: Loose Change is a card game of counting money. On their turn, players add to the cards face down in the middle, trying to add up to a dollar. If you complete the dollar, you earn the cards. But be careful not to bust--- for if you do, these cards count as negative points! Whoever has the most positive piles at the end is the winner.

name: Bolero
description:
From the box cover:

"Bolero - a tactical game for two.

A rousing, ingeniously simple game, where winning demands all your acuity and maneuvering skills."

Players take turns to place their markers on the board. Both players have 64 markers numbered 1-4, 16 of each. The board is a 4x4 grid of 2x2 squares numbered 1-4. The played marker always goes to a square with a same number.

The player who first creates

1. a row of 4 same numbers horizontally, vertically or diagonally,

2. a row of 4 different numbers horizontally, vertically or diagonally or

3. a 2x2 square of 4 different numbers

with his own markers wins the game.

name: Seattle (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This fan-made expansion of the core Ticket to Ride game (by Alan R. Moon) focuses on the development of automobile, bus, and train routes in the single metropolitan city of Seattle.

This game is made available as a print and play expansion for Ticket to Ride and may not be produced for commercial reasons.

Ticket to Ride is a registered trademark of Days of Wonder and used by permission for this non-commercial variant.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Dolfje Weerwolfje: Het bordspel
description:
From the publisher:

Dolfje Weerwolfje is on an adventure with Boura, Timmie and Dad. They're looking for Grandpa Werewolf, who's never afraid of anything. But hunters tricked him and now he's locked in a chicken coop. Now you are either Dolfje Weerwolfje, Noura, Timmie or Dad and you're trying to save Grandpa Werewolf as quickly as you can. But of course, you have to transforn into a werewolf first! Be the first to release Grandpa Werewolf from his cell to win the game.

This is a game based on the popular books by Paul van Loon, about a little boy who's actually a werewolf. It's a simple 'roll and move', where cards replace the dice. The board is divided into day, twilight and night. During the day, players have to become werewolves. During the night, they have to find the items necessary to save Grandpa Werewolf. The 'twilight' part of the board serves as a second chance, where players can try to get the things they miss to finish either day or night.

name: Hoksotin
description:
Hoksotin is a game where you spin a Twister-type spinner, that tells you what you'll need to find from the board, for example you'll have to find "Something round". In limited time you'll try and find as many round things as possible, marking the ones you already found with sticky little chips in you color. When the time runs out the chips are removed and correct ones are scored on your personal scoreboard. The one that gets most points in the limited number of rounds is the winner. There are 3 different two-sided boards with the art that is very appealing to the children.

Hoksotin was one of the finalists in the "Vuoden perhepeli 2010" -competion. (The Best Family Game of 2010).

name: Spelloker
description: The card game that combines the fun of word building with the excitement of poker! The Spelloker deck contains 104 letter cards divided into three suits/colour. The object of Spelloker is to win chips from other players by creating the best poker style hand ... or bluffing your opponents into thinking you have the best hand.

name: FrankenDie: Mad Scientists' Guild Expansion
description: The Mad Scientists' Guild Expansion consists of 12 character cards, with unique special abilities that will bring an additional, unique element into the FrankenDie game, with an extra serving of theme for added flavor.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Variable Player Powers

name: Fifty Shades of Grey: Red Room Expansion Pack
description:
Add some extra spice to your Fifty Shades of Grey party game with the expansion pack that promises to raise the stakes in this outrageously fun party game, and will have everyone talking long after the game has finished.

The games contains:
- 200 Red Room Questions
- 1 die
- 1 rulebook
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Novel-based, Party Game

name: The Cottonwood Contest
description:
Your parents have given each of their children a part of the family farm in the small but growing town of Cottonwood. You have three years to show that you can make your share profitable. You may plant corn and grain, raise animals, and gather berries and herbs from the countryside. You may sell goods at each of the three Markets, and enter the income in your ledger. The sibling who has the most money in their ledger after the third year wins the contest, and will receive the remainder of the family farm. [Source: rules]

In The Cottonwood Contest, players develop their farms by plowing fields, planting corn and grain, building pastures, raising animals, weaving baskets, and gathering herbs and berries. Double-ended farm cards depict the choices for what the farmers may do with their day.

There are three scoring phases, triggered by drawing a market card. Prices for each item fluctuate, and players must determine the best time to sell their items. Corn and grain may be sold, or used to raise sheep and cows. Players may sell the wool from their sheep and the milk from their cows, or the sheep and cows themselves. Players may sell berries and herbs, or make the berries into jam and dry the herbs to sell at a later market.

The player who has the most money in their ledger after the third market is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Farming, Print & Play

name: Figuratzy
description: An abstract dice game, where there are 10 dice. There are 5 different figures and three different colors. Player rolls all the dice and chooses the matching pairs. The same figure and the same color are worth 3 points, same figures in different color are worth 1 point. Then the player can reroll the remaining dice and repeat the pair matching. If there are no pairs, then the player scores 0 points for that round. If the player voluntarily stops, then he scores points for the pairs and minus 1 for each unused die. When someone gets 100 points, each other player has one turn. The highest score wins.

name: Transformers
description:
The Autobots and the Decepticons are at war, trying to occupy newterritories and set up bases across planet Earth!

Be the first to capture four territories by leading your Autobots or Decepticons into battle. As Commander, it’s your job to pick the most powerful Robot on each territory.

As an attacker choose a territory you think you can conquer with the Robots in your hand. Choose the Robot (or pair of Robots) that you want to use to win that territory and place them face down on the table. When both sides have played, turn over your Robot cards, count your power ratings. The highest score takes the territory.

Every Robot has two power numbers and Special Skills shown by the colours on his card. If your Robot’s skill colours match all the battle skill colours needed on that Territory, use the large number as your power rating. If they don’t, or you don’t have all the colours, the smaller number is that Robot’s power rating this turn. The highest number wins.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Watch Ya' Mouth: NSFW Expansion #1
description:
Enjoy our thick, dirty, long-lasting…phrase cards. (Why, what did you think we were going to say?) Get your mind out of the gutter and our cheek retractors into your mouth. C’mon, the kids are asleep. Put Watch Ya Mouth NSFW Expansion Pack #1 deep inside your cart. Warning: may be too intense for some players. Can you handle it?

Watch Ya’ Mouth, The Original Mouthguard Party Game, is authentic and hilarious. Often imitated, never duplicated.
3-10 players
Hampered by cheek retractors, teams attempt to read and interpret silly phrases, like:
Mother f∪©k!ng penguins.
Pop my butt pimple.
Bubba Gump is a backdoor bandit.

Watch Ya’ Mouth NSFW Expansion Pack #1 comes with 143 depraved, explicit phrases. Our cards are strong and durable for years of hysterics and beer spills.

name: Sugar Cubes
description:
Get ready to add some spice to your game night with Spicy Games!
Each of the spice bottles hold all of the pieces you need to play a game. Each game takes 2 minutes to learn and 10 minutes to play.

Sweeten your fun with Sugar Cubes, the quick and easy game of words and wit. Sprinkle out the dice and spoon on a little creativity to beat the timer and taste sweet victory.

On a turn, a player rolls all 8 dice and then turns them so they can see the letters. The player to their right flips the timer.
The active player then has 20 seconds to come up with a grammatically correct sentence. Each word must start with one of the letters shown on the dice. While making the sentence, the player lines up the dice in the order they have used them in.

Players score 5 points for each die used.
If a player manages to use 7 dice they score 40 points.
If a player uses 8 dice they score 50 points

The player with the most points after 7 rounds wins

name: Chicks go Boom!
description: Roll the die to see which chickens you can chuck into the coop but move quickly before the coop jumps up and they all fly out. It’s a race to see who can round up their chickens first in this rowdy cluck-cluck game.

name: Monopoly: Treasures of Greece
description: Special edition by Shell with the most valuable monuments of Greece.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Castle Assault: Fell Fire Forge
description:
Castle Assault is a unique gaming experience combining the ferocious onslaught of Tower Defense games with the strategic elements of CCGs and progressive advancement of RPG's. Castle Assault seeks to break the mold of traditional card games and organically extracts the most enjoyable parts of these different genres and distill them into a standalone concept. Castle Assault plays in about 30 mins, and is for 1 or 2 Players.

Draft warbands, upgrade heroes and craft legendary weapons as you battle an inferno of horrors on an epic quest to forge your destiny. As a 100% stand alone Castle Assault expansion that can be 100% integrated into Castle Assault, the Fell Fire Forge introduces 4 new Warbands and an completely epic, non-linear branching solo campaign like you have never seen!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Medieval, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing

name: Zombie Slam
description:
Zombie Slam is an app-assisted card game!

You must survive four days by scavenging a new location, exploring the rooms, and collecting supply cards to fill your backpack. Listen carefully and use your hand to slam a stack where the top supply card matches the request. If you fail to fill a backpack or overcome the hazards you've encountered by the end of the day, you become a zombie. That doesn't mean your game is over as the undead can rise again and win by infecting the most stragglers! Zombie Slam is played over four rounds with all players acting simultaneously, and each round consists of ten turns.

There is also an optional smart device app to guide the play, which also turns Zombie Slam into a movie-like experience!
mechanics: Modular Board, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: ã­ããã¼ãºããã°ã (Neko Cheese Wo Ubae)
description:
User summary
ã­ããã¼ãºããã°ã (Neko Cheese Wo Ubae) is a Japanese card game. Players become mice who scheme to steal away the cat’s collection of cheese. Neko Cheese Wo Ubae means 'steal the cat's cheese'.

You should aim for the cat with the most cheese but be wary that your fellow mice players be go after the same target. If the targeted cat notices your combined thievery, both players will be unable to receive any stolen cheese.

Neko Cheese Wo Ubae is a game of retreat, and reading your opponents. At the end of the game, the mouse with the most cheese is the winner.

Publisher's summary
