Players whose trick indicator cards were face-down get one point for each trick that they took. Players who took exactly as many tricks as noted on their trick indicator card get a 3 point bonus.

Openly declared trick indicator cards:
Players whose trick indicator cards were turned face-up only get points get if they take exactly as many tricks as they predicted. If they fulfill this condition, their score is equal to the number of tricks they took multiplied by 2 plus the 3 point bonus.

Goal of the game
The goal of the game is to have the most points at the end of the game.

name: KÃ¶nig Laurin
description: Deep inside his crystal castle the mysterious King Laurin prevails since legendary times. His subjects are dwarves, who dig treasures from rock, in order to fill his vaults. In the wonderful garden of the king the dwarves show their lord the most precious treasures to rise in his favor. But only few will succeed in acquiring liberty ....

name: Monopoly: Milk Chocolate Game
description:
This version of Monopoly plays very similar to the normal rules, albeit with a smaller board containing just 12 properties. What makes this version particularly special is that the tokens, houses, and hotels are all foil-wrapped chocolate candies.

To start, each player is given $1,000 and all properties are dealt out much like a standard Short Game (although it is of course possible to play a standard game). There is only one die to roll, so you cannot get in or out of Jail with doubles; instead, rolling a 6 or paying $100 gets you out. Only two houses are needed before a hotel can be built, and the interest rate is fixed at $40.

The winner of the game gets not only the satisfaction of having won over his or her opponents, but also has the privilege of consuming all the chocolate.

Unlike the later Monopoly: Chocolate, this version is perfectly playable post-chocolate consumption through borrowing the same tokens, houses, and hotels from another Monopoly game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Kakuro: The Board Game
description:
Kakuro: The Boardgame is a one-to-four player game involving of the competitive solving of over 100 Kakuro puzzles. On a given turn, players have sixty seconds to find the solution for a particular section of the puzzle or to challenge an opponent's answer. Once the entire puzzle has been completed (or three players have "timed out" in succession), players consult the solution and score points for each correct answer. The player who filled in the most correct answers wins!

Contained within the box: Instruction book, puzzle booklet, 3D game board, clear plastic overlay, 4 dry erase markers, egg timer, small chamois (for wiping the board between games)
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition
publishers: Alga, Identity Games International B.V., Pressman Toy Corp.

name: De Kolonisten van Catan: Wegwerpcatan
description:
Wegwerpcatan ("disposable Catan") is a free promotional version of Settlers of Catan, given away by Dutch publisher 999 Games.

The game is completely made of paper and can be used a few times. Rules are simplified: no cards are used in this version, no robber. The player who gets to 7 points wins.

Instead of dice, Wegwerpcatan uses a spinner which you have to assemble yourself. Every player has a set of tiles to rotate and represent the number of resources you own or gain. The board layout is fixed, as are the positions of the starting settlements and roads.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Memory, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Trading

name: Bop It! Smash
description:
Taken from the game's official web page on Hasbro.com:

Bop It! is a brand that has built success on a simple concept: challenging your reaction time. Using a handheld game unit, players follow easy voice commands quickly and precisely, or they lose. It is straightforward and positively addictive! Bop It Smash takes the action one step further with moving lights, playing on an arcade theme that’s impossible to resist.

Time it right and smash the light! With BOP IT SMASH, colored lights in the center of the game unit fly back and forth while you do your best to capture one in the Zone. It’s active and fun – you and your friends will keep playing until you smash those lights every time!

name: Monopoly: Halo Collector's Edition
description: Join Master Chief on a campaign to gain control of critical locations and legendary assets from the Halo Universe in the special collector’s edition of Halo MONOPOLY. Use your wits to take command of Arcadia, the Covenant capital of High Charity, or even Earth itself.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: IÃÃ! Cthulhu! Fhtagn!
description:
As a cult leader in IÄÄ! Cthulhu! Fhtagn!, you want to build your cult's power by calling on the mighty Cthulhu. With the help of tentacles symbolized on dice faces and even the volume of your spoken voice, invoke the great elders to your bidding, gaining power points that raise you above all other religions. But beware! Not only are rivals against you. If in your appeal the elder signs do not appear, even the mighty Cthulhu will rise up against you.

By combining two copies of IÄÄ! Cthulhu! Fhtagn!, you can play the game with up to six players.

name: Masters of the Universe Pop-Up Game
description:
He-man, the most powerful man in the universe, encounters numerous dangers as he travels to the fortress of power and mystery, castle Grayskull. He-man’s dream of ridding the planet Eternia of evil forces is jeopardized by the Lord of Destruction, Skeletor, and his evil sidekick, Beastman. As He-man crosses the treacherous terrain, Skeletor and Beastman, the Volcano Keepers seek to delay his journey to the mighty castle.

Using a spinner to determine how many squares they advance, the players travel freely across the 3D boardgame representing the lands of Eternia, until they reach one of the two crater-packed volcanos controlled by Skeletor and his aide. This two pieces are rotated each time a 6 is obtained on the spinner or a player falls in a square that orders it. Each time the volcanos are rotated, the crater squares changes its position. If a player falls on one of them, they must move back as much squares as it reads in the crater. Therefore, the player rotating the volcano can do it strategically in order to gain advantage over his competitors, making them fall in the craters. Once the volcanos are left behind, the first to reach the drawbridge of Grayskull wins the game.
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme
publishers: Clem Toys, Diset S. A., Peter Pan Playthings, Schmidt International, Schmidt Spiele, Whitman

name: Logo Lok!
description:
When the locomotive card is received, it begins the game.

Player picks a locomotive card. It ties to either of player.
It ties to the same color train.

When the locomotive card is lost, the player that has longest train wins.

A lovely illustration is card game by which the feature can play easily.

name: Ta Ziemia
description:
Ta Ziemia (This Land) is a family, cooperative board game. It allows players to move back to the year 1979 and participate in the preparations for the first pilgrimage of Polish Pope John Paul II to his homeland plunged in the complicated reality of communism.

The task set for the players in Ta Ziemia is not easy: they must confront the forces of the communist regime, which hinder the organization of the pilgrimage and try to diminish its importance. Players work together to help in preparations for the visit of John Paul II. Acting under pressure of time and the communist regime, players must show cleverness, imagination and the ability to predict opponent's next moves.

Box contains:
- Board
- 44 Renovation cards
- 44 Regime cards
- 10 Central regime cards
- 8 Special city rules cards
- 4 Faction cards
- 16 Citizen pawns
- 1 Time marker
- 15 Influence tiles
- 15 Faith tiles
- 15 Resistance tiles
- 30 Faithful tiles
- 8 Agent tiles
- Instruction

name: All In
description: Ice-breaker party game where a player chooses a true/false statement off a card (i.e."I have sung at karaoke bar," "I have never flunked a test") and the other players try to guess whether or not the card reader is telling the truth. They make their decision by placing chips on the either the'TRUE' or 'FALSE' halves of the board (there is no choice but to go 'all in.') Any chips bet on the wrong answer are discarded, and the last player to have any chips in play wins.
mechanics: Acting, Betting and Bluffing, Player Elimination

name: Bedlamb
description:
You are a sheep farmer. You have raised a surprisingly similar flock of sheep to all of your neighboring farms. Because of this none of you can tell who is the finest at raising sheep. A cunning contest of sheep trading results!

Each farmer secretly selects which sheep to trade with each neighbor, and which to send to the grazing fields. Lying and deception are of course the most important tools of any sheep trader. But beware – each farmer also has a wolf in his arsenal! Don't let the wool get pulled over your eyes!

Each card in Bedlamb contains unique flavor text, and upwards of 30% of them are better than that wool joke.
mechanics: Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: See you later ...
description:
See you later ... is a racing game for gamblers: Each player gets a pawn, puts it on the starting field of a race track, the first one in goal wins. In the middle of the board is a circle of 12 fields, where five different colored crocodiles are placed (belonging to no-one). There is also a deck of cards showing a number in the color of a crocodile. In their turn, a player reveals a card from this deck and sees if they can pull the corresponding crocodile the number of fields indicated by the card in clockwise order. This is possible, if the landing field is empty. After success, the player can decide to reveal another card and do the same. They can also decide to stop and move their pawn one field for every crocodile card which was revealed. But if it is not possible to move the crocodile, the player has to stop and give all cards already revealed to the next player. This player must reveal at least one card (if successful, they can move their pawn for all cards!). If a player in last place moves their pawn, they can double the value; a player in first place must move back, if they are not successful.

Some special action cards can also be used; they allow a player to stop only after an even number of cards revealed or force them to move back, etc.

The game is in German, but all components except the rules are language independent.

name: T-34
description:
Published in Strategy & Tactics magazine #23.

Eastfront armored combat with minatures (TAC3- 20mm) - using paper folded cards to represent the miniatures.

"Designer's Comments" from Arnold Hendricks:

Tac 3/20mm isn't exactly the most detailed miniature WWll land wargame around. In fact, it is really just a direct steal from TACTICAL GAME No. 3 of the TSG. What I hope it will do is provide that real bridge between board and miniatures, to get each side of the fence partly on the other. Miniature wargamers are going to find having combat factors and a CRT a bit strange, while board wargamers are going to find all those tank models and painted figures weird too. In fact, the lack of hexagons alone is startling enough.

The rules are neither complex nor comprehensive, if anything they were designed to be clear. This game is a 'quickie', fast to set up, almost as fast to play. For those tactical historians with the "what if--", it is a tool for endless answers. By now you should have enough organizational information to be able to set up various German and Russian formations using platoons and companies as building blocks. Pick your terrain and objectives, and have at it. If your imagination fails you, some reading into the real campaign and some of the battles should produce enough food for thought. For the fun-minded, I personally have a set of "orders" cards each containing an order of battle and a mission for one side. I set up a Russian and German deck before each battle, and thus players remain in the dark about enemy forces and objectives

For those who find Tac 3/20mm just a nice take-off point for 1944 vintage land miniatures, note that S&T does indeed have considerably more detailed and simulation-oriented rules around. I know because I have designed and tested one set myself! Naturally, all it takes is a lot of little notices from you to produce them in an upcoming issue.

name: Fox and Hounds
description: In this track game one player becomes the Fox and the others act as the Hounds. The Fox has the first move, spins the spinner, and advances along any path the number of spaces indicated. The Hounds then spin in turn, trying to capture the Fox by landing exactly on the space the Fox occupies. The Fox is safe on the Red track, but must move out on his next turn. If the Fox can reach the Fox's Den space by exact count, before being captured by one of the Hounds, he wins - otherwise the player whose Hound captures the Fox wins.

name: Zoodiak
description:
The players place their pieces on a central board trying to recreate the constellation patterns that appear on their cards in order to win.

The game comes with a cloth board, 20 double-sided wooden cylinders and 2 black cylinders (used for blocking board positions).

name: Battel
description:
An abstract dice game from the 1970's. The board is composed of three squares, the inner square having 9 spaces with the numbers 1, 2 or 3. The players throw two dice and place their chips according to the result. With a 6 a chip can be placed on one of the starting positions. From there it can be moved with the result of the 2nd dice. If a player lands on an occupied space, he can throw out the other chip. Only on the inner 9 spaces on the board, players can score in the end.
After all 9 inner spaces have been occupied, the game ends and the players count points by multiplying the number of chips with the according number it stands on.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Enclosure, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Uruk
description:
(From the publisher's site)

From prehistory to the invention of writing!

Uruk: Mesopotamian town, the cradle of writing!
Just over 5000 years ago, when the first game of chance ever discovered was already being played, a major event in the history of the world took place: man learnt to write!

Uruk: The card game combining the story and adventure of writing!
Easy, work in stages towards your ultimate goal: the invention of writing.
Fun, play special cards to slow down your opponent's progress or speed up your own.
Simple, suitable from 6 to 77+ years of age, each game lasts between 10 and 20 minutes.

name: Hamster Combat
description:
A 2-4 player card game with the fun theme of Combat Trained Hamsters! After printing out the game all you need to supply are four markers or stones per player.

Background: Little known amongst Humans is that Hamsters in the wild indulge in mortal and violent combat. Many schools of Hamster Martial arts have evolved. This clan like school system has lead to an annual competition between the schools where the best student of each school is placed into a deadly combat until only one remains.

Despite the domestication of Hamsters the combat school competition continues with Hamsters from all over the world taking part.

This card game represents this annual competition with each player taking the part of a Combat Hamster.

(from the website)

name: Monopoly: Ultimate James Bond Collector's Edition
description:
The World is Not Enough... or is it?

In this customizable edition of the monopoly game, you send Bond on assignment. Set up your game board and buy, sell and trade over 50 exotic locations, bases, and properties from the world of James Bond. All 22 Bond films are represented including Quantum of Solace. Which location will you place on Boardwalk: Casino Royale or Crab Key? You decide. With over one million possible combinations of locations, you’ll never play the same game twice. Use your decoder gadget to decipher the directives on the Bond Allies and Enemies cards. The Ultimate James Bond Edition of America’s favorite board game comes complete with 6 collectible pewter tokens featuring the Moonraker Shuttle, Octopus, Casino Royale Poker Chip, Zorin’s Airship, Q Boat and Moon Buggy.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation, Novel-based
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Rakete
description:
One of the "Easyplay Kids" series. This one is a simple dice-roller.

Each player has a set of five 6-sided dice showing one of five different monsters and a rocket. One monster is revealed at random from a deck of five cards and players simultaneously roll their dice (one at a time). The round ends when one player has four dice matching the monster on the card and the fifth die does not show the rocket.

The losers pay the winner in "Mars Maggot" tokens (to feed the monster). If they can't afford to pay then they must discard a "Rocket" token. The first player to lose all their rocket tokens loses the game; the Player with the most "Mars Maggot´s" win.

name: Tempt
description:
Tempt is the 8th game in Small Box Games Pure Card Line.

In Tempt, players are powerful warlords vying for control of a splintering empire. Players tempt powerful Cohorts to fight for their cause. The fleeting Temptresses grant the players additional special abilities. Tempt is a mix of strategy, tactics, and clever card play. The player controlling the largest portion of the kingdom after the conflict ends, wins the game.

Tempt takes place over several rounds of play. Each round, each player will receive 3 turns. A round always begins with players secretly selecting 2 Temptress cards to aid them for the round. The 3 facedown Cohort decks in the middle of the play area represent 3 areas of the kingdom, and each player controls a Column on his side of each area where he can Tempt powerful Cohorts, in attempts to gain and hold control of that area. The player with the strongest Column has Primacy in that area and is awarded extra points and actions. Cohorts may also be tempted as Chanters, granting the player additional abilities.

Due to the artwork on some of the cards, Tempt is not recommended for gamers under the age of 13.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Black Stories Junior: Purple Stories
description: How could that have happened? Purple Stories is a game similar to the Black Stories game series. The players try to reconstruct an obscure nightly event by asking, guessing and fiddling about. Only yes/no answers are allowed. This version of the black stories has mysteries related to various spooky nocturnal things.
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Fantasy, Party Game
publishers: G3, Gen-X Games, MINDOK, moses. Verlag GmbH

name: Balancespiel
description:
Balance game by Lidl, a wooden dexterity game were you stack wooden cilinders on a tilting turtle.

A big wooden turtle lays on its back forming an unstable half moon shaped base the feet kerp the cilinders from rolling of. You roll one die or both dice and add a cilinder of the rolled color on the turtle. If the cilinders drop you lose. A bit like animal upon animal but without cute animals and a rocking base.

name: Forest Adventure
description: Forest Adventure is a collecting and memory game.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Memory

name: Rebs & Yanks
description: Rebs & Yanks is a Tactical American Civil War card-wargame. Not a collectible card game. Requires two D6 (not included). Players start with hands of cards representing famous generals, terrain, and various kinds of army units. Players draw and discard until one feels strong enough to launch an attack. The battle is conducted with the assistance of dice and card modifiers and points are scored for victories. The game includes a standard game, advanced rules and also contains special options for reenacting four historical battles (Antietam, Stones River, The Wilderness and Kennesaw Mountain).
categories: American Civil War, Card Game, Civil War, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Monopoly: Zapped Edition
description:
Monopoly: Zapped Edition updates the classic game by combining the attributes a board-game with the technology of an iPad/Phone/Pod Application. The APP is free and is quick and easy to download from the APP store. The basic mechanics of Monopoly are here, but with an updated look and no hard currency. Players use the app to buy and auction property, transfer money, pull Chance/Community Chest cards and take part in mini-games as play evolves. Each player has their own touch-banking cards which track their balances and allow for electronic transaction on your device.

Game Board comes with Rubber Pads, 6 tokens, 28 Property cards, 32 green houses, 12 red hotels, 2 dice, 4 Monopoly Touch-banking cards and instructions.

Note: An internet connection/iTunes account are required to download the app but not for game-play. App is in English language only.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Winning Lines
description:
In round one, the host player picks a set of 6 questions from the booklet while placing the relevant 7 numbers (i.e. the answers) in front of the Wonderwall. The questions are asked and the first answer is taken from the first player (up to 6 players) to shout out any of the numbers. If correct, they take that number to use as a "pit stop" in the Wonderwall (up to 3). If incorrect, they lose a number into the discard pile or if the player has none, they are out of the round.

The host then picks a sheet of (both correct and incorrect) answers to place on the Wonderwall and hides them from view. The Wonderwall timer begins, the answers are revealed and the player is given 15 seconds to read all the answers, followed by three minutes in which the hosts reads up to 25 questions. Players must give an answer along with the number next to it to ensure they found the answer. If correct, they cross out the answer on the board and gain a point. At any time during the three minutes, the player may use a pit stop (up to 3) which allows the player another 15 seconds to read the answers.

The next player (or group of players) then plays their turn on the Wonderwall.
Play continues until a player wins by reaching a score of 49 points or by gaining the highest score after a set amount of rounds.
Winning Lines is based on the UK game show of the same name.
categories: Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Number, Trivia, Word Game

name: Trouble: Disney Frozen Olaf's Ice Adventure Game
description:
The seasons are changing and Olaf is melting! Move your Olaf token through all kinds of trouble to be the last player without a fully melted Olaf!

A Frozen themed reimplementation of the Milton Bradley game Ice Cube, players move ice cube-based Olaf tokens around the board trying not to melt while trying to hasten the melting of their opponents through the use of water, salt and other means.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: The Dinosaur Card Game
description:
From the back of the box:

"Eight different games to play!

Digging Up Dinosaurs - a quick-reflex matching game
Dinosaur Dup - you'll need good observation skills to win
Double Dinosaur - if you're lucky, you'll collect the most pairs
Dinosaur Snap - a race to win all the cards
Dinosaur Match-Up - a cooperative matching game
Dinosaur Rummy - the beginner's version
Advanced Dinosaur Rummy - Mom & Dad will like this one, too!
Fishin' for Dinos - everyone's favorite!

While enjoying many different games, dinosaur fans and their families can identify the 10 popular dinosaurs illustrated on the cards."

name: The Lord of The Rings
description: In their First Action, players move forward one space along the Adventure Track. For their Second Action, players take an appropriately coloured Challenge Tile. Their Third Action involves resolving the challenge by rolling one, two or three dice to match of exceed the number on the Challege Tile. A player's Corruption Marker is moved along the Corruption Track the same number of spaces as the number of dice they have chosen. Players may used Reward Tiles they have acquired to add to their dice roll. If a player fails the challenge, play passes to the left. If a player is successful, then that player may take a Reward Tile or move on the attempt a further challenge. The game is over if a Hobbit Piece progresses to Mount Doom and destroys the One Ring, or if all players have become corrupted.

name: Seven Families
description:
7 Families is a French card game that originated in the 19th century and is closely linked with the old English game, Happy Families. It also shares a lot of similarities to more modern kids' card games like Old Maid and Go Fish. As players attempt to collect all of the members of as many families as possible, the game relies heavily on both observation and memory (remembering who did or did not appear to have certain cards).

Historically, 7 Families makes use of a variety of families, including actual family names, animals, fictional characters, etc.
publishers: (Public Domain), Blue Orange Games, Ãditions Gladius International, Inc., TrasHumantes

name: La soupe Ã  Gertrude
description:
La Soupe Ã  Gertrude (Gertrude's soup) is a game where each players are trying to obtain enough ingredients to make their soup first. There are 5 types of ingredients in the deck of cards, you only need 3 differents.

The current player pick the 3 top cards of the deck, choose one that will be face up, the others face down. Now (in no specific order), all the players bid on the lot. Once the winning bid has been found, that player will pay the other players by giving them cards for the total bidded, then pick up the lot. If he has 3 different ingredients, he wins.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection
publishers: Cocktail Games, Hutter Trade GmbH + Co KG

name: American Idol Collectible Card Game
description:
From Publisher's website:

Now you can become an American Idol with the American Idol Season 3 Collectible Card Game by Fleer Trading Cards. Look for the complete 110-card game box set at retailers nationwide. The American Idol Season 3 card game is fast, easy to learn, and fun for two-to-six players, ages 9-and-up.

These great-looking game cards carry photographs of actual American Idol contestants, rejects and judges. Match a song card with a singer card and use judge cards to take your contestants all the way to the finals. Then, during the finals, you can cast your vote to determine which contestant becomes the American Idol winner!
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music

name: Power Trip
description:
At its base, Power Trip is a trivia game with a thin veneer of a science fiction theme. The plastic bits are fantastic... but, in the end, it's a trivia game.

By successfully answering trivia questions, players are allowed to place their markers on stars in the constellations depicted. Having a given number of stars in a constellation gains control of the constellation for that player. Victory is achieved by controlling the target number of constellations for the game.

name: Guess What I Am!
description:
Guess What I Am! - The Hilarious New Twist on a Classic Guessing Game

There are 4 different games suggested to use with these components.

What Am I?
Everyone receives one of 30 mystery character cards with a hole for them to place their face in. The cards show cartoon outlines of animals and community members (a pig, a lobster, an astronaut, a cowboy, etc). Your face replaces theirs, which looks really silly, and everyone can see what you are except you. Each player rolls a die and asks questions about their card to deduce what it depicts. The die tells them whether they can Ask, Guess, Lose a Turn, Reverse Direction, etc. Questions must be Yes or No: for example, "Do I have a lot of fur?" "Do I wear boots?" "Do people drink my milk?" A tally sheet is used to keep track of which characters aren't on your card, based on the answers given by the other players. The first person to correctly guess what their card depicts is the winner of the round.

Team Challenge
Each team gives clues to a player on their team who is wearing the card. They are allowed only five clues (three for advanced play) before the player must guess who they are. The first team to guess correctly wins a chip; first team to five chips wins.

Charades
Players select a card that only they can see. They then act out the card and each player in turn gets one guess. The player who guesses right gets two chips and the actor gets one. Then another player chooses a card and is the actor. First person to collect ten chips wins.

Lightning Round
One team gets all the animal cards, the other team gets all the people cards. Players use one card at a time and guessers are only allowed one clue from their teammates. The team who guesses the most cards wins the round; if you guess the entire pile you get 3 bonus points. Card piles are shuffled and swapped. At the end of that round whichever team has the most chips wins.

name: Royal Court (fan expansion for Dominion)
description:
(from the download document)

This is a fan based expansion created by Mike Young for the game Dominion.

These cards may be used to create standalone sets or may be added to mixes from other Dominion expansions.

This set introduces the concepts of:

Kingdom cards where not all the cards in the pile are identical.
Duration cards that last for more than 1 turn.
Duration cards that allow players to perform an action instead of playing an action card.
Use tokens to determine when or if a card has been used.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Host
description: Host is a card game, with an alien invasion, zombie infection motif. You have a hand of cards and a secret objective to match a particular set of cards. You draw a card, then pass a card to anyone else at the table, until you reach 10 points. The trick is to see which set cards negatively affect you and pass them off on to the other players. You also must deduce what they need and what they don't need and try to pile on the negative points. We've also add a chaotic event deck, that if you pull an event you will likely reset the game, scramble everyone's cards, or end up with a whole new objective.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Fantasy, Science Fiction, Zombies
mechanics: Acting, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection
publishers: Broken Prism Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Demoniak
description:
Words and a wild atmosphere!

Each round, a theme is revealed. Race the other players to find letter tiles that make a word related and be the first to ring the bell to place it! The longer the word, the more points you win... But be careful your opponents do not take the wind out of your sails ! What about the theme ? It is up to you : anything is possible as long as you can justify !

Demonstrate your imagination and speed to win the game !

Includes several modes to vary the pleasures.

Players: 2-6. Age: 8 and up . Duration : 20 min.

Contents: 120 cardboard tiles, 90 cards, 1 bell and 1 rule set.

name: Jaws: No swimming, beach closed
description:
The vessel 'Orca' roams the waters to hunt Jaws...and a shark fun has been sighted. BEACH CLOSED!

The great white creeps under the surface looking for a meal, and three innocent swimmers are still in the water! The Orca and Jaws constantly try to outrun and outsmart each other by using hidden movement and deploying extra skills.

But do not hesitate, because the playing area gets smaller and smaller each turn!

—description from the publisher

First Jaws gets a full turn by moving, taking one action (and maybe use tokens), and removing a card.
Then all the other players get their full turn by moving, taking one action, and removing a card.
If the person playing as Jaws manages to eat the three swimmers, they win the game. If the player(s) who are on the boat manage to hit Jaws three times, they win the game.

—user summary

name: Dado Batalla
description:
Dado Batalla ("Battle Dice") is a board game designed for the little ones, to share and have a nice time with the family.
The main objective of this game is to mark all the numbers of an opponent with the marker tiles as soon as possible. You must roll the dice and mark your opponent's numbers.
Whoever does it first will be the winner of the game!

El “Dado Batalla” es un juego de mesa pensado para los más pequeños, para compartir y pasar un lindo rato en familia.
El objetivo principal de este juego es marcar todos los números de un contrincante con las fichas marcadoras lo antes posible.
Quien lo haga primero, será el ganador de la partida!

name: Monopoly: Chronicles of Narnia Collector's
description: This Narnia version of Monopoly includes graphics from the 2005 movie "The Lion, The Witch, and The Wardrobe" and the 2008 sequel "Prince Caspian". The game features collectible pewter game pieces and unique character cards. Gather power against the White Witch and the Telmarine Army through buying, selling, and trading Narnian locations. The landmarks include Cair Paravel, the Black Woods, and Asian's Camp.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation, Novel-based
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Condomoneyum
description:
In this heavily sponsored game, the players are advertising executives who try to land accounts with clients and earn money (through the accounts, speculation on the stocks of the companies whose accounts they hold, lotteries and random events) so as to buy their condo, room by room. First one to complete his condo wins.

Movement is controlled by a distance die (1-3) and a direction die (east, west, uptown, downtown, choice).

Very random, as the players have no influence on the values of the stocks of the accounts they hold, for example.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Anvil-Dragoon: The Second D-Day
description:
ANVIL-DRAGOON is a regimental/brigade level simulation of the invasion of Southern France in August 1944. One player represents the German forces employed in this area and maneuvers unit counters which represent the German forces which were or which could have been involved in this campaign. The other player represents the allied commander, and maneuvers unit counters which represent the British, American, and French units which were, or which could have been included in the actual campaign. Depending on the scenario played, a set of victory conditions are established, which will affect the actions taken by both players as they maneuver their units in an effort to fulfill the victory conditions and win the game.

6 Scenarios, each 15 turns.
16 x 28 hex map on yellow paper with reddish-brown and blue coloring for the man made and natural geographic map symbols.
144 thin die-cut counters

Published as a magazine game in JagdPanther #12 which has been rereleased in PDF format by Amarillo Design Bureau.
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., JagdPanther Publications

name: All Ears
description:
"The Game of Sound Effects"

This is a word association game that mostly requires one to act out the phrases using non-word sounds. 800 items in 6 categories.

name: The Littles Pop-up and Play Game
description:
The Littles Pop-up and Play Game is a Milton Bradley board game that is based on the early 80s television series, "The Littles", which is based on a series of children's books by John Peterson. The Littles are little 4 inch tall humanoid creatures that live in the walls of human's homes.

The board was rather interesting because it had pop up sections that made up The Littles' living area. The object of the game is to collect some inventions and get them to Dinky Littles' room.

name: Global Pursuit
description:
"Global Pursuit is a game of strategy and luck for those who enjoy learning about the world we live in. With four different levels of difficulty, it's also a game the whole family can play!

The object is to race your opponents around the world in your balloon, picking up your flags (in the correct order of course) by throwing the dice, answering questions and moving forward.
First player to collect all seven flags is the winner."

name: Schaf
description:
This game in HABA's mini-spiel key chain series comes with two sheep (one black, one white), four green four-leaf clovers and a die showing a four-leaf clover on three sides and a wolf's head on the other three sides. Like other games in the series, the pieces are wooden and terribly cute, especially the tiny die.

To start, the two sheep are placed at equal distances from the box they came in. Varying this distance will determine how long the game is. During a player's turn, he can create a path to the box using up to four clover leaves (slight ambiguity in the rules here: initially the rules say 3 then say 4). However, before he can place each leaf, he must roll the die. Rolling a clover leaf means the player can continue to add clover leaves, or the player can stop and move his sheep ahead of the last clover leaf placed (i.e. nearer to the box). If instead a wolf's head is cast, the player's sheep is so frightened that it is unable to move that turn. The player whose sheep reaches the box first is crowned King of the Sheep and wins the heart of the woman shepherd, Edda.

<!-- Entry audited by (nsolitander) (13-08-2009) --!>

name: Funny Farm
description:
Gather the farm's animals!

4 farmers have lost their animals and have gone to gather them. But watch out! The animals will only follow their true owners! Witch farmer will be the first to gather all his animals?

(From the box - translated from Danish)
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Med IQ
description:
From the box...

"Med IQ makes honing your medical knowledge fun. The questions created by a panel of clinicians and medical educators headed by Morton Bogdonoff, M.D., Professor of Medicine at the Cornell University College of Medicine, deal with everything from medical lore and history to therapeutic decisions and case histories. The game can be played with a group playing individually or in teams - or solitaire."

Contents:
Game board
192 regular question cards
60 case study cards
Scoring sheets (for solitaire game)
4 pawns (ambulance, beaker, doctor bag, and microscope)

This is a trivia game that was apparently released in conjunction with the drug Actigall (Ursodiol). Each turn you choose one of the four basic categories: Lore, Vital signs, Therapy, or Miscellany. Another player draws a card and asks the question relating to the category you chose. Each questions has a number next to it. If answered correctly, move that number of spaces forward on the board. If incorrect, move ahead one space.

There are case study spaces on the board that let you conduct a case study. Each case study has three questions and you move forward 2 spaces for each correct answer.

The game ends when one player/team reaches the end and is named "Doctor of the Year".

Question examples:
- Lore(3 points): In hypertension, what is the Pae mosaic?
- Vital Signs(2 points): A 50-year old man presents with vertigo. He has horizontal nystagmus that rapidly fatigues. Which is the likely source of his vertigo; the inner ear or the cerebellum?
- Therapy(4 points): What surgical approach to the pituitary gland has replaced the earlier technique of open craniotomy?
- Miscellany(2 points): What characteristics of malignant melanoma s its most important prognostic indicator?

name: Monopoly: Dog Lovers' Edition
description: This is an official themed monopoly version using the theme of dogs. Dogs and dog-related concepts make up the board spaces, tokens, etc. This has been published in two versions--a version with a "Pedigree" endorsement (Pedigree is a brand of dog food), and a version without the Pedigree endorsement.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Hasbro, Parker Brothers, The Op Games

name: Alphabet Circus
description:
Toss a bean bag onto the target mat. Then, draw a card and complete an alphabet challenge.

The first player to complete five challenges is the winner.

name: Global Warming
description: This is a slowly sinking island game like Survive: Escape from Atlantis! or Atlantis. It uses a unique method for determining which parts of the island will sink next that gives the players partial knowledge of future events.

name: Poetikus
description:
Russian board game.

«Now everyone can write poetry!»
«Poetikus» - is not just a tabletop game, it is unique poetic constructor. With its help you and your child can make a huge number of different lyrics: funny and sad, about love and nature, greeting, and laudatory - constructor provides a sea of opportunity, and the rest depends on you!

The set includes 16 cards with poetic forms and 300 cards with the words. Each poetic form consists of four lines. It colored rectangles marked place, which in the process of creating a poem should substitute the appropriate color
cards with words. On the cards are written the words, whole words, or the parts of words the end of which are in poetic form. On the cards with the words are still different icons (stars, crosses, etc.). Words with the same icons rhymes with each other. In poetic form at the end of lines are the same color squares with a capital R. In these boxes, and have put rhyming words and your poem will be read as rhymes.

The process of creating a masterpiece is easy. The player takes the card liked the poetic form and lay his cards on the words, as a color match, and given badges rhymes at the end of lines. In other words, you can play, even without reading, you still get meaningful quatrain, often make laugh its creator, or conversely have a deep meaning. Of course, no one prevents game match words, not only in color, but also the meaning - each color category words very extensive. After all the cards distributed by one for each rectangle a player saw that his card is not the missed sites, and all the rhymes are met (at the end lines of rhyming words are the same color with the same labels), only read aloud, and the resulting masterpiece of expression!

name: Stern Wissensquiz: Die neunziger Jahre
description:
Quiz game for 2-4 players or teams.
Questions are all about the nineties.
Be the first/best after 20 rounds.

All players including the player who asked the question put a token (with the answer they think is the correct one ==> multiple choice) in the middle - the less correct answers the more you can move forward - if you were right.
Special (red) questions for additional moves:
Die is used to determine the year - make a guess if the requested event happened earlier, later or during that year.

Content:
200 cards - with 4 questions per card
4 large & 4 small meeples (scoring positions month & year)
10-sided die
1 board
24 answer cards
1 rule sheet & solutions
No extensions were published - but different editions regarding other decades.

name: Quiz: Jede Antwort bringt eine neue Frage
description:
"Try and guess" game : 52 cards having a question and a letter.

Each player try to answer a question with a word beginning with one of its letter. This will give the next question.

The first player who plays their last card wins the game.

name: Geschlechterkampf
description: Here the women are playing against the men, and vice versa. Do you know how many cylinders a Porsche 911 has? Or is the material from which the best nail file? These and similar questions must be answered here. Depending on the game type questions are asked of others and / or the same sex. The players love one estimate, if the question can be answered correctly or not. Who know a lot or can bluff well is rapidly advancing on the board and win this battle of the sexes - at least temporarily!

name: Reflecto
description:
The goal of the game is to create a pattern of three pawns (in a row or with an "L" shape) as well as the symmetrical pattern along the diagonal of the board.

Pawn can be set at the square dictated by the dice, or moved one step to an adjacent square.

name: Drunk Ass
description:
Drunk Ass is the classic trivia drinking game that will keep you laughing and drinking all night long! Drunk Ass tests your wits before, during and after you chug your favorite beverage. All you need to play are glasses, some liquids to imbibe in and a few friends.
Players (or teams) compete in these six party-enhancing categories: Drunk Ass Quotes, Drunk Ass Drinks, Drunk Ass Sobriety Test, Drunk Ass Trivia, Drunk Ass Jokes and Drunk Ass Luck.
Each card uses a series of clues leading to a common answer. Every player may have known it, but the ones that didn't get it will be saying, "I knew that!"
Players take turns rolling a die, drawing the corresponding card and gaining points for each correct answer and in the end, whoever has the most points wins!

name: ZigZak: Skoki narciarskie
description:
Challenge the best ski jumpers in the world! See for yourself that you can become one of the sports champions! “ZigZak: Ski Jumps” is a party card game, in which players become ski jumpers trying to fly as far as possible and take the longest and the best jump.

In ZigZak: Skoki narciarskie (ZigZag: Ski Jumps) game all the players perform their jumps in the real time simultaneously. In order to win, the players have to create the line of their jumps using cards from the common pool by putting together their Start and Finish cards. The speed, the style and the length of the jump are all important. The players have to prove their reflex and accuracy while selecting the cards.
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Real-time, Sports

name: POOP: The Game Limited Edition Bidet Wild Cards
description:
POOP is an UNO-like game where the first player to run out of cards wins! Players are given a 5-card hand and take turns laying cards (pooping) but trying not to clog the toilet! If the toilet is clogged the player must pick up the entire poop stack and a new toilet is started. If 3 cards of the same color are played in a row then the toilet is Flushed and that toilet is reset with zero poop cards. Some cards make players perform crazy acts on their turns.

The Limited Edition Bidet Wild Cards pack includes four wild cards, one printed for each version of Poop: The Game in print.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Bananas
description:
From the publisher:
In Bananas there are cards showing monkeys in three different positions, and banana cards. When it is your turn, you can lay down one, two or three cards to line up three monkey cards. At the end of the game the winner is not the player with the most monkeys, but the one with the most bananas!

User Summary:

Game play:

The 60 cards Bananas are divided into 24 banana cards and 36 Monkey cards. The goal is to recover as many bananas as possible.

When playing cards, rows are formed under a stack of banana cards (banana cards or played in one of the banana pile stacks, the monkey cards in one of the rows), the , a player who can play three different monkey cards under a row wins all the banana cards in that row.
The player who has the most banana cards at the end og the game wins.

name: Kamela zick nicht!
description:
Kamela zick nicht! is a dexterity game for childen.
You try to load freight on a camel and try to avoid that the camel buckles up.

Description on publishers website:
„Kamela zick nicht" - ruft mir Ali Baba, mein Kamelreiter, ständig zu. Er hat sich in den Kopf gesetzt die schöne Prinzessin des Landes mit Geschenken zu überhäufen, um sie für sich zu gewinnen. Und wer muss den ganzen Plunder durch die Wüste tragen? Ich natürlich! Nun - ich denke gar nicht daran! Möchtet ihr Ali Baba helfen, mich zu beladen? Nur zu, versucht es doch! Eine falsche Bewegung oder ein Gepäckstück zu viel und ich schmeiße euch alle Teile um die Ohren.

name: Sophie's Seashell Scramble
description: Each player takes a turn as Sophie the Otter, spinning for a seashell of a particular shape and pattern to add to their tableau. Once a player fills their tableau with one of each kind of seashell, they win the game. Players must use the Sophie the sitter grabber to retrieve their seashells from the ocean and move them to their tableau. The game promotes fine motor skills, pattern matching and recognition, taking turns, and social skills.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Number Knockout
description:
Each player’s turn begins with rolling three dice, stating the rolled numbers, and starting a 60-second timer. The player must incorporate all three numbers that are rolled, employing addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, roots, and powers, to create a number on the board.

All three numbers rolled must be used once but cannot be used more than once. If more than one numeral ‘one’ is rolled, the contender is given an automatic reroll, because the game can’t be played well with two ‘ones’ and a third number.

As the player solves equations, he or she crosses the numbers off the board. Players are given 60 seconds to generate as many equations as possible with unique answers from one roll of the dice.

name: The Crystal Maze: Eastern Zone Mini Game
description:
A standalone expansion to The Crystal Maze board game.

Players each play a Mental,Physical,Skill and Mystery Puzzle.
One player is the Maze Master who sets up and judges each game.

The person with the most crystals wins. Players gain crystals by successfully completing the challenge in the given time.

Game ends once each player has completed each challenge.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle, Real-time

name: Hack My Password
description:
Step into the shoes of a hacker. Try to break through your opponents firewall and decode their password before they manage to hack you! The first player to hack their opponents password or reach the finish line wins! The difficulty level on this game can be adjusted. You can also play this game in two teams.

Players are given topic cards that they use to choose their words. Words are then scrambled, hidden behind player screens. On a player's turn they guess a letter and if matched, opponent reveals all matching letters in their password. Optionally a guess can be made that has to match the two words in their unscrambled form.

name: Romans
description: Players journey around the Roman Empire, conquering garrison forts in a race to proclaimed "Caesar"! The fascinating history of the Roman Empire will be explored whilst playing the game!

name: The Da Vinci Game
description:
The Da Vinci Game, available from 1 October 2005, where players race against each other and the clock in a treasure hunt driven by all manner of ingenious challenges. This board game is inspired by the codes and symbolism used by Leonardo Da Vinci, the secret society The Priory de Sion and by The Da Vinci Code by Dan Brown.

A board game where all the players play all the time. The player landing on a challenge reads out the puzzle, riddle, logic problem or code to all the other players, who then race to solve it. Only on the treasure spaces do players face a solo challenge.

With mental agility, shrewd tactics and a little bit of luck, fortunes can change in the blink of an eye. Gather the four pieces of treasure and return to the Ankh space to face and conquer one final challenge to become the Grand Master of The Da Vinci Game.

Contents

1 Game board, 400 Clue Cards (800 challenges), 1 Electronic Timer, 1 Die, 4 Category Dividers, 6 Pairs of Playing Pieces, 1 Cloth Bag, 50 Treasure Tokens, 24 Treasure Tiles, 1 Plain Pad, 6 Pencils, 1 Rules Leaflet.

See http://www.thedavincigame.com for more information.
categories: Educational, Mythology, Novel-based, Number, Party Game, Puzzle, Trivia, Word Game
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: James Clavell's Whirlwind
description: The game is based on Whirlwind, the novel by James Clavell, which is set against the revolution in Iran in 1979. Each player is a mercenary helicopter pilot leading missions in the revolution for a fat fee paid into his Swiss bank account. Gradually, one side of the revolution or the other will gain the upper hand and players may choose to declare loyalty to one side or the other in order to gain a cut of the revolutionary spoils
categories: Adventure, Aviation / Flight, Civil War, Modern Warfare, Novel-based, Political, Transportation
mechanics: Alliances, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Sudden Death Ending, Take That, Variable Set-up

name: Oval Office
description:
This is a strange game. Nowhere on the box, gameboard or playing pieces is there any reference to who designed or who published this game or when it was designed or published. It must be fairly new because there is reference to an internet site listed as : www.racetobepresident.com on the box. Attempting to go to that site results in notification that the site no longer exists.

The object of the game is to become president of the United States by collecting either a majority of the Electoral College Votes or more than any other player. Players earn Electoral College Votes by correctly answering the questions on the question and answer cards. The subjects covered on the cards include current affairs, politics, American History, World History, Geography, Economics etc.

The outside of the box states that the game is for 2 to 8 players and the inside says that the game is for 2 to 4 players with the 4 running as Presidential and Vice Presidential running mates.

name: Pig Dice
description:
Pig Dice, an ancestor of Pass the Pigs and a descendant of Pig, is a jeopardy dice game, where the dominant type of decision is whether or not to jeopardize previous gains by rolling for potential greater gains. In particular, Pig Dice is a jeopardy race game, where the object is to be the first to meet or exceed a goal score.

One die is a standard die with a pig head replacing the 1. The other is a standard die with a pig tail replacing the 6. Such rolls are called Heads and Tails, respectively, and modify the value of the roll. The goal score is 100, yet after a player has met or exceeded 100, all other players have one more turn to achieve a higher score.

name: X-Ceter-O
description: X für O? is a new twist on the classic Tic-Tac-Toe game. It includes six game pieces: three Os marked 1, 3 and 5 and three Xs marked 2, 4 and 6. You play on 3 x 3 game board grid. The pieces are played in numerical order. Once the six pieces are on the board, play continues in sequential fashion, with each move exposing the now-vacated square to the opponent. The action ends only when the first player achieves a three-in-a-row combination. With this game there is never a tie.

name: Animals of the World
description: A fun, educational game about animals for the whole family! The game contains 200 cards filled with interesting questions and facts about 200 different species all over the world. Play the easier version where you recognize the animals and answer questions about them – or try the more challenging version and see if you know the animal’s range, conservation status and Latin name as well!

name: ÐÑÐ°Ð½Ð¸ÑÑ ÐÐ¼Ð¿ÐµÑÐ¸Ð¸ (Borders of the Empire)
description:
ÐÑÐ°Ð½Ð¸ÑÑ ÐÐ¼Ð¿ÐµÑÐ¸Ð¸ ("Borders of the Empire") is dedicated to the destruction of the Roman Empire and the establishment of barbarian kingdoms in its territory.

The player can play for the Emperor, usurper, or tribal leader, but as a rule for the game several times will replace the post, typing while victory points.

So, a game situation like that at all. One of the players is the emperor, others are trying to break the Empire into pieces and collect her remains into their kingdoms. The problem is that it's virtually impossible to stay on the imperial throne from the beginning to the end of the game.
mechanics: Area Movement, Hexagon Grid, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Strategy Yatzy
description:
This game is not related to the classic dice game Yatzy (better-known as Yahtzee).

The game consists of an 8 x 8 grid in a vertical frame, similar to Connect Four but only accessible from one side. The players roll four dice and insert four chips into the board with symbols corresponding to the results (the symbols are hearts, clubs, spades, and diamonds). Whoever gets three or more of the same symbols in a row may score, but a player may choose not to score yet. The more symbols in a row, the more points are scored. When all players have scored four times or when the frame is full, the game ends and the player with most points is the winner.

name: Saddle Up!
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Saddle Up! is a game in which you DON'T want to make a match. Each card has four objects, and players must place cards next to each other under one condition: a matching object or color cannot touch vertically, horizontally or diagonally! The first player who can correctly place the most cards wins the round! With multiple levels of play, the game is always different.

name: Paul and the Moon
description:
Description from the publisher:

Oh dear! The moon has lost his radiant magic staff! Without the mystical staff the moon cannot wax, it can only wane. But if the sparkle sprites can build a ladder along the stars before the moon vanishes behind the cloud, Paul may be able to climb up the ladder, returning the magic staff to his friend, the moon. Who would like to help Paul and the sparkle sprites? A cooperative memory game that also includes a competitive version.

Description from the publisher (German):
Oje, der Mond hat seinen leuchtenden Zauberstab verloren.
Ohne ihn kann er nicht mehr zum Vollmond werden, sondern nimmt immer weiter ab. Doch wenn die Funkelfeen an den Sternen entlang eine Leiter Richtung Mond bauen, bevor er hinter der Wolke verschwunden ist, kann Paul an ihr hochklettern und dem Mond seinen leuchtenden Zauberstab zurückgeben. Wer möchte Paul und den Funkelfeen helfen?
Ein kooperatives Memo-Spiel mit Wettbewerbsvariante.

toller 3-D-Spielaufbau mit abnehmendem Mond
in 3 Schwierigkeitsstufen
plus Gute-Nacht-Geschichte zum Vorlesen

name: Ninja Night
description: In Ninja Night, we are in Japan in 1444 in the Region of Iga. You are ninja apprentices, and your senseï has sent you raiding an enemy village to honor your clan. You must complete several missions to do so.
mechanics: Action Queue, Modular Board, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Big Boom Bang
description: An exciting game of dice with a bit of luck. The players roll the dice and reveal tiles in turn. And hope that they will be spared from the big BOOM. But be careful, nobody is safe. Who is lucky enough to stay in the game until the end? Whoever remains at the end wins.

name: Snekagon
description:
Snekagon is a 7-turn abstract perfect information game about building snakes.

The goal of the game is to create a snake longer than your opponent by placing tiles of various shapes.

On your turn, you can place one tile either so that it doesn't touch any other tile, thus creating a new snake. The other option is to place the tile so that it touches some of your other tiles - this way, you make one of your snakes grow. You can even connect two of your snakes this way!
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Payoff Machine
description:
A pure luck game. Players take turns dropping different colored marbles worth different point values into the machine. Then they are allowed to turn the tumblers that many times. Any marbles that fall out are collected. First player to get 25 points or last player with any marbles wins! Game includes 42 black, 8 white, 2 red marbles.

From the back of the box:

Object: Be the first player to get balls worth 25 points out of the Payoff Machine.

It's your turn. You decide to drop one white and two black balls into the machine. That's 7 points and seven twists of the tumblers. Out drop six black balls and one white ball - that's 11 points. You've gained four points.

From the rules:

PLAY


Point Value: Each black ball is worth 1 point, each white ball is worth 5 points, and each red ball is worth 10 points.
To start the game, each player receives 1 white and 5 black balls for a total of 10 points.
The rest of the balls are placed in the holes on top of the cap. One red ball is the last to be put in the machine. The other red ball is a spare. Some of the balls may not go all the way down into the filled holes and will stick out slightly from the top. This is all right.
A player is chosen to go first. They take their turn. Then play passes to the left.
On their turn a player tries to collect more balls and points than they put into the machine.
They may place 1 or as many as 10 points worth of balls into the machine. For each point, they must make one move. A move means turning any of the grooved tumblers (only the grooved tumblers are moveable) in either direction, until a 'click' is felt. A player may move any of the 3 tumblers in any order they want.

name: Donald Duck's Haunted Mine Game
description:
Children's game published by Whitman based on a Disney story featuring Donald Duck, Mickey Mouse, Goofy, and Pluto.

Each player starts with six matching pieces laid face up in front of them. A pool of path tiles, plus Escape and Lost playing pieces are placed face down in the center. In turn, each player draws a tile from the pool. The first tile must be a path tile and is placed face up in the center of the table. After that, drawn path cards must be connected to a path card already played.

If the Escape tile is turned up, the player instead places one of their character cards on the path. They are played as a path card but become a dead end. The Escape tile is returned to the pool and mixed in after use.

If the Lost tile is turned up, the player instead removes one of their character cards on the path (if they have one) and returns the tile to the pool after use.

The first player to get rid of their six pieces wins. If all paths are blocked before this happens, the player with the most characters used wins.

Contents:
34 Playing Pieces
66 Path Cards
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: De Lama's het spel
description:
Game based on the popular Dutch improvisation TV Show "De Lama's" (Dutch version of "Whose Line is it Anyway?")

Play the games like the Lama's do in their show and make the audience laugh

awards:
-"speelgoed van het jaar 2008"

name: Detour!
description: A track-based game in which players compete to be the first to visit a number of tourist attractions and return home. The game is made unique by two features: a random number generator in the shape of a gas pump and a couple discs on the game board that players may rotate to block opponents in their travels.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Justice League: Face Off Dice Game
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Play hero or villain in Justice League: Face Off Dice Game, a push-your-luck dice game of bluffing and battling. Roll the special hero/villain dice in the sculpted dice cup that features both Batman and The Joker. Push your luck as you bluff your opponents with villains or keep rolling to try for more hero points.

name: Boomerang
description:
Players can either play a piece on the board or bring a new one on. You must eliminate the players pieces to win, but beware some attacks can boomerang!

If you can gain control of the orange triangles you can place a man for free.

Whoever is brought down below three loses.

name: The Great British Train Game
description:
"The Great British Train Game" is a trivia-based family board game that takes players on an exciting train journey around the British Isles with questions on history, customs, sport, music, famous people, landmarks, literature and much more.But beware, players can find themselves stuck in a siding, on an unexpected detour, facing a delay on the line, or encountering a lucky change onto a fast train that will speed them on their way. And, if you hit the buffers on a question, you'll need to play one of three kinds of joker cards to get moving again.
The questions come graded in 3 levels so youngsters can pit their wits against older players. Contains over 3000 questions.

name: Kagutomo
description:
- "Both furniture" Story ~

Every player is a furniture dealer in the world of dream.

Whenever someone is spinning a story, residents rapidly populates this world. On the other hand, when the residents leave, the furniture that are forgotten by the storyteller become Nora (Nora means stray in Japanese like stray cat or dog) furniture, and play as they wish night after night.

To give new residents wonderful days, every player will work to have the new residents meet with the Nora furniture.

So, become friends with Nora furniture and complete a set of necessary furniture for your shop.

Original description:

çããã¯ãããã®ä¸çã®å®¶å·å±ãã
