Friends of Nora furniture rise Once this way aligned.
This furniture store's you also nice!

name: OMFG!
description:
This may be the rudest, shockingly funny bluffing game you have ever played! Can you sort out the facts from the fiction? Can you sniff out outrageous lies and downright bullshit? You'll learn some toe-curling and bewildering facts along the way - but to win this game it't not what you know, it's the way that you tell it.

You can choose to speak the truth (often stranger than fiction) or dish out some deadpan deceit. Select from the scandalous, but oddly believable 'facts' on the card, or wing it with a Double Bluff that could pile on your points. Do you have what it takes to fool your friends? Do they?

A strictly adult party game, not for the easily embarrassed, to make you laugh out loud within the context of a genuinely competitive game. The winner is the first to reach 25 points.

—description from the publisher
publishers: Cheatwell Games, Gameology (Gameology Romania), Hobby World, HUCH!, Magellan

name: The Sting Game
description:
You have just landed on Teaser's Lucky Casino; its token is valued at 20 million. You quickly take a deal card and give it a sly glance. Is the deal card worth millions or is it a worthless Sting Card? Nobody knows except you! The tension mounts as you place both the token and the card on the gameboard. As the Sting Man, you open the bidding with 10 million... the other players are confused... are you bluffing, or does the deal have a real value? They all pass. You make your final bid... 120 million. The next player sense a Sting Card... he challenges; the following player thinks you bid too high... he challenges; the last player pauses... 121 million... he wants the deal.

A grin crosses your face as you are handed 121 million in cash. Slowly the deal card is turned over... it's a Sting!

You have to be a shrewd Sting Man to make the wildest deals and get away with it... or be sharp enough to uncover a Sting to receive the big payoff. If you work your deals with skill and finesse, you'll build the largest fortune and win the game.
categories: Bluffing, Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Piggy Bank Race
description:
Players each control two piggy banks which race around a track to the finish line. On their turn the players roll a die containing the numbers one through three and then choose one of their two pigs to move that many spaces, skipping over spaces already occupied with a pig. Along the way pigs will stop on spaces which earn them gold coins for their banks, spaces which allow them to put black coins worth -1 gold in their opponents banks, and spaces which allow them to shake their opponents' banks so as to try and gauge how many coins they hold.

The first five pigs to cross the finish line earn five, four, three, two and one coins, after which the game is over and all the piggy banks are opened. The player who owns the bank with the most gold wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move

name: MM-peli
description:
"The official game of the World Championships in Athletics!"

In this game you compete in five different sports: long-jumping, 110m hurdles, javelin-throwing, pole-vaulting, and 1500m.

In each sport your results are measured in meters or seconds, just like in real life, so you have a chance of setting new world record! In addition, you get "result points" in each sport. The better your results, the more points you get. The result points are added up, and the player having the most points after all five sports is the winner! The "super score" - very hard to achieve - is 1000 points or more.

One special feature of the game is that you yourself can influence your results; the outcome is not decided by the dice alone.

So if you're planning to win this official game of the world championships in athletics, it is going to take both skill and luck - just like in real life!

This is a rare Fenno-Alga publication in that, being published to promote the specific sports competition in Helsinki, it does not seem to have a Swedish counterpart at all.

name: Clash of the Titans Game
description: Spin and move game based on the 1981 MGM movie, Clash of the Titans has each player taking on the role of Perseus. Each Perseus is trying to gather the Medusa's head and the five magic items needed to pass the five obstacles in a race to the finish where he will show the Medusa's head to the Kraken and win the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Åowcy przygÃ³d
description:
Translated description from the back of the box:

Take the role of one of the members of Royal Adventurers Company from London. Send your explorers and adventurers to the furthermost parts of the Globe. Fund expeditions. Change the history. Take the glory of an explorer founder.

The box contains:

29 Boards
30 Glass stones
2 Dice
Rules



Home Page: http://ww.lizardy.pl/lowcy.html (Polish)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mike Read's Pop Quiz Game
description:
Form a pop group, make a record and be the first to Number One in the charts by a combination of luck and answering Mike Read's Pop Quiz questions.

The game is played in two parts. In the first part players roll the dice to move their 'guitarist' piece around the outer track and collect a pop group of six cards comprising: Lead Guitarist, Bass Guitarist, Keyboard Player, Drummer, Vocalist, and P.A. In the second part players instead move their guitarist piece around the inner track and also move their 'record' piece up and down the charts. The squares on the inner track either have the players answering pop music related questions (in the general form of "Name X bands/titles with this <word> in the title" or drawing a card and following the instructions. A sand timer is used for the easy questions (30 seconds) and hard questions (60 seconds).

The first player to have their record piece reach Number One in the charts wins the game.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Trivia

name: Baffle!
description:
The Game Board
The Baffle! game board consists of 25 squares aligned into 5 rows and columns. In all versions of the game, except Baffle! Junior, all 25 squares are used for play.

The Game Pieces
The 25 game pieces include 5 geometric shapes (square, star, triangle, hexagon, and circle) in 5 different colors (red, green, blue, purple, and yellow).

The Cards
The 60 cards in 3 levels of difficulty can be used to add another playing dimension to Baffle!® Classic. The player resets the board with game pieces according to the positions on the card, and then play begins.

Contents
Contents include the Baffle! game board, 25 game pieces, 60 cards and game directions.

name: Modern Battles II: Kaliningrad & Mosul
description:
Modern War #27, Jan-Feb 2017

Modern Battles II is a grand tactical simulation of battles that were or could possibly be fought in the era since the fall of the Berlin Wall and into the near future. Players control actual and hypothetical combat units utilizing a wide range of technologies and forces to gain objectives. Modern Batles II includes two games: Kaliningrad, covering a hypothetical Russian clash with NATO forces at the Russian Baltic Fleet forward base, and Mosul, a clash between ISIS and Coalition forces in Iraq. There are two players in each game, commanding opposing forces. Both games use a main body of shared rules, and each also has its own scenario special instructions.

name: Yo-kai Watch Trading Card Game
description:
The YO-KAI WATCH Trading Card Game is a two player card battle in which players take turns consisting of recovery (unflipping one in play card, move all medals to ready, untap all tapped cards), drawing a card, playing cards and attacking the other player aiming to eliminate the opposing player's three life cards.

From the box:

Collect, battle, and trade your favorite YO-KAI WATCH characters!

name: Handel und Wandel
description: Each player has his own enterprise with own cars, building sites and capital. The player can buy shops (storys) of a building site and other players who stop there, must pay for them. There is a winner, when everyone else goes broke.
publishers: Bengt D. Bengtsson fÃ¶rlag, Otto Maier Verlag

name: Ligretto Speed Machine
description:
Ligretto Speed Machine is an electronic device that puts a new twist on Ligretto. A new deck of cards is included in the box so it includes all you need to play.

There is a deck of special action cards that are shuffled an placed in the speed machine.
During play the machine will at random times make a sound and spit out a card. The player who manage to grab this card can use the special ability to his or her advantage, like giving the top card from his Ligretto deck to another player, to get a wild card, etc...

This speed machine adds even more stress and more fun to Ligretto.

name: Puzz-Ominos
description:
This is a tile-laying abstract, where the goal is to score the most points. This is done by placing tiles that are made up of squares so that they:

1) Touch one of your previously played pieces (first turn, rule waived)
2) Touch as many of your opponents squares as possible
3) Close off small 1-2 square areas (optional for extra points)

Players, after placing a piece, get one point for square they touch on an opponents piece and 1 or 2 points for each sealed empty area. Player with the most points once each player has played 13 pieces wins.

The game includes a solitaire version.

name: A-Ã
description: This is a word game, where you try to name things that start with different letters. On your turn you roll a die and one other player takes a card and reads a category from the corresponding line. Now you try to name as many things from that category as you can. You have on note block with alfabet and you can cross out all the starting letters that you could use. When you run out of time, it's next players turn. On your next turn you get new category and try to get the remaining letters. First player who can cross out all the letters is the winner.

name: Beat the Parents: Ask Me Anything
description:
Beat the Parents Ask Me Anything is the friendly competition that brings families together. It’s like a trivia game where every category is YOU! Kids ask a personality question of the their parents, then lock in their guess as to what they think the parents’ answer will be. Parents then must guess which answer the kids expected them to pick. If they’re right, they win the round. The parents then take a turn asking a question of their kids. What’s your favorite thing about summer? What insect scares you the most? Beat the Parents Ask Me Anything is the personality guessing game that pits parents against their kids in a friendly battle of who knows whom best. Everyone learns something new about each other while having a hilarious time!

Description

How well do parents know kids? Do kids have insight into parents’ quirks? Beat the Parents Ask Me Anything is the fun way for families to find out! Parents ask kids a question about themselves, and then guess what the kids’ response will be. Then the tables turn as kids ask their parents a question. With 150+ thought-provoking questions, find out more than you imagine with Beat The Parents Ask Me Anything, and have a hilarious time in the process!

—description from the publisher

Game play involves one family comprised of two teams - parents and kids. Teams take turns drawing a card and asking the other team a question. Each card has two personal, trivia questions - one to ask parents, one to ask kids. The off-turn team selects and answer (A, B, or C) and hides a response card. The on-turn team debates the question and then announces what they feel the answer should be. The off-turn team reveals the hidden response card. If the answer and card match, the on-turn team scores one point. Play continues until an agreed upon score or turn count elapses.

—user summary

name: ÐÐ»Ð¸Ð¢Ð¾ (OrThat)
description:
This game has questions, but no right answers. You have to choose between two options. Each round can turn into an incredible battle of opinions, evidence, manipulated facts, and counter-arguments.

The fact is that the question before everyone else is posed by the presenter, who must be convinced that one of the options is the right one. And the person whose opinion influenced the presenter's decision the most will get the most points. Fight, be eloquent, speak more, louder, more convincingly!

name: Sequenz
description:
A game where one mustn' lose sight of one's opponent...

Each player gets 8 pieces. Players start placing their pieces on the gameboard which is divided in 7x7 squares. Each square contains one of 7 colors, letters and numbers (which each number, letter and color is exactly 7 times on the board).
After placing all pieces on the board players alternately move one of their pieces one square in any direction.

Whoever manages to place his pieces on 7 equal colors, numbers or letters wins (which IMHO is almost impossible when two equal opponents are playing...).

name: Mauseschlau & BÃ¤renstark: Wissen & Lachen â Unsere Erde
description:
From the box:
Unsere Erde in an exciting race around the earth! Mauseschlau and Bärenstark are discovering Earth and they can use powerful actions while doing that. Here, players can test their knowledge about animals, countries and continents, but also laugh together! Contents: 4 game pieces, 1 board, 90 of knowledge and action cards, dice 1 Packing size: 12 x 18 x 4 cm

First player to go around the board is the winner.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Heist
description:
In Heist, players compete to commit the ultimate art heist. By using special tools to break through top level security systems, players progress towards the big haul. But you have to hurry, as you'll only have 3 minutes to steal the prize before the security systems fully trigger, and you're unable to complete your heist.

The game can be played with 2-4 players and takes EXACTLY 3 minutes to complete. Set up begins by randomly laying out a series of rooms that players must progress their pawns through in order to reach the Vault and steal the prized art. Each room has a coordinating color and symbol-coded tool that can be used to bypass the security in that room and move on to the next. But you can use other cards in your thieving arsenal to make vital Hand-Offs, stop your opponents with Security Guards (or pay them off with Bribes), Sabotage your buddies and more!

Since each of your special thieving techniques requires you to do more than just play the cards (as you make alarm sounds, laugh evilly, and shout "Stop!"), this game of stealth will be anything but stealthy.

name: Argent: Hall Monitor
description:
In Argent: Hall Monitor, a small abstract strategy game that uses the pieces from Argent: The Consortium, students battle over a hallway in Argent University, which is set in the World of Indines universe created by Level 99 Games.

Each student has a different power depending on the magic school that student follows, with the school being signified by its color, and your goal is to reach the other side of the hallway with one of your students.

Players take turns placing mages from a common pool of available mages. When the mage is placed it enacts whatever power is associated with its school of magic. For example, placing a Sorcery mage will remove an adjacent mage from the board. Other powers are passive, such as the Nature mage which cannot be directly targeted by any enemy mage. Players must use these powers in creative and strategic ways in order to defeat their opponent and make it to the end of the hall.

name: Cerberus
description:
User summary:
ã±ã«ãã­ã¹ (Cerberus) was developed from ideas that appeared whilst designing the game ããã¸ããã°ã¸ã¬ã³ã (Hedgehog's Dilemma).

Players are dealt six cards. You play a card each turn, whose value is either 1, 2, or 3. If the card's value matches a card in play, you score that value. But if you score more than five points, you lose all the points scored so far.

Publisher's summary:
1-3ã®æ°å­ãæ¸ããã6æã®ã«ã¼ããä»»æã®é çªã§åºãã

name: Stay Out of My Dungeon!
description:
Stay Out of My Dungeon! is a semi-cooperative 4-6 player worker placement, hidden identity, building game that plays in about 60 minutes.

In Stay Out of My Dungeon! players take on the role of goblins trying to defend their dungeon from the greedy king Flumperdump. Each player, playing as 1 of 7 unique goblins, takes turns visiting and building various locations in and around their dungeon. From flame throwing turrets, to sharkodile moats, to poison traps, players must work semi-cooperatively to build each location to perfection before the King's royal guard shows up.

If all three primary defenses are constructed before the King's Royal Guard arrives, the Loyal goblin players win the game. If the Royal Guard reaches the dungeon before that happens, the hidden Spy will win.

Players achieve global and, more importantly, individual rewards for completing construction phases of a particular defensive structure. But beware! Your fellow goblins may not be as loyal as you! Each player has a hidden identity card and plays as either a Loyal Goblin, a Spy, a Selfish Jerk, or an Anarchist.

Each Loyalty type has its own win conditions.

If the Royal Guard shows up before the defenses are built, the Spy player wins
If the defenses are built before the Royal Guard shows up,
The Anarchist wins if the Anarchy Track is high enough, otherwise
The Selfish Jerk wins if he/she has accumulated enough individual glory, otherwise
The remaining Loyal players win.



Stay Out of My Dungeon! combines the fun of hidden identity games and the camaraderie of cooperative play into one strategically rich yet easy to learn board game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Outlander: Destiny Dice
description:
In Outlander: Destiny Dice, each player rolls the six custom dice. The goal is to roll Jamie and Claire characters; dark characters, like Black Jack Randall and Laoghaire MacKenzie, can ruin great rolls when they appear, while helpful characters like Jenny or Dougal, can save poor rolls. Players can alter destiny through action cards that allow players to re-roll dice or modify their roll.

After each player has rolled, players compare rolls. The best rolls advance their players forward on the destiny track, bringing Jamie and Claire closer together. The first player to get Jamie and Claire together wins the game.

Outlander: Destiny Dice contains:
6 oversized custom full color dice
40 Action Cards
4 Reference Cards
8 Markers (2 for each player)
A full-color rulebook

name: Ultimate Race
description:
Description from the box:

The Ultimate Race is not an ordinary game: all is not dependent on luck. You will have to choose a car, select your tires, fight against temperature, and make judicious driving strategies to reach the first step of the podium. Six players will compete in a hot championship on 16 different world racetracks. The green flag is out, roll the dices and may the best man win!

name: Flag Frenzy!
description:
In Flag Frenzy!, players try to match flags on cards in their hands with flags on the table, emptying their personal card deck before anyone else can.

Flag Frenzy! consists of 49 flag cards and 8 continent cards (two each of Europe, Africa, Asia and the Americas); each flag card shows eight flags, and any two flag cards have exactly one flag in common, similar to the cards in Catch the Match and Spot It!

Game play differs from those titles, however, as two cards are placed face-up on the table at the start of play while the remainder of the deck is distributed evenly among the players. All players take two cards in hand, then everyone simultaneously tries to play onto the face-up cards by spotting the matching flag and giving its country's name when playing the card. With a continent card, the player has to name a flag on the continent being played.

After playing one or two cards, the player refills her hand. The first player to play all of the cards in her deck wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Real-time

name: Zombie Rancher
description:
From the Invisible City Productions website:

A post-zombie apocalypse game of entrepreneur-ism for two or four players.

The zombie infestation of North America swept the United States like wildfire. Unchecked, zombie hordes destroyed the agricultural base; destroying fields, devouring cattle. Governments toppled as food resources became scarcer and scarcer. Quarantined by the rest of the world, it took 10 years for the survivors and governments-in-exile to wheedle support and aid from an international community filled with fear and skepticism.

Early in the process of containment, eradication, and reconstruction, a horrible secret was discovered: To supplement dwindling ration supplies, many survivors harvested and ate the corpses of the zombies they killed. Shockingly, zombie flesh was the most tender, tastiest, best-aged meat in the world. Preserved by the zombie disease while tenderized by necrotic bacteria, zombie steak made several black-market smugglers very wealthy. Serving zombie steak became an unusual, but chic, status symbol among the elite and wealthy outside North America.

Recognizing the demand for zombie steak, and desperate for revenue to rebuild the economy, the US government did not eradicate the last of the zombies, but herded them into federally controlled and regulated 'zombie ranches'. Each fiscal year, contractors bid for the right to harvest and process zombies from their local zombie ranch. You are one of the contractors lucky enough to land a rancher's contract. Your goal is to capture the finest, tastiest, and best-aged zombies and render them into juicy steaks and fillets.

Welcome to the world of Zombie Rancher.

The printable board and rules are available here:
http://www.invisible-city.com/play/91/zombie-rancher

name: Play Ball
description:
Be the first to field a team of nine in all four colors. But watch out! Just when you think you've got your bases covered, someone plays an Action card and--BAM--you lose a turn, a player, or a whole team!

Ages 6 and up

name: Odds On
description:
From the back of the box:

"Odds On Card Game

Odds On is the dice and card game where the players decide the odds and the dice decide the outcome.

Each player has seven specially numbered horse cards. Just like in real horse racing, some of the horse cards are better than others - you have to decide which you think are the best and what their chances are of winning.

A "seven plus" horse card means you need to throw a seven or more on the dice - an odds card of "four" gives you four attempts to do it. Succeed and you're on a winner, fail and you've lost one of your horse cards and your opponent could be one step nearer the winning post.

The player with the most winning horses is the champion in this exciting game of luck and skill.


Pack of Horse Cards
Pack of Odds Cards
2 Dice
Rules Inside


Devised by Michael Kindred and Malcolm Goldsmith"

Listed as Ages 8 and up.

name: Big Sunday Football
description:
From the website:

Big Sunday Football plays closer to real football than any other game. Running, Passing, Kicking, Penalties, Sacks, Interceptions, Fumbles, 2-minute Warning, 2 point conversion, bad call by officials flag picked up. You name it, Big Sunday has it, except audibles. For ages 7-adult. Endorsed by NFL Coaches and Players. When you roll doubles look to the rule chart.
You may have broken a tackle or if you sacked the QB doubles means he fumbled the ball. You may have intercepted the pass and three doubles in a row means Touchdown return.

name: Dice Farmer
description:
Dice Farmer is a very fast-playing game of chance, with just enough strategy to make it and interesting. The game was developed by Tailsteak of Leftover Soup.

There's a pool of dice from four siders to twenty siders in a pool between the players, including d14s, d16s, and d18s. Players have a "hand" of dice they throw every turn. Any 1s rolled are returned to the pool. Other dice that singly or in groups total the size of a die available in the pool can add that die to the players hand (ie a rolled 4 and 8 could claim a d12).

Last player remaining or first with three d20s in their hand wins!

name: Run Bunny Run
description:
The wolves want rabbit for dinner, but the bunny has other ideas! The rabbit has superior agility, but the wolves have pack tactics. Will the wolves feast, or will the rabbit rest easy in its comfy den?

In Run Bunny Run, one player is the bunny trying to make its way home, and the rest are hungry wolves! The wolf players move by placing cards that show where their next move will be (akin to Wings of War), and they work as a group to corner the rabbit. The rabbit player moves relative to the wolves, trying to find a path through the danger and to the safety of their rabbit hole. Will you be the hunter or the hunted?

In addition to the movement cards, the game includes a few rabbit holes and fences to make the gameplay more varied.
publishers: HenMar Games, Mayfair Games, Peliko Oy

name: Trespass
description:
In Trespass both players set up large plastic numbers (0 through 9) on the first two rows of a 5X6 grid then each player secretly selects one of the numbers. The object of the game is simple... get your selected 'secret' number to your opponent's first row.

Pieces may move, on a clear path, as many spaces that are open or make single or multiple 'jump' moves (similar to Chinese Checkers) or combine a move by sliding and then making a jump.

Players alternate moving pieces with the only restriction being that they can't move a piece that was just moved by their opponent... moving your opponent's colour is allowed.

If your secret number is moved to your opponent's first row, you win (whether you made the move or not).
publishers: Action GT, Lakeside, Palitoy Ltd., Parker Brothers

name: Crossword Dice
description: Crossword Dice is a word dice game that involves each player throwing seven dice, each with a variety of letters and wild spaces on them. After rolling the dice, each player is given a fixed amount of time to construct a crossword based on those letters. Bonus points are scored for using letters in more than one word. After tallying your score, the dice are passed to the next player, who then rolls and tries to come up with his own crossword. After every player has had a roll, the player with the highest score wins.

name: Hop Along Frogs
description:
Splish, Splash, Splosh! There go those adorable fogs with the colored feet! Try to memorize the colors and positions of the frogs and match them to the lily pads. The player with the most matches at the end of play wins the game!

The box is the board, a pond with holes. There are frogs in a pond, and all frogs have a color at the bottom. Now everybody tries to find the color that matches the active flower on the board. Each kid who makes a right guess about the color is allowed to take a frog out of the pond.

name: Putwoody's Castle
description:
Putwoody's Castle is a Fine Free Game from Cheapass Games.

The board consists of a 5 x 4 grid representing the castle. Owners of the game supply their own colored stones (5 red, 8 blue, 11 white). On a player's turn he places a stone of any available color on any empty space in the castle. The player immediately scores 1 point for every stone of the same color adjacent to the placed stone.

The winner is the player with the most points.

name: Ranger Rick and the Great Forest Fire
description: This is a roll and move game using a spinner. Players compete to be the first to get to the fire so that they can put it out. There are event cards that can come into play from landing on a particular space or from the spinner.

name: Phalanx
description:
This Heyne travel game is played on a 2-piece board of 5x5 spaces. Each player has 5 tokens. Two opposing sides of the board are used as staring positions, but the 5 spaces always contain 2 tokens of one color and 3 tokens of the other.

Object of the game is to form a straight line of 4 tokens. To equalize the advantage of occupying the middle space of the board, this space must be left after 3 succeeding turns.

Included with this game are the rules for a second game, called "Lanxy". It is played with 3 tokens per player are uses only the inner 3x3 spaces of the board. Object of the game is to form a straight line of 3 tokens. But the player reaching this has not won the game yet: he scores a certain amount of points, depending on where he could form that row. The whole Lanxy consists of 5 games and the player with the most points is the winner.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement
publishers: Heyne, Interplay (Board Game Related), Palet spil

name: PGA Tour Finger Golf
description: Played on a high gloss durable mat that measures 2 feet by 4 feet, players flick a ringed ball-bearing towards the hole in a game that simulates the game of golf.

name: Castle Garden
description:
Chess-Like Abstract Game.
The theme setting is the middle age, with Knights and Warriora battling it out to defend the Castle Garden.

Each piece has different movement, with a particular pattern of cells it can reach, similar to the piece movement in Navia Drapt. Also the pieces move differently based on the location on the board.
The packaging is of very high level, with wooden pieces contained in a tin box, similar to the ones used to keep cookies. The rules are in thick illustrated booklet, akin to a book.

name: La Gran Conquista
description:
Exciting military strategy board game for two players (or three in case a third participant wishes to act as a judge).

Goal: Capture the flag of the opposing army.

The game is really a clone of Stratego in its Junior Version. With less military units and with more field obstacles to make it different enough.

Similar to:
Stratego (http://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/1917/stratego)
L'Attaque (http://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/9246/lattaque)


Apasionante juego de estrategia militar para dos jugadores (o tres en caso de que un tercer participante quiera actuar como juez).

Objetivo: Capturar la bandera del ejército contrario.

El juego es, realmente, un clon de Stratego en su versión Junior. Con menos unidades y más obstáculos de campo para hacerlo diferente.

Similar a:
Stratego (http://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/1917/stratego)
L'Attaque (http://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/9246/lattaque)

name: Tatu ja Patu: VirheistÃ¤ viis
description:
Tatu ja Patu – Virheistä viis has cards with two pictures. Players must find 5, 10 or 15 differences in the pictures and mark them on the cards with whiteboard pens. Players score 0-5 points depending on how many differences they find. There are several rounds played until someone gets 25 points.

The game art is based on popular Tatu and Patu children's books by Sami Toivonen and Aino Havukainen. The game play is based on Spot the Difference from University Games.

name: Cat's Party
description:
User Summary:
Cat's Party is a card-drafting game where each player holds their own party and tries to invite cats. If you gather many cats of the same color, your party warms up and you gain high reputation. You may simply play a cat card or two special cards, two cats card or a fish card. Fish card can lure other cats. Basically the goal is simple: gather as many cats of the same color as possible. But to do so, you should consider several factors while drafting, such as what color opponents are gathering, or whether you should play special cards now or not. That makes this party game so strategic that everyone from children and adults can enjoy together.

Publisher's summary:
ãCat’s Partyãã¯ããã©ããã¿ã¤ãã®ã«ã¼ãã²ã¼ã ã§ããåãã¬ã¤ã¤ã¼ã¯ãèªåã®ãã¼ãã£ã¼ä¼å ´ã«ã­ããéãã¦ããã¾ããããªãã¹ãåãã°ã«ã¼ã(åãè²)ã®ã­ããå¤ãéããã»ããããã¼ãã£ã¼ãçãä¸ããã¾ã(å¾ç¹ãé«ããªãã¾ã)ãããããªã«ã¼ãã(å¥ã®ä¼å ´ã«è¡ããã¨ãã¦ããã­ãããã³ãå¯ããã«ã¼ã)ããã¾ãä½¿ãã°ãããå¤ãã®ã­ããéãããã¨ãã§ãã¾ããåºæ¬ã¯åãè²ã®ã­ããéããã ããã¨ããç°¡åãªã«ã¼ã«ãªãããã2ã­ãã«ã¼ãããããããªã«ã¼ãããªã©ã®ç¹æ®ã«ã¼ããä½¿ãã¿ã¤ãã³ã°ããä»ã®ãã¬ã¤ã¤ã¼ã®ä¼å ´ã®ã­ãã®è²ãç¢ºèªããªããåãã«ã¼ãã¨æ¸¡ãã«ã¼ããèãããã©ããã²ã¼ã ã®æ¦ç¥æ§ãã¨ãã»ã³ã¹ã¨ãã¦å«ã¾ããå°ããªãå­æ§ããå¤§äººã¾ã§ä¸ç·ã«æ¥½ããéã¹ããã¡ããªã¼ã²ã¼ã ã§ãã

name: Hurricane Ball
description: In Hurricane Ball, each player has a goal card showing the color of plastic balls they want in a particular order in their slots of the shared central device. When you press the lever on top of the device, the balls start hopping around, ideally landing in the player slots. If you don't like the ball color in a slot, press the lever to eject the ball and put it back into play. Get the right balls in the right slots, press the button on top, and you win!

name: Snoopy Come Home
description:
Based on the movie of the same name, with a blue cover depicting Snoopy and Woodstock. Standard track game in which players attempt to find Snoopy, and bring him home.

Players need to first bust Snoopy out of Lila's apartment where he has gone after visiting Lila (his original owner) in the hospital. Then it's a free-for-all as everyone tries to take control of Snoopy and return him to the dog house. Players can use telephone booths as shortcuts, use cards to cause the player with Snoopy to lose a turn or send a player to other locations on the board, or place a 'No Dogs Allowed' sign to block Snoopy's path.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Pony Pokal
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Ready, steady, and you're off for the pony tournament! In Pony Pokal, everyone tries to do his best – but only the player who knows the strong points of his pony can win the trophy...

name: Tracktic
description:
Thanks to your puzzle pieces and your best tactics, create the longest colored line to win!
During the game, block your adversaries’ paths, or flip their pieces to integrate them with your own line. But be careful because these new white pieces can benefit all players!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition

name: Murder Mystery Party Case Files: Mile High Murder
description:
INVESTIGATE A MURDER IN THE SKIES - Solve a murder mystery with friends. Open the Mile-High Murder Case File to start the crime scene investigation. Marisa Hightower was murdered on an overnight transatlantic flight from San Francisco to London. The hunt is on to find a killer and it’s up to you to solve this mile-high murder. This Case File includes all the evidence you need to solve the murder. Review every clue and piece of evidence in this unsolved mystery case file.

IMMERSIVE STORY AND REALISTIC EVIDENCE - This Case File includes crime scene photos, suspect interviews, newspaper clippings, and much more to help you determine who committed murder. All the evidence has been curated to present the most realistic experience possible (no fake handwriting). This murder mystery game in a box is the perfect gift for friends and family who love mystery board games and is perfect for family game night, an evening with friends or for date night for couples who love cold case murder mysteries. Get your Sherlock on to solve this murder mystery.

DETERMINE MOTIVE, MEANS AND OPPORTUNITY - Murder Mystery Party Case Files is the only game where players solve the murder the way a real detective would. Players need to hunt through the evidence to find the killer and determine the motive, means and opportunity of each suspect. During a murder investigation, a detective must answer the following 3 questions: 1) Motive: Who had a reason to kill the victim? 2) Means: Who had access to the murder weapon and victim? 3) Opportunity: Who had a chance to kill the victim? Is any particular person unaccounted for during the time the victim was killed?

ONLINE HINTS AND SOLUTIONS If you get stuck anytime during your investigation, you can access misplaced case files online for hints to keep you moving. Once you think you know the solution, access complete solutions online to confirm your suspicions and make an arrest.

Case File Contents:
· 12 Suspect and Evidence Photos
· 1 Air Marshal Notebook
· 37 Pieces of Case Evidence and Instructions
· Online Access to Hints and Solutions

Crime Location: International Flight

Background: Marisa Hightower was murdered on an overnight transatlantic flight from San Francisco to London (with emergency landing in Iceland).

name: Isabella
description:
Isabella, the little witch, is brewing a magic potion. She is throwing all kinds of ingredients in her cauldron. Sometimes she forgets whether an ingredient is already in her cauldron or not. Help Isabella to remember and score wizard hats in return.

Each turn ingredients are placed in Isabella's cauldron. You can score a wizard hat if you can remember which ingredients are in her cauldron. The player with the most wizard hats at the end of the game, wins the game!

name: The Baseball Card Game
description:
Quick-playing card game of MLB baseball. Comes in several themed team editions.

Players take turns playing cards that represent hits, steals strikeouts, flyouts, and other baseball plays. The cards themselves represent baserunners. Standard baseball rules determine scoring.

name: Finish
description: A horse racing game, adding a variety of jockeys to the more standard variety of horses and betting mechanisms.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Des thunes et des urnes
description:
This is a satirical game about French politics.

The players try to be the next president of France by buying votes and bluffing.

name: Befour You Know (The Color will Show)
description:
The game is played on a board full of squares in which you place colored pieces. The first one to get four in a row of their color wins.

But there are some twists: Only you know what color you are. (You draw a color randomly, face down at the beginning of the game). Pieces are drawn from a bag and have to be played, no matter what color they are. "Wild" pieces assist any player, counting as whatever color is necessary. There is a hidden element and a random element to the otherwise traditional "four-in-a-row" game.

name: Adoradores de Cthulhu
description:
Adoradores de Cthulhu is a variation from the game system from Werwolf for 6 to 18 players.
One player is the guardian. He control the events in the Arkhan City, where each player has a secret role: cultists os citizens (some citizens with special powers).
The goal from the cultists is to kill every citizen, one by one. If they achieve these goal, then Cthulhu will come to our world.
The goal for the citizens is to kill all cultists.
Every round has a night fase (where the cultists kill one citizen) and a day fase where everyone (including the cultists) discuss and vote to kill one player.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Bretagne (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
Brittany (French: Bretagne) is a cultural region in the north-west of France.

The map contains ferries as well as several long routes making use of some of the extended rules as seen in Ticket to Ride Europe.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Monopoly: United States Army
description:
A Monopoly clone sold primarily through the military Post Exchange system, although it is also available on Amazon.com.

From the Manufacturer: Over 700,000 active duty personnel. Army bases replace traditional property. Tokens include: Bradley tank and Combat boots.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: All kinds of flowers profusion
description:
This is a wonderful trick taking game.

The cards are 4 colors and the numbers are 5, 6, 8, 13. But the same numbered and same colored cards are included.

The trick is the same with like Wizard, Skat and so on. But a player can play any cards with the same number. And the cards are added the number each other.
So if you have 13(Max), you may lose three 5 cards. Then this game is a wonderful trick taking game.

The points are calculated by the cards with the money.
Theme is the era of war from 1400-1600. But the war is very beautiful.

name: The Good Dinosaur: Roarin' River Game
description:
Race the rapids to get home!

Work together as a team to hep Arlo and his friends outrun the flooding river! Travel through Dangerous Canyons, Mountain Forests, and Sweeping Plains!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Geni 2000
description:
A trivia game where you will go around the outer circle and collect genius tiles by answering correct on at least one question in each subject. Then choose a favorite way (2 subjects that fits you) towards the center, where you have to answer correctly on a question, which category the opponents chooses.

The 5 subjects are "Big headlines", "Progresses and discoveries", "Cultures and Pleasures", "Sport of the century" and "Everyday life and curios". All questions are about the 20th century in some aspect and they work as documents of the century that has passed.

The game only exists in Sweden and the title Geni 2000 means "Genius 2000".

name: Pulijudam
description:
Originally an ancient Hindu game for children, Pulijudam is a two player strategy game free from elements of chance. It is almost an abstract strategy game, but one of its alternative names, "Lambs and Tigers", suggests the theme overlaid for children.

Pulijudam is very similar to Bagh Chal and Fox and Geese - it is essentially a member of the Hnefatafl family of asymmetrical abstract games, although of very different origin. One player uses three pieces representing tigers; the other player uses fifteen pieces representing lambs. The initial placement of the three tigers is fixed. The lamb player begins to place his fifteen lambs wherever they wish in the twenty remaining spaces on the board; neither side can move any pieces until all of that type have been placed. Therefore the tigers may begin to move from the third turn while the lambs may only move from the fifteenth turn.

Each piece may move to any vacant adjacent space on the board (effectively orthogonally). Tigers may 'eat' lambs by jumping over an adjacent lamb into a vacant space beyond.

The game is won when the tigers have captured all the lambs or the lambs have encircled the tigers preventing them from moving.

name: Monopoly: My NHL
description:
Introducing the first ever MONOPOLY game that YOU customize! Choose 22 of the 30 NHL teams and place your favorite team labels on the game board in the order you choose. Which teams will you choose? Which team will you put on Boardwalk? Park Place? Baltic? It’s your say, which teams play! So, set it up your way. Then. . . buy, sell and trade your favorite teams in an effort to own and control the NHL, every hockey fan’s fantasy. The team labels are removable and reusable so if you choose, you can play a different game each time. Features six oversized tokens including the Stanley Cup® trophy, goalie and puck.

Create it… Play it… Own it All… YOUR way! The NHL is yours for the taking!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Film Fixer
description:
Game description from the back of the box:

"Film Fixer" is a card game based on the theme of the film industry. Each player becomes a producer of the movie, or hire the talent, we will increase the influence in the industry by creating a slush fund or been successful in investing, or making a movie variety. Rivals and won the "psychological warfare", it becomes "mastermind" who do you think true...

Game description from user:

"Film Fixer" is a 3-4 player card game based on the theme of producing movies in the film industry. Although this game was made in Japan, the company has made it bi-lingual (although a few of the translations are a little strage).

Each player starts with a new talent card and 8 coins. The player uses coins to purchase (contract) "talent" and sends them to "movies" in order to earn more money and victory points.

Contents:
4 - Newcomer Cards
36 - Money Cards (9/6 coins, 12/3 coins, 15/1 coins)
37 - Movie Cards (15/Talent cards, 11/QE Film cards, 11/CP Film cards)
1 - The End Card

Each turn is conducted in 6 phases:

1 - Investment
2 - Change
3 - Contracting
4 - Shooting
5 - Profit
6 - Replenishing

The instructions provided are a little confusing at first, but I'll do my best to try and summarize them.

The movie cards (talent and film cards) are shuffled, the END card is placed two from the bottom, and 5 cards are dealt into the play area.

1 - In the investment phase non-acting players can invest money in what they think the acting player will do. Money cards each have one of three logos on them: Yukidama Agency Corp. (for all talent cards [YA]), Qvinta Essentia Entertainment Inc. [QP] and Cosaic Pictures Inc. [CP] (the two movie companies). The invested money is placed face down and players wait until phase 5 (where they see if the acting player has played any of the companies non-acting players have invested in.

2 - In the change phase the acting player can choose to pay one coin to switch out one movie card with a new one. They can do this as many times as they'd like as long as they have the money to do so. They do not receive change from this transaction.

3 - In the contracting phase the acting player can purchase "talent" which will be placed face up infront of them. Talent often have various abilities that will affect play. In this phase, players can receive change from this transaction.

4 - In the shooting phase the acting player sends talent (this includes their "new talent" card) to film cards (if any in the play area). They can send multiple talent to work on different films as long as those films are being produced by the same company (you can't send one talent to CP and one to QE in the same turn. Either one or the other). You can also send multiple talent to the same film (as co-stars). The acting player will collect money and the film card (film cards go into the victory point pile). If the sent talent card has a star mark on it, it is discarded.

5 - In the profit phase the other players will collect their reward if they properly invested their money (for example: If player B decides to invest a "one coin" card with the CP logo on it and the acting player (player A) sends tallent to a CP film, then player B will be rewarded [they can either put the invested money into their VP pile or upgrade it to the next higher value coin card]). If the non-acting player invested in the wrong company, that invested money is discarded.

6 - In the replenish phase new movie cards are dealt into the play area until there are 5 cards again. It is now the next player's turn and it becomes the investment phase again.

Once the END card is dealt, the game will finish after the "next" player's turn. Once finished, each player counts their Victory Points. Player with the most VP is the winner (if tie, the player who made the most movies wins).
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Commodity Speculation, Open Drafting

name: Dynamit Joe
description: Tom, the sheriff of Goldfever, advances slowly in the center of the deserted street. The James brothers gang is downtown. Yesterday, they started a brawl at the saloon and today, Tom must expel them. The confrontation is inevitable, Tom carries his faithful 6-shots to the belt and his Winchester with the hand. Further, the James brothers also prepare to receive the sheriff, William posted himself in ambush at the corner of the street whereas his two brothers wait close to the saloon? All the ingredients of the best westerns are joined together in the same game: banks robbery, payback, duels, ambushes.

name: Stubborn
description:
Stubborn(tm) is the easiest of the "Mining Order From Chaos" (tm) games. Stubborn does not have a game board, thus simplifying the task of finding a home for your tiles. Stubborn is a great solitaire game, but can easily accommodate up to six players.
The game is played by each player blindly choosing six tiles. A specially marked Starting Tile is turned face up, and then the players take turns placing their tiles in correct color pattern and numerical sequence. The first person to place all their tiles (the most stubborn player!) wins.
There are three increasingly difficult levels of Stubborn: Simply Stubborn, Downright Stubborn and Certifiably Downright Stubborn.

name: Dice Games
description: Dice Games is a book explaining and illustrating instructions on how to play 10 different dice games. The games are relatively basic and are intended for children. The games included are: Pig, Thirty-Six, High Dice, Rotation, Cross Out, Tic-Tac-Toe Dice, Going to Boston, Multiplication, Help Your Neighbor, and Horse.

name: I've Never... The Outrageous Game of Truth
description:
"I've Never...? The Game of Truth" is an adult party and drinking game similar to Truth or Dare in which people reveal what they have and haven't done in their lives. Players move around the board and perform various actions such as taking drinks, giving drinks, dancing, singing, and spinning in a circle. Players move their pieces by answering "I've never..." cards-- for example, "I've never had sex in a hot tub." If the player answers "true" he or she may be able to move forward or give someone a drink. If "false," the player may have to take a drink or do something silly, such as sing a nursery rhyme.

Game contents include game board, game rules, dice, 8 Playing Pieces, 100 I've Never…? questions (including 10 blank Make Up Your Own cards). This game is intended for people aged 21 and older.

name: Lilli's Favorite Clothes
description:
Game description from the publisher:

What do Lilli and her friends want to wear today? Be it a skirt or short trousers, blouse or shirt, sneakers or ballet flats, inside Lilli's wardrobe are the most amazing clothes. But where are the stripy socks again? In the drawer or in the wardrobe? Whoever memorizes well the location of the tiles and has some luck in Lilli's Favorite Clothes will be able to dress her girl first.

name: Bible Hunter
description:
Bible Hunter is a card game with themes from the Old and New testament, with artwork in manga style. The game has three types of cards, characters (red cards), that can be persons like the patriarchs or prophets, Jesus or the apostles, and items, like swords or money (green), and mission cards (blue).

Players starts with four cards, two characters and two missions. The players take turns, selects one of the three cards on the board, and then tries to collect this by playing one character card. The strongest character gets the card. It is good to have strong characters, but some of the gives minus points if in hand then a round is completed, eg. Satan (-20 victory points)

The cards collected can be put together to complete a story. The round ends then a player can complete a whole biblical story, and then all players count there victory points. The game is played in three rounds, and the player with most victory points after the third round is the winner.

name: Victory Circle
description:
Victory Circle is a variant on the old Trap the Cap game.

The object of the game is to be the player with the most capped and/or captured pieces at the end of the game. You can only cap one piece at a time; it is best to drag the capped piece back to your Victory Circle --where it'll remain until the end of the game. When you cap a piece that is itself capping another, you get to keep either one capped, setting the other free (sending it back to its own Victory Circle). The green spaces are safe.

The game ends when all of a player's pieces are capped or captured. If keeping score, captured pieces are worth 3, capped pieces 1.

name: UNO: South Park
description:
Basic Uno-themed card game.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The 'Dead Kenny' card. By playing this card, you choose a player (kill them) and they must draw cards until another card with Kenny on it turns up. When drawn, play continues with that card, and the player keeps all other cards drawn. If another 'Dead Kenny' card comes up, they get to 'kill' another player, and so on.

As a side note, the box says "Ages 18+" though I'm not sure why.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Beadecked
description:
From the Box:

The Beadazzling Card Game
For 2-6 players, Aged 6 and up
5 shapes, 4 colors, 3 patterns. Match 2 of the 3 to make a beadlightful string of Beadcards. You'll be beadsotted with them all!

6 Different Easy-To-Learn Card Games!
Beadecked - Build an unbeadlievably beadutiful Beadcard necklace.
Beadspoke - Tailor-make your own string or Beadwitch another Beader by beading on theirs.
Beadtween - From beadginning to end, taking beads is the trick. But don't wait, you might bead late!
Beadmarket - In this Go Fish! twist, if another Beader won't beadstow a match, the Beadmarket may.
Beadominoes - Create one beadazzling string in this Dominoes modbeadification.
Beadrummy - Form combeadnations of 3 and 4 Beadcards in this beadguiling spin on Rummy.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Game System
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Trivio 3000 la fuerza del saber
description:
Spanish 80´s clone of the popular game Trivial.

From the spanish box:

"¡Este juego contiene más de 3000 preguntas, participa y que las fuerzas del saber te acompañen!"

"This game has more than 3000 questions, play and may the forces of knowledge be with you!"

name: Monopoly Junior: Finding Dory edition
description: An edition of Monopoly Junior, with Disney/Pixar Finding Dory theme, that features exclusive Finding Dory tokens. The game is like the classic Monopoly game but easier for kids. And it features properties from Disney/Pixar Finding Dory Movie.

name: Pasta-Pasta
description: Hold your pasta in your lap out-of-sight and choose as many as you wish in one closed fist. Reveal the number of choices and add them to the number others have revealed simultaneously. Move the marker around the pot. The color the cook lands on gets to put a pasta in the pot. When you are out of pasta, you win.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Bringing Down the House
description:
Takes the basic idea of Bunco and adds a house building element. Players roll special dice, then build parts of their house if the correct symbols were drawn. Roll dice that did not allow you to build and you must pass the dice to the next player or set of players. Roll 3 of a kind and you must start over.

From the manufacturer's website -

Bringing Down the House™
The Groundbreaking Dice Rolling Game

Choose your partner, grab the dice and get ready to roll! Bringing Down the House will have everyone shaking in their seats.

Compete against the other players to roll the right combination of dice, at just the right time, to build your house.

Roll 3 of a kind and the Foundation will shake and you must start over. Finish first and ring the bell to win!

name: Turnabout
description: Each player starts with 6 cards. The object of the game is to be the first to discard their entire hand each round and collect all the points. The dice dictate which cards you can discard, so it's fairly random.

name: Manara Game
description:
From back of game:
A special pack of cards, a true collector's item with 54 illustrations by a master of eroticism with which a special and intriguing game can be played

Players: 2 to 6
Length of game: 20'-30'
Ages 18 and up

Each player gets 3 cards and 3 cards are put on the table. Then each player in turn may exchange 1, 2 or all 3 cards in his hand with the ones on the table. Or he may pass. When all players pass the cards are removed from the table and 3 new added from the remaining pile.
The object is to get 3 cards of the same color in your hand. When you have 3 cards of the same color in your hand then you say 'Manara' and put down the cards in front of you. All cards, except the winning set, are then collected, shuffled and a new hand is dealt. Any player who receives the Manara card may put it down in front of him and receive a new card from the pile immediately.
After 10 deals the players now have a number of sets in front of them and scoring begins. Each set of 3 scores 1 point. If a player have all 6 cards of one color then he receives a bonus point. The player with the Manara card in front of him also receives a bonus point.
According to the rules, the losing players should now remove one piece of clothing for each point by which they lost to the winner...

((From Hakko504's first impressions thread))
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Jenus: Il Gioco
description:
From the publisher:
What would happen if Jesus returned to Earth and swooped down from the Kingdom of Heaven crashing to the ground, losing his memory? Just like Jenus, you too have a mission but you do not remember what it is! Embark on a journey to divine glory, to discover your lost memory. Fight to rise to holiness or world domination. Perform miracles, dispense indulgences, fight against demons evoked by the Vatican and spread the Word. You will be Jenus, returned to earth to give hope to the people, the tender Angius, the redeemed Paolo Brosio, the chaste Claudia Koll or the cruel ex-pope Ratzinger?

Inside you will find: rules, 74 cards, 5 Player Cards, 5 Holiness Points tokens and 5 Hit Points tokens and 1 First Player token

At the beginning of the game you will be given a covered character card that you can not watch until you reach 5 Sanctity points.
The five available characters are: Jenus, Angius, Claudia Koll, Paolo Brosio or Ratzinger, each with specific abilities according to their class (two humans, two deities and a clerical one).

The round is developed in 3 phases.
1 - Divine Intervention (at the beginning of the turn, a card is drawn from the Divine Intervention deck, which affects players during the round)
2 - Actions of Characters (the player chooses an action to: evangelize, attack, draw a Miracle card or draw an Indulgence card)
3 - The Demon attacks (The Demon attacks each player, who must defend himself by throwing the dice.)

The winner will be the first to reach his goal.

Dal sito dell'editore:
Cosa accadrebbe se Gesù tornasse sulla Terra e nella sua discesa in picchiata dal Regno dei Cieli si schiantasse al suolo, perdendo la memoria? Proprio come Jenus, anche tu hai una missione ma non ricordi più qual è! Intraprendi un viaggio verso la gloria divina, alla scoperta della tua memoria perduta. Lotta per assurgere alla santità o al dominio del mondo. Compi miracoli, dispensa indulgenze, combatti contro demoni evocati dal Vaticano e diffondi il Verbo. Sarai Jenus, tornato sulla terra per dare speranza alle genti, il tenero Angius, il redento Paolo Brosio, la casta Claudia Koll o il crudele ex-papa Ratzinger?

All'interno troverete: un regolamento, 74 carte, 5 Schede Giocatore, 5 segnalini Punti Santità e 5 segnalini Punti Ferita e 1 segnalino primo giocatore

A inizio gioco vi verrà consegnata una carta personaggio coperta che non potrete guardare finché non raggiungerete5 punti Santità.
I cinque personaggi disponibil son: Jenus, Angius, Claudia Koll, Paolo Brosio o Ratzinger, ciascuno con specifiche abilità a seconda della classe d’appartenenza (due umani, due divinità e un clericale).

Il round si sviluppa in 3 fasi.
1 – L’Intervento Divino (all'inizio del turno viene pescata una carta dal mazzo degli Interventi Divini, che influenza i giocatori durante il round)
2 – Le Azioni dei Personaggi (il giocatore sceglie un’azione tra: evangelizzare, attaccare, pescare una carta Miracolo o pescare una carta Indulgenza)
3 – Il Demone attacca (il Demone attacca ciascun giocatore, che dovrà difendersi lanciando il dado.)

Chi raggiungerà per primo il proprio obiettivo sarà il vincitore.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Religious
publishers: Freak & Chic LLC, Magic Press Edizioni Srl (MPE), Raven Distribution

name: Geografacts
description:
Individually or in teams, players draw a card that represents either a country or a U.S. State and answer standard questions in order to move. Each country is assigned a number, and the answering player/team gets to look at one of several maps for aid in answering the 5 questions.

The marker moves forward 3 points for the first 2 questions answered correctly (usually Continent and Country name) and 1 point for the last three questions (usually capitol, official language, and currency).

The team/player that has the marker reach the end first is the winner.

Updates for border changes used to be available by mailing the company.

name: Greed
description:
Each player starts with $100,000. Deal the all the cards to the players evenly. The players lay out the cards dealt face down in front of themselves. Each player in turn flip over one of their own cards.

If the card has a money amount on it the player gains that much money. A player who flips over a "Loser" card is out of play for the round. Flipping over the third of the four "Jackpot" cards earns the player $500,000. Flipping over a "Greed" cards lets the player take a card from another player. The player may then ask for any amount from the player from whom the card was stolen. A called bluff will earn the victimized player the requested amount.

The game continues until a winner with one million dollars is declared.

name: Batman: Le sauveur de Gotham City
description:
After months of preparation, the Joker released twelve of the most wanted Super Villains who are Batman's worst enemies from Blackgate Prison and Arkham Asylum: Bane, Penguin, Scarecrow, Double Sided , Deathstroke, Mr Freeze, the mystery man, Poison Ivy, Harley Quinn, Ra's al Ghul, Man bat and Killer Kroc.
Together, they have developed 10 projects to destroy the City of Gotham City. Will the Joker and his cronies manage to destroy Gotham City and escape before Batman and his allies stop them?
Draw one of the 10 evil Joker projects and then create your own scenarios. Choose your side and play as a villain or a hero to save or destroy the city!

Après des mois de préparation, le Joker a fait évader de la prison de Blackgate et de l’Asile d’Arkham douze Super-vilains les plus recherchés qui sont les pires ennemis de Batman : Bane, le Pingouin, l’Épouvantail, Double face, Deathstroke, Mr Freeze, l’homme mystère, Poison Ivy, Harley Quinn, Ra’s al Ghul, Man bat et Killer Kroc.
Ensemble, ils ont mis au point 10 projets pour détruire la Ville de Gotham City. Le Joker et ses acolytes parviendront-ils à détruire Gotham City et à s’enfuir avant que Batman et ses alliés ne les arrêtent ?
Tirez au sort un des 10 projets maléfiques du Joker et créez ensuite vos propres scénarios. Choisissez votre camp et incarnez un vilain ou un héros pour sauver ou détruire la ville !

name: DespuÃ©s de Colditz
description:
"Después de Colditz" (After Colditz) is the sequel to the acclaimed game "Fuga de Colditz" (Escape from Colditz), designed by Major P. R. Reid, B. Degas and the production team at NAC.

The escape from the castle was only the beginning of a long adventure that would take the prisoners along several escape routes out of Germany. The most important routes were Switzerland, Spain, the Baltic (on to Sweden) and Bretagne (on to Great Britain).

Along the escape routes the players will encounter many obstacles such as the German army, the Gestapo, German civilians, etc. Intelligence, stamina, the knowledge of foreign languages, luck and audacity are all represented in the game.

One of the players will lead the German security forces and the rest will play as teams of escapees.

name: LISTicles
description: A category card and a bonus letter are revealed each round. Players have 90 seconds to write out seven entries that fulfill the category. Only unique answers will score and entries that begin with the bonus letter earn extra points. Play continues until 4 rounds are played. Each player adds up their scores for all four rounds and the player with the most points wins the game.

name: Pass the Trash
description:
This is a four player action game. Each player controls two paddles, one advances the two garbage trucks that move on a turntable in the center of the game while the other shoots marbles (trash) into a chute positioned above the turntable. Objective is to dump your trash into the garbage trucks as they pass under your chute. One of the trucks, however, has a hole in it, meaning it can pass trash back into the player's bin.

The first player to get rid of all his marbles wins.

name: Squares
description:
CONTENTS:
Frame and stands which forms a 4x5 grid of boxes
50 white and red blocks
40 scoring pegs.

OBJECT
To be the first to make 10 or more squares.

from the rules:
"It plays exactly as the 4x5 box version of the pencil and paper game of DOTS & BOXES, or FENCES"

On your turn you swivel a block which is like drawing a line in pencil on the pencil and paper game. Completing a square gives another turn, and to complete a square can not be ignored.

name: Cursed!
description:
Cursed! is the outrageous card and voodoo doll game that allows you to take out all of life's little mishaps on the other players. You become a voodoo enthusiast by placing curse after curse on players who deserve them most.

Each player has his own colored voodoo doll which represents his standing in the game. Once you have the power of the voodoo, you can give someone curses by playing cards upon them. If you have the fewest pins stuck in your doll when someone reaches 10 pins, you become Voodoo King and win the game.

name: Six Shooter
description: Six Shooter is a fun, fast-paced, easy to learn dice game where all players play at the same time. Each player rolls 6 dice and attempts to complete the goal on the current card. The first player to get 6 in a row on their board wins!

name: Harry Potter: The Triwizard Maze Game
description:
From the box:

"Face the Challenge of the Triwizard Tournament! Enter a maze filled with creatures and magic as you race for the Triwizard Cup! Be the first to get through the maze, claim the cup and win the Triwizard Tournament"
categories: Children's Game, Exploration, Fantasy, Maze, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Mattel, Inc., Pressman Toy Corp., Reflexshop

name: Sonic the Hedgehog Game
description:
In Sonic the Hedgehog players roll and move a spiny mammal through four levels based on the video game of the same name.

Each player takes turns rolling a die and moving the Sonic token. All players move the same piece throughout the game. While moving, players pick up ring tokens when they land on special squares. At the end of the first three levels is a warp zone that allows one player to collect bonus coins. At the end of the fourth level, players must battle Dr. Robotnik to gain more coins and end the game.

Battling and collecting bonus coins is resolved by simple die roll. As well, players each have 3 tokens to aid during their turn and 3 tokens to hinder an opponent at will.

After the final battle, the winner is the player with the most coins.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Master Criminals!
description: Master Criminals! is a mystery card game of high intrigue. You assume the role of both Chief Investigator and Master Criminal. Are you clever enough to avoid detection while pursuing your fellow felons?

name: The Flintstones Stoneage Game
description:
The game that rocked Bedrock! Players search Bedrock and collect sets of cards with characters, locations, or objects (Fred's Car) from the show.

Includes game board, 4 scoring pegs, game cards, and instructions.

name: Switch-away
description: Roll and Move Children's game, where players try to move their car from start to finish. The board is a track with 5 moving turntables on it. Each turntable connects certain paths and disconnects others. The game has a rural theme.

name: Der GrÃ¼ffelo: Alles wird gut!
description:
In Der Grüffelo: Alles wird gut!, alles won't be gut unless you can reach the gruffalo before the owl, snake and fox fully emerge from the forest and eat you up, you being a tasty little mouse.

To set up play, arrange the nine tiles in a 3x3 field with the gruffalo tile at the end of the dotted path on these tiles. Place the four tiles each for the owl, snake and fox next to these tiles. Players take turns rolling the die. On a 1-3, the player moves the mouse figure this many spaces forward; if you advance off of a tile, then flip it face down. If you roll an owl, snake and fox, flip one of these respective animal tiles face up. If all four tiles of an animal are face up and you roll the animal again, you must move the mouse backwards on the path. If you don't have a tile on which to move (since you've flipped it), then everyone loses. Reach the gruffalo space before this happens, however, and you all win!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Joust
description: Joust is a very brief two player game themed around jousting, inspired by En Garde and Pico, where players plan out their strategy by stacking a small group of cards - and then play them out in this fixed order.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Medieval, Print & Play

name: PokÃ©mon On A Roll Game
description:
This is a dice game where players attempt to roll patterns of Pokémon with the dice before rolling a Poké Ball and losing their turn.

From the publisher: Chimchar, Turtwig and Piplup accompany players in this exciting new Pokémon game. Roll the dice and set aside any Pokémon character that will help you get the patterns you need on your card. Roll as many times as you want on every turn, but watch out -- if you roll the Poké Ball, your turn ends and you can't score in that round. First player to get all seven patterns wins.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck

name: Doctor, Doctor!
description:
From the box:

Doctor! Doctor! Come Quick! It's poor Mr Illbert! He's sick in bed again. Does he have Burning Ears, or is it an outbreak of the dangerous Stiff Upper Lip? Maybe it's Love Sickness... Or is he Just Fakin'? If your diagnosis is correct, it'll speed you up the ladder from Medical Student to Chief Doctor! (and Mr. Illbert will be eternally grateful to you too).

name: Collector ... das markante Gesellschaftsspiel fÃ¼r Pfiffige
description:
Collector is similar to Trivial Pursuit, but you have to collect stamps instead of slices.

Categories of this game are:
- Sports and Games
- Science and Technology
- Economy and Society
- Arts and Culture
- History and Politics
- Nature, Environment and Social Matters

Under certain circumstances you can lose stamps and you'll have to give them to the other players.

name: Noah's Ark Race Game
description:
A simple roll and move game for youngsters.

The animal discs are placed face up on the board. Player's move by throws of the die and follow the path. If you land exactly on an animal disc, then you can place it in your ark. Watch out for the different coloured spaces, some help, some hinder. The first player to fill their ark, wins.

There is a game variant where points are awarded for the various animals. The most points earned, wins.

Contents
1 Playing Board.
4 Pawns.
1 Die.
4 Noah's Ark Cards.
21 Animal Counters.
Rules Are Printed on Inner Box Base

name: Tournament Fishing: The Deckbuilding Game â Dice
description:
A new way to play the game! Instead of a deck of cards, 3 dice are used in the Reel Phase if you want to chunk some plastic for a change to see how hard the fish fight.

Along with the dice, 72 cards also come in this expansion that replace cards from the core game and other TF expansions, converting them to be playable with either mode! (Additionally 9 cards from the core game were changed for balancing reasons.)

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Memory, Push Your Luck

name: Visual Brainstorms
description:
A trivia/puzzle game akin to MindTrap, but more child-friendly. The questions require mostly critical and mathematical thinking, there are only a few lateral thinking questions. The cards are large and colorful. The questions are always accompanied by a large illustration, and the answers often come with diagrams and examples.

The difficulty of each question is reflected in how many points it is worth: yellow questions are worth 1 point, blue are worth 2 points, red are worth 3 points, and "bonus" questions are worth 1 point. Gameplay and scoring take a back seat to the actual questions. You can play for a certain amount of time, for a certain number of cards, or until a player gets a certain score.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Educational, Math, Party Game, Puzzle, Trivia, Word Game

name: HumanKind
description:
"Welcome to the contest for the future of HumanKind. Choose your team. Fight for the Future."

The second CCG produced in Chile, HumanKind depicts the underground war between four great factions (the Corporation, Acracia, Quimera and Abismales) for the control of the world. Each player represents a faction in the game, with his forces and resources represented by his 54-card deck. Your objective is to destroy your opponent's Sanctuary before he destroys yours, through the use of your Characters, Technologies, Manipulations, and Virtues.

Remember, the future of HumanKind is in your hands.

More information in the game's official site:

http://www.humankind.cl
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction

name: Escape the Temple
description: Trapped in darkness, the explorers in Escape the Temple hear strange noises and are constantly being pursued by a wild monkey! Secret passages are hidden under the temple slabs, but also traps from which it is necessary to free oneself. Can they find the keys and escape from the adventure together?

name: Twister Ultimate
description:
Description from the publisher:

Add a burst of fun into any party or family night with the hilarious game that ties players up in knots. The Twister Ultimate' game features a larger mat with 2 times the numbers of spots! You'll still enjoy classic Twister gameplay but now the game also features 2 special gameplay options that make it even more outrageous and fun. Choose to play Spot Elimination to lose a row and make the game more challenging, or play Spinner's Choice -- where the spinner chooses the next move. Play whichever way, but don't fall over. The last player standing wins!


Classic Twister gameplay
Features 2 gameplay options
Larger mat with more spots
The last player standing wins
Includes game mat, spinner board with arrow and base, and instructions (mat dimensions 64 inches x 93 inches).
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Find Nix
description: Raupe and Co. abound on the colorful cards. On what object do they sit? What shape and color is the background? Only those who keep track here, gain points.

name: Mob Strategy: The Takeover Game
description:
A Chinese-chess-like game in which players try to rub out their opponent's boss. Each type of piece has certain movement limitations. The Valentines (white heart) fight the Diamonds (black, move first). You win by eliminating the opposing Boss or by occupying the opposing warehouse on the board.

The Bosses (heart, diamond) move one square orthogonally. They may also jump onto their Car (they henceforth move with the Car).
The Punks (pistols) move one square orthogonally or diagonally.
The Hoods (violin cases) move like bishops, diagonally any distance.
The Cars move like rooks, orthogonally any distance.

No piece can jump over another. A piece is eliminated if a rival piece ends its move on its square.

name: Casino Pirate
description:
To increase his booty, a pirate worthy of his name must know how to bluf without blinking an eye.*


Each player gets 10 treasures to bid with. Players keep the cards hidden and try to get as close to 7 1/2 as possible, but no higher.

Has its roots in Las siete y media

name: Ghostly Hours
description:
It is midnight and the ghosts can hardly wait to go to the graveyard for a night of fun but they have to be home on time. Players take turns moving around the board with the help of a rat, bat and spider. Flip the play pieces into the colored bamboo rings and move to the next colored tile of the same color.
Players who reach back in time win. Players who don't lose.

Contents:

1 game board,
3 animals,
4 ghost figures,
1 die,
1 springboard,
7 bamboo rings and
one felt mat.

name: Grapple
description:
According to the Publisher/Designer:

This is a scholastic wrestling match to cards. You begin with a take down, and then player on bottom must play a bottom card and try to pin or reverse positions with the top wrestler. Cards have moves from the top, bottom, and neutral positions as well as blood time and bonus cards. Names of the moves and the scoring of each move are on the cards. There are 4 ways to win the game. It's educational, and a lot of fun to play. No experience necessary, because all cards are color-coded. (top-blue, bottom-green, etc.) If on bottom, you must play a green card, if on top, a blue one and so forth. You play until you pin your opponent, run out of cards in your hand, or keep score and time your match.

name: Doubloon Lagoon
description:
Doubloon Lagoon is a game of exploration, battle, and chase. Players search for a lost treasure and attempt to return to their homeport with the treasure before the other players can stop them.

Seventy-five custom imaged cards allow players to execute effects and damage their opponents with Tornados, Hurricanes, Priate attacks and other surprises.

Players can explore islands with their crews or go for a straight attack on their opponents to eliminate them before they find the treasure. The varieties and combinations of strategies allow for many replay's.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Rocketball
description:
Rocketball is a futuristic strategic sports game for two players. Rocketball is avalable for free at:
http://www.invisible-city.com/play/62/rocketball
