The players are: The Emperor; the Official; Gentry/Landholder; Scholar; Silk Peasant; Rice Peasant; Wheat Peasant; and the Warlord. Each Player gets a booklet that describes your function in life. You start your life by choosing a booklet in random. And you act according to the role described in your booklet until you achieve your next position in life.

The object of the game is for the players to move up or down the social ladder. How you achieve your objective depends on how you play your role in society. For example: how do you solve the social-economic-political problems of a rural society? How do you feed the people? Build public works? Collect taxes? Fight wars? Defend yourself? Revolt? Grow crops? Accumulate money? Become powerful?

The variables involved are as numerous as your personality. And how you move up the social ladder depends on your ability to interact with the other players.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Events, Grid Movement, Income, Negotiation, Role Playing, Square Grid, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Ant Eater
description: Players try to catch their color ants with their anteater which is done by moving the anteater arm back and forth so the ants move through the guide and into the holding area.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: Flip for Fun
description:
A sure-fire way to make a happy mix of children and travel. Two flipper trays with two sets of eight cards for a total of 16 games.
Games include: Learn to Spell, Alphabet, Observation, Detour, Make-a-Match, States and Capitals, Build-A-Car, Battleship, Dot Blocko, Ghost, Word Squares, Dominoes, Crazy Eights and Twenty One.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Word Game

name: Arizona Trivia
description: Arizona Trivia provides an entertaining way to learn more about Arizona. Each game contains a colorful game board (map of Arizona) as well as 1,000 interesting questions covering places, people, leisure, cactus, sports, politics, history and geography. When a question is answered correctly, the person continues with a roll of the die. The first person to make a complete tour of the state, wins! If you like Arizona, you'll love Arizona Trivia!

name: Showdown/31
description: A gang of Old West characters greets you on this deck: A Marshal, A Gambler, and A Dance Hall Queen. All ages can play SHOWDOWN/31, but the game can challenge the skills of the best. When a call of "SHOWDOWN" or "LAST DRAW VARMINTS" rings out, hang on to your hats.

name: The Smurfs Whirl & Twirl Clumsy Game
description:
Try to beat Gargamel and your opponents at this exciting card game by matching Smurf character cards to your Smurf playing boards. Spin the Smurf card dealer and take character cards from Smurf or your opponents. Give away or trade cards in order to get matching cards before Gargamel wins.

This game is sort of a Lotto game combined with the card shooter from UNO Attack!. When Clumsy turns towards you, he'll give you a card... it pops out from his gift box. If you need the card, place it on one of your playing boards. Special cards let you trade. Be the first to get all the Smurfs you need to win!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Ask Zandar
description:
On their turn, each player draws a question card, reads it out loud, guesses whether Zandar will answer affirmatively or negatively, waves their hand over the top of Zandar's globe (to trigger a light sensor), and listens to his answer. If they guessed correctly, they can either take a gem of their color from the pile and put it in front of them or onto the game board. If they guess incorrectly, they must return one.

The other players can make a "side bet" during their turn and guess at Zandar's answer. If they are right, they get a gem of their color. If they are wrong, they must return one.

There's a few other rules to the game, but that is main gist of it. The first player to place all six of their gems onto the game board wins and gets to have their fortune read by Zandar.
publishers: MB Giochi, MB Jeux, MB Spellen, Milton Bradley

name: Cabbage Patch Kids Bicycle Race Game
description: Who will win the Tour de Cabbage, the greatest bike race ever? Which cabbage patch kid will pedal past all the others. Steer your rider through the gameboard countryside. But every time you land on a cabbage, look underneath. The hidden pictures tells you where to go. It could be a shortcut to the apple orchard or you might get sent back for bike repairs.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Peanut Butter & Jelly
description:
Let's race to see who'll be first to match the pieces and make a peanut butter and jelly sandwich in proper sandwich order. Players use a spinner to acquire sandwich components: bread, peanut butter, and jelly.

This is apparently a different game than Peanut Butter & Jelly, which also had an edition from Parker Brothers in 1971.
publishers: Fundex, Parker Brothers, Random House, Inc.

name: Portsmouth Harbour Trail Game
description:
From the publisher:
Each American Adventure Game has 11"x17" game board. All playing pieces are easily cut out and folded or assembled by you. A dice or a spinner is included, along with complete rules which have interpretive information to help you get the most from your game. Travel the Portsmouth Harbour Trail in competitive game of fun and learning. Experience Portsmouth through four centuries of maritime, architectural and social history.

name: Scrab-Trap
description:
Scab-Trap is a game of strategy and the game consist of two separate crosswords grid.
The purpose of the game is to form words and to link them together in order to reach one of the square identified by a black circle, while at the same time trying to avoid the obstacles (black squares) that the adversary will inevitably place in front of you.

name: Thomas the Tank Engine's Railroad Rescue Board Game
description: Object is to remove obstacles from the train so Thomas the Tank Engine can make his run from the engine shed and back.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Trains
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Outdoor Life Trivia Game
description: Each player or team tries to correctly answer as many questions as possible, in order to be the first to advance from the start and around the playing board back to the finish

name: Star Wars Escape From Naboo
description: Sleek, elegant and breathtaking, the transport vessel used by Queen Amidala of Naboo is a handcrafted J-type ship powered by a 327 Nubian engine, specially crafted for the young leader. In keeping with the peaceful nature of the Naboo people, the Queen's ship has no weapons, only deflector shields. Queen Amidala uses her ship to escape the Trade Federation blockade and appeal her planet's cause to the Galactic Senate. Their mission is jeopardized when the hyperdrive breaks down. Now you must make repairs before the Trade Federation finds the ship and stops your critical mission.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: TRIUMPH
description: Triumph is a checkers-like game for 2-4 players, played on a hexagonal board with triangular spaces and tetrahedron-shaped pieces. The aim is to capture your opponents' pieces, which are removed from the board. The winner is the last player with pieces remaining.

name: Cluedo: Juniordetektiv
description:
The dog of inspector Cluedo, Watson, has hidden a number of items in the school of detectives. The children of the inspector are trying to find the items to advance to junior detectives. This games is distributed in the Nordic countries.

The game seems to be a simplified version of "Clue Jr. The Case of the Hidden Toys."

name: Baboon Ball
description: Each baboon has got a bat, got to bash the ball into the hole. Baboon Ball's where it's at. Players maneuver their baboon on a metal rod and try to score goals against opponents.
publishers: Action GT, Hasbro Industries (Hasbro Bradley), Prima Toys

name: The Lost World Hunt...and Be Hunted Card Game
description: Are you a human or a dinosaur? If you're a human, you're hunting for Triceratops, T-Rex and the other prehistoric giants. Dinos are after the likes of Dieter, Sarah and their machines. So draw a card - and start hunting. If you bag the prey you're after, you can stop now or you can keep on hunting. Will you play it safe, or risk it all and go for more? Remember, in the Lost World, you have to take chances.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Mars and Venus in Love Question Card Game
description: A pack of provocative questions that will keep you guessing what men and women are thinking. Score points by successfully guessing other players' answers. It's thought-provoking fun for whenever friends get together. Or use as additional questions with your Men Are from Mars, Women Are from Venus Game.

name: Rich and Famous Trivia Card Set
description:
This trivia card set is designed to be played as a stand alone game, or as a companion to such related games as Avalon Hill's Game of Trivia and Selchow and Righter's Trivial Pursuit. Contains six categories:
1 Jet Set
2 Places and Palaces
3 The Vault
4 Baubles and Bangles
5 Fortunes
6 Misfortunes

name: Lilly's Purple Plastic Purse Counting Game
description:
The Matching Pairs Game
Ages 3 and up
1 to 4 players

Count to ten with Lilly. Find the two puzzle pieces that go together - one has a picture, the other has the corresponding number. The colored borders give you another clue. The puzzle pieces are self-correcting so only the true pairs match. The game is over when all the pairs are put together. Everyone wins!

Based on Kevin Henkes's best-selling books Lilly's Purple Plastic Purse; Julius, the Baby of the World and Chester's Way.

name: Jackie Chan Adventures Game
description: Now Jackie Chan has a game that lets you share in his adventures. Take on the sinister bad guys of the Dark Hand with the Shadowkahn Spinner as you race to retrieve the magic talismans. Face the Chan Challenge where luck and power will decide who will get back to Section 13 with their talisman and who will return empty handed. And just when things seem to calm down you land on a wild card. Will you get blown off course or sent forward to seek the power of The Talismans.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Caterpillar Crawl
description:
Players roll the colored die and move their caterpillar according to the color of the vegetable that matches the color showing on the die. If a player throws red, he/she can move to a tomato for example. Make sure the caterpillar is always headed in the right direction - a string connects his head to his feet so be careful to keep his head in front. To move, a player hold the feet of the caterpillar and moves the head as far as it can reach to the color thrown. Then the feet are moved, but cannot pass the head.
When a player throws the 'caterpillar head', he/she can move anywhere he/she likes.

The player who makes it through the vegetable garden first wins the game.

name: Trap Tennis
description: Action/dexterity game based on tennis where, I guess, players try to trap the ball after their opponent serves it to them.
mechanics: Area-Impulse, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Nerf Goalie Showdown
description: Block and shoot at the same time. Move the goalie to the right or left by moving the handle. Even make him jump to block a shot. All while you are watching for an opening to fire and get one past him to score a goal.

name: The Word
description: The Word is a vocabulary game which expands and builds the players knowledge of vocabulary. The object of the game is for players to race around the board answering questions whenever they land on The Word spaces or At a Loss For Words spaces. The first player to finish is the winner.
mechanics: Memory, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Honeymooners VCR Game
description: Watch an actual scene from the Honeymooners, then race to be the first player to unscramble a short word puzzle and answer two memory-teasing questions about that scene. You score points for each right answer, and bonus points if you get them all right. The player with the highest score after five rounds wins.
categories: Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia, Word Game

name: Wide World of Sports Auto Racing Game
description: A fun filled game combining the excitement of moving cars in a race with the element of skill in overcoming obstacles in your path, which have been placed there by your competition. The object is to be the first driver who reaches the end of the race, by overcoming obstacles and using successful strategy.

name: Fleece the Flock
description: You take on the role of a televangelist trying to amass your empire of TV stations, theme parks, stretch limos, record companies, missions, and corporate jets. Starting with 50 million dollars, look out for Devil, Angel, and God's Will cards. Through it all you will be gripped by intrigue, strategy, and subterfuge that is sure to keep everyone in tingling suspense!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Pinnacle
description: Pinnacle is a rummy-type game using a standard deck of 52 cards, valued Ace - 9 = 1/2 pt. and 10 - King = 1 pt. Each player draws a hand of 7 cards and on his turn, may draw from the face-down draw pile or from the perfect knowledge discard pile, taking any card plus all others above it. When the player has a sequence of at least 3 cards of the same suit, he may meld it and score the appropriate value. The player may also add to existing melds, both his and the opponents. The value is used to move pawns on the board. The board is a large molded plastic piece with a raised area in each corner for starting areas and a raised area in the center for the goal area. Pawns may move in any direction and also jump other pawns. The winner of the game is the first person to get all his pawns into the center area.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Durch Die Republik
description:
A trivia game about the German Democratic Republic (DDR = Durch Die Republik) published after the reunification of Germany.

6000 questions with 3 multiple choice answers included.

name: Escape from Frankenstein
description: Each player moves around Frankenstein's castle, picks up the key of their colour and hopes to reach the laboratory. Frankenstein may come alive at any moment and capture any player. On reaching the laboratory the key shuts off the power. The first player to do this wins the game.

name: Solar Conquest
description:
The major governments in the world are in a desperate race to be the first to conquer all the planets in our solar system.

First, players build launch pads on earth. Then launch "Space Wheels" into orbit. Now they begin send rockets to the moon and planets. They can even, if they wish, establish a base on the moon from which to launch rockets to the planets. To get the upper hand you can even sabotage the other countries

This fun game consists of a board, dice, cards, and plastic launch pads, space wheels, and rockets.

Do you have what it takes to be the first to succeed in conquering space?

name: Sharks!
description:
Race through the oceans of the world on an adventure to find the Great White Shark. Be the first and Professor Smarty will award you a real fossilized shark tooth. Test your knowledge and learn about sharks as you play.

This is a Roll and Move and trivia game. On their turn, players roll a die and move accordingly. If they land on a Question space and answer the question correctly, they win an Action card. Players may play some Action cards instead of rolling the die.
The first player to end his turn on the Great White Shark space at the end of the board wins the game and the shark tooth.

Components:
Game board
49 question cards
40 action cards
4 playing pieces
1 die
1 shark tooth
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Trivia
mechanics: Memory, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Harmony
description: Each player takes a set of 21 hexagon-shaped tiles with either black or white centers. Every tile has colored hexsides, two sides each of blue, red, and yellow. Players alternate playing tiles, matching colored hexsides. After the first two turns, each tile must be played to match two or more hexsides. The winner is the first player to either complete a straight line of 5 of his own pieces or fully enclose any one or more opponent pieces inside 6 or more of his own pieces.

name: Curator
description:
A roll-and-move game set in the Ackland Art Museum of the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.

Your goal is to collect a set of paintings in the same theme and then "take" them to the gallery of that theme.

There are seven paintings each of seven different themes plus a wild card. Each player begins with five randomly dealt paintings. As they "move" through the museum, they will get chances to trade paintings from their hand with those in the "Art Card" (face down) pile, the "Art Storage" (face up discard) pile, or another player's hand. The first player to collect a hand of one type and get to the gallery of that type wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Who Can Beat Nixon?
description:
This game was developed immediately after Nixon's first election, and apparently by someone who did not want him to get a second term.

It is a simple Monopoly-type game, but it has an interesting asymmetrical dynamic. Essentially, one player takes Nixon and up to seven play as challengers, with Nixon trying to knock them off one by one as Primary cards come up. Players still roll to land on states and buy them, and other players pay a fee when landing on them afterwards. But buying states requires a combination of two forms of currency: money and media points. Many state spaces also trigger event and media cards, which have different effects on Nixon and challengers.

Key to the game are the four Primary cards in the Event deck. Each time one of these comes up, Nixon rolls off with the top-ranking challenger, and whichever has the highest electoral vote total gets +2 on the 2D6. Loser is out of the game, winner grabs a state of his choice from the loser, and the rest goes back to the bank. There is a “saved by the bell” re-entry card in the deck that allows a loser to stay in the game.

There also is a provision for the challengers to join forces if Nixon seems about to win, but only if they can agree on which challenger should be the winner instead! The decks include blank Media and Event cards to allow players to customize the game.
publishers: Dynamic Games / Dynamic Design Industries, Harrison-Blain of N.J.

name: Jogo Ecologia
description: In this game, players fight against four different environmental menaces (fire, deforestation, illegal hunting and fishing)by moving their agents through the combination of movement cards. The player with most menaces collected, wins.

name: Mayhem: Warrior Kings â Man to Man Combat in Ancient and Medieval Times
description:
From the Designer: "Man to man combat in the ancient and medieval world. Not only does Mayhem Warrior Kings provide a realistic "quick & deadly" combat system it also has a campaign system easily links the various battles together to form a fun and fast-paced story line. Includes over twenty different "army lists". Playable with any already based figures. Perfect for playing alone or with a group of friends..."

Small scale skirmish miniatures wargame for Ancient and Medieval figures.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Rummage
description:
Rummage - A Game Straight Out Of The Top Drawer!

This game takes place in your own house. The board has several rooms which players mark on their score sheets as actual rooms in the place where you are playing, so the Red room might be your kitchen, the Green room might be your bathroom. Players then roll & move around the board and on entering a room another player draws question cards and letter cards from the relevant decks. So you might be asked "To name something you might see in the sky..." with the letter B. The player keeps answering questions and collecting letter cards if they give proper answers. If they fail, or take too long, their turn ends. You keep no more than 5 letters, so if you get a 6th letter, you return one you don't want.

Players also land on Rummage! squares, and must jump up, grab their letters and sprint off the the relevant room in the house. They then snatch objects from that room which start with the letter and return them to the game. So if you have the letter P and B and on the board are in the living room, you might bring back a piano and a buffalo, or maybe just a pencil and a book if that's what you find.

Other squares get everybody Rummaging, or have players swap their collections and sheets. First to get 5 different objects and reach the back door wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Rocket Toys and Games, TV Board Games Ltd

name: Guess Again
description:
A "question and answer" game (as opposed to a "trivia" game) in which players score points by correctly answering questions from a wide range of topics including history, geography, sports, etc. A card with 10 questions (five on a side) and three answers per question is placed onto the electric board. On their turn, a player picks one of the three answers by pushing the electric peg into one of the holes. If the answer is correct, the white light will illuminate and the player scores 2 points. If they answer is incorrect, the red light will illuminate. The player then takes a second guess. If this guess is correct, the player scores 1 point. Otherwise, no points are scored. The player with the highest score after a set number of rounds wins the game.

Similar to:

Electro

name: The Great Muppet Caper Card Game
description:
Card game based on the movie, played in a series of rounds until one player has 21 points.

Each player has a hand of 12 cards. Seven of the cards match the seven spaces on the board, which illustrate the story sequence of the movie. Four of the cards form a puzzle that shows the Baseball Diamond. One card is a thief card.

The players start with four cards in their hands and draw a card, then play a card each turn. There are four play options. A player may play a story card if it matches the next empty space on the board. A puzzle card may be played in front of the player. A thief card may be played against another player to have all of that player's puzzle card showing placed in a discard pile for that player. Finally, if a player cannot or does not want to play a card, one can be placed directly into the discard pile.

A round ends when the last story card is played onto the board. Points are then tallied. Each player gets a point for each story card that was played to the board in this round. A point is also awarded for each puzzle card that is still face up in front of the player. A bonus point is awarded if the player has all four puzzle cards face up. A point is subtracted from each player who is still holding a thief card in hand.

Further rounds are played, with the player with the least total points going first in each round, until at least one player has scored 21 or more points. The player with the most points wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Cardcaptors: Challenge of the Clow Spirits Game
description:
From the box:

In this CARDCAPTORS game, choose which of the four friends that you want to be. Try to collect as many Clow Spirit Cards as you can be guessing if the next hidden Clow Card has a higher or lower value than the last one that you saw. Be sure to stop when you feel that your luck is running out because if you guess wrong you will lose everything that you have collected on that turn.

Along the way, there are many challenges between players and your positions on the gameboard constantly shift as the Clow Cards reveal their powers. Up until the last moments of the game, anyone can win!
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Doquin
description:
Doquin is played on an unusual "board," namely a cube with a 4x4 grid of holes on three adjacent sides. These holes go almost all the way through the cube, and players insert wooden rods into them.

On a turn you simply insert one of your rods into a hold as far as it will go. You can capture an opposing rod by touching it with the ends of two of your pieces (after which they slide in as far as possible).

The game ends when one player has used all 10 of his rods. A player scores 1 point for each rod inserted fully into the cube and 1 point for each captured rod.

name: Diabolik: il Colpo Perfetto
description:
Diabolik - il Colpo Perfetto is a board game based on an Italian comic series about a master thief. The players assume the roles of characters on opposing sides in this game. On one side are the title character, Diabolik, and his sidekick/wife, Eva Kant. On the other are Dane and his criminal gang.

The goal of the players in control of Diabolik and Kant is to steal one of the objects on the board and escape unscathed. Dane and his gang are to prevent the theft and capture the thieves. The object of theft is randomly chosen (drawing a Mission card) at the start and kept secret from the criminals. Players can play cards to help themselves or impede their opponents, e.g. deploying and disarming traps. The die makes movement and the effects of certain cards random affairs.

The game ends when a side has won by achieving its objectives.

name: Quintet
description: Created for the movie of same name directed by Robert Altman. A commercial version of the game is available in Brazil, translated as "Quinteto".
categories: Abstract Strategy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Dutch Revolt
description:
from the MGDG website:

Early in the 16th Century, an accident of inheritance joined the Low Countries to the sprawling Habsburg Empire. The local governments disliked threats to their traditions of self-rule, and heavy taxes to support foreign wars. At the same time the Protestant Reformation, which was sweeping Europe, found ready acceptance among the affluent, literate Dutch. There was little enough to bind the independent-minded Dutch to the distant Habsburg possessions in Spain and Austria, but the devout Catholicism of the Emperors and their Inquisition now made war inevitable. When the rebellion commenced in 1566, neither side foresaw either the decades of bloody civil war or the formation of an independent Dutch State.

The Dutch Revolt is a simulation of this conflict. One player commands the Catholic forces of the Habsburg Empire under King Philip II of Spain. The other player commands the Dutch Protestant forces under William of Orange.

name: Girl Power
description: Players take turns rolling the dice and collecting tokens representing spirit, loyalty, pride and girl power. The first player to get ten girl power tokens gets to decide to take a solo win, or to continue the game until everyone has ten girl power (a group win). The various spaces and cards all reflect scenarios tending to stress the game's unabashed message of cooperative endeavor.

name: Black or White
description:
Abstract game on 6x6 grid that folds up to form the box. Players have 6 pieces each with one side black, the other white, like Reversi/Othello pieces. Pieces may move in any direction and when they jump an opponents piece, it's turned over to show your color.
An uninspiring variant on Reversi which lacks clear rules. Can you make multiple jumps? How far can you move? Can you make a better game with the contents?

name: Bagpuss
description:
Help Emily, Bagpuss and friends find homes for the lost things.

This game is based on the children’s TV series, Bagpuss about an old toy cat and his friends; toys that come to life to study the lost things their owner Emily brings into her special shop. Players move around the board taking penalties, extra goes or collecting cards with pictures of one or more of the characters from the series on them. Whenever a player has a complete set of all of the characters they can trade them in for a card from the 'lost things' pile. When all of the lost things have been drawn the player with the most wins.

name: Strip
description: A spinner with ten areas (5 blank alternating with 5 clothing symbols) is spun. If the spinner lands on a blank area, the turn is over. If the spinner lands on a clothing symbol, the player must throw the seven dice. The dice have articles of clothing some of the faces and some die faces are blank. The player must remove the articles of clothing shown on the dice if possible. If the dice show clothing that is still unrevealed it is treated as a blank face and ignored i.e. the dice show 3 blanks, 2 socks, 1 undershirt and 1 jacket, but the players shoes and shirt are still on. The player just removes his jacket and his turn is over. The last person wearing a vital piece when the rest have stripped bare is the winner.

name: Jetsons Fun Pad Game
description: The round PADS are attached to a white dome which is balanced on the center of a tall stand. The players place cars on the pads one at a time according to to the color spun on the dial, causing the pad to tilt back and forth. If the cars are not placed correctly, the cars will slip off the pads. The object of the game is to try to place all the cars on the pads without letting any fall off. If all the cars are placed on the pads without any falling off, players must remove them one at a time until the pads are empty again. Any player causing cars to fall off are out of the game. The last remaining player is the winner.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Hurry Waiter
description: Players must deliver orders from a spinning tray. Cards with food items are given to the current Waiter. The Waiter must memorize everyones order, place the food on the spinning tray and deliver them to each player before the tray stops spinning. Players tip the Waiter 25¢ (chips) for each item correctly delivered. Player with the most money after all players have been the Waiter is the winner.

name: Sneaky Pete
description: From Pressman's description: "Tell the truth or stretch it as you call out your roll of the dice from behind the bluffing shield. Each roll you get away with moves you closer into opposing territory. Watch out for Sneaky Pete - he's full of surprises!"
publishers: Peter Pan Playthings, Pressman Toy Corp.

name: Klecks: Kennst Du die Farben?
description:
From the box: Zebra Motley adores coloring everything in different colors. Occasionally he gets the color mixed up. What is red? The sun, leaf or ladybug? By turning over the card you can check your answer.

Contents:
1 zebra rod
30 cards
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational

name: Star Trek Adventure: Serie Classica
description: Italian edition only. Star Trek game based on the original series. Play your missions as Klingon, Romulan, Gorn or Human.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Movement, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Strike for GOALLL
description:
Object of the Game:-

To score as many goals as possible within an agreed period of time. A goal is scored by progressing along the playing field as indicated by the instructions on the rolled dice, by trading players, by making tactical maneuvers and overcoming the many interesting and unpredictable circumstances which will arise in the actual game or in the life of a real soccer club.

Game Contents:-

1 x playing board

2 x Dice

5 x Packs of Cards...
- Wild Card
- Free Agent
- Penalty
- Centre Circle
- Defensive Trap

Play Money

Loan Money

4 x Coloured Pawns

20 x Goal Rings

1 x Sand Timer

1 x Rules Leaflet (Full Rules)

1 x Rules Leaflet (Learn as you play method)

From the Box:
Tactical excitement on and off the pitch, including..
- corner kicks, Bakruptcy, Offside, Sendings Off, Drug Abuse, Penalty Shoot Outs..and more!

You don't have to be a football expert to play this game. Just roll the dice and get ready for a rollercoaster of emotional highs and lows as you score goals, buy and sell players, and develop game strategy.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Mann O Mann
description: This game is based on a TV- Show. 10 men are here to be voted the "Best man". Roll the dice and move around the board. From time to time vote for a man. Vote for the right one and you win.
categories: Dice, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Schlotterknie Company
description:
A game of trying to cross a pond of ice without breaking through the ice. One player secrectly notes thin parts of the ice and the others move their families (dobbers marked with the weight of that family member) across the pond.

Contains:
24 play figures (dobbers), 1 block to note where the ice is thin, 1 die, 1 game board (20x21 squares)

name: Falsies
description: Incomplete statements are read from player booklets that have the Truth, a Fib and a Whopper to complete the statement. Players choose one of the three or makes up an original lie. Bets are place on whether the reader told the Truth, Fibbed, told a Whopper or made up an original lie. The reader scores points for all players that he fooled, doubled if it was a Whopper and tripled if it was an original lie. Play ends when all players have read three statements with the high scorer winning.

name: Vortex
description: A whirlwind game of survival! A game where every move threatens to draw you deeper into the depths of the Vortex. A totally new concept in board game design that will provide hours of fun and entertainment for every member of the family. All players start in the Vortex (center of the board) with their 4 pawns and make their way through the many waves to the outer circle! Objective: Move all your pawns safely into your Life Rafts before your opponents can send you back to the Vortex, to start over again! A game of strategy and excitement with every move! EQUIPMENT: 1 Playing board, 1 die, 6 sets of colored pawns.

name: King of the Sandbox
description:
King of the Sandbox is a game of control of a school playground. It's a DTP game, requiring cutting (and pasting to cardboard if you're smart). Lots of pieces representing kids (neutral and factions), candy, sodas, stuffed animals, etc. A map of a playground is also included.

You start the game with one "troublemaker" and have to convince neutral kids to join your gang: your Smarts + 1d6 vs their Smarts +1d6. You can bribe them with quarters, candy bars, stuffed animals, etc., to influence the die roll. You can bash kids in other gangs: your Size + 1d6 vs their Size + 1d6. You can gain weapons (shake up a soda for a grenade, bop somebody with a stuffed animal, throw sand - for shame!) to influence a fight. Results can vary from broken weapon to running away to being beaten up to running home crying out of the game. You can soothe beat up kids with candy but suffer severe humiliation for being beaten up with a stuffed animal.

To win you have to control three of the six areas with members of your gang.

From the back cover: "Remember that Genghis, Caesar and Rommel were all kids once, too!" And a quote from an anonymous mom: "It's all fun and games until somebody loses an eye."

name: Obonto
description:
Contents: 1 brown felt game board; 81 wooden octagons (plus one extra piece); 2 camels; 2 zebras; 2 lions; and 1 rules booklet.

The Object of the Game: Summary - It's pretty simple: You win if you can make at least one move after your opponent can no longer make any moves. Both players take turns moving one of their three animals (Camel, Zebra, or Lion). After each move, turn over the octagon that the animal stood on before the move. Since you cannot move on or over octagons that have already been turned over, it is only a matter of time until one player is unable to move any of his animals - and the other player wins. (Let's hope it's you!).The winning player receives one point for every move that he/she is able to make after her/his opponent's animals are stuck.

name: Birds and Binoculars
description:
From the publisher:

Birds and Binoculars is an entry level strategy game for children to play while sitting around the nest, school or home. With over 20 different bird species, players must use their memory and strategy skills to collect the most flocks of birds. Birds flying around the table left and right; can you keep track of who has the bird you are looking for? Birds and Binoculars is great fun for children ages 7 and up to learn strategy and enhance their memory skills. Plus with the binoculars card, it's OK to Cheat! The player to collect the most flocks (matches) by the end of the game wins. Make sure you watch out for the Dirty Bird!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory

name: Timing It Right
description:
Kids play their way through a busy day of activities while building time-telling skills. Self-checking game helps build skills in telling digital and analog time. Includes board, game pieces, clock face and self-checking Time Table flip book.

Ages 7 - 11

name: Empires
description:
From the publisher web site:

Basically, each player owns four territories. Four territories that belong to other players. So, once someone lays down the first strike, everyone starts attacking everyone in the hopes of regaining their four territories. While laying siege to other lands, you must also defend your own, otherwise the bad people sitting next to you will take them.

The bloodshed goes on and on until someone throws down a time stop card, or runs out of cards in their deck. At that point, everyone gets to take a breather and tally up damage. If a rival player pushed one of your territories over the damage threshold, he gets to take your land. It's the original meaning of hostile take-over.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Real-time, Wargame

name: Special Agent
description: Spin and move around the board attempting to land on Suspect and Clue cards. Landing on Danger spaces allows the player to move to one of the other Danger spaces. Return to your HQ with the correct Clue and Suspect by exact count to win the game.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sunken Treasure Adventure
description: The octopus holds the keys to winning this treasure – follow the tentacles and collect blend cards as you go. Match the beginning blends to word endings and score points for each word that you make! Includes 17" x 12" game board, 24 blend cards, 24 word-ending cards, spinner and markers. Ages 6 - 8.

name: Amsterdam
description:
"The object of the game is to visit six places of interest in Amsterdam and be first to return to the starting point. You travel along the waterways exactly as you could in real life.
Taking turns to move, you are allowed to cross as many bridges as the number shown by the dice you throw. You have to stop at the places of interest you wish to visit and take a Hazard Card on your next turn. Sometimes a Hazard Card will help you on your way, at other times it may add time and trouble to your journey."

One 22" x 34" mounted playing board, white with blue canal and red bridges. 30 souvenir cards, 20 hazard cards, 5 boats, 12 discs, 1 die. Rules and cards in Dutch, English, German, and French.

name: Polly Pocket: Fashion Beach
description:
A game based on the #1 selling small doll, Polly Pocket. Polly and her friends are out at the Beach when they get invited to a super cool party, which is great, but what will they wear? It's a race through the trendy beach promenade while the girls frantically look for the outfit of their dreams.

Players travel around the board visiting different shops. When a player enters a shop, they may look at one of the face down cards located in that shop. If the item matches their dream outfit, represented on the players outfit card, they may take the article of clothing and dress their doll with it. First player to get all the items of their dream outfit and make it to the SUV to go to the party wins!

From the box:

Polly & friends are on a "what to wear?" quest,
For the hottest looks that are sure to impress
Shop 'til your card and outfit's the same,
then dash to the SUV to win the game!
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Muscle Man
description: Keep adding “weights” until this strongman takes a spill! Roll the game die to find out how many disks you have to add to Muscle Man’s weight bar . . . Put them all on one side of his bar or split your move to try to make it harder for your opponents. But if you’re the heavyweight that makes him take a spill, you’re down for the count and the remaining players go for another Muscle Man challenge. And another . . . until there’s just one player left.

name: Santa Incident. The
description:
This one game from the December 1992 issue of the Gamers Discount Club magazine.

December 25th 19??
For several years the Iranian regime have been aware of unauthorized incursions into its airspace. But it's not until Christmas Eve 19?? that a pair of aircraft on patrol along the country's northern boarders chanced across the mysterious intruder.

It's time for Santa to defend himself, designed to be played with GDW air superiority rules.

name: So ein KÃ¤se
description:
In the attic, little mice run around in search for food. They are especially fond of the sausage and tasty cheese. But beware: behind the corner, the cat may be lurking. Only a quick escape into the next mouse hole can save you.

Age 5 and up

name: Black Ball Express
description: A three dimensional board with grooves for train tracks. The board has an inner and an outer track with spur tracks on the corners for passing other trains. A black die and a white die are rolled and the players moves his trains (marbles) on the outer track and the Black Ball Express on the inner track. When the Black Ball Express lands on a train, that train is sent back to start. The player whose four locomotives (marbles) arrive at their home station first, wins the game.

name: SchlaubÃ¤r: Was ist groÃ?
description:
From the publisher...

"What is big?" the little bear asks the big bear. "The opposite of small!" answers the big bear as he continues to read the newspaper.

"Aha!" thinks the little bear as he jumps from one leg to the other. Suddenly he makes a big leap and jumps right up onto the newspaper the big bear is reading. He looks at him and asks, "What is an opposite?" Big bear smiles, folds the newspaper, takes the little bear by the hand and says, "Come on, I'll show you..."

With the help of the little clever bear, children become acquainted with opposites and learn how to express them.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational

name: Addadda
description: From the Manufacturer’s website: Due to the clever scoring opportunities, the use of simple sums leads to a very enjoyable and entertaining game. Addadda offers very good value not only for great enjoyment over the Christmas season, but also as a useful fun way for tuning up one's ability to do basic mental arithmetic for the rest of the year.

name: Sketch & Guess
description:
How are your drawing skills ? Place the 42 wooden picture squares face down on the table where everyone can reach them, and have each player pick a square and place it face down in front of them. The first player takes the chalkboard and looks at the object that is shown on this wooden picture square, without showing any of the other players. Then he does his best to draw the picture on the wooden square and shows his drawing to the other players. The first player to correctly guess the object marks an "x" in one of his four squares. When one player has an "x" in all four of his squares, the game is over and he wins.

Ages 3 and up

name: Triple Flips 10: Disasters
description:
Triple Flips 10 includes Outlaw and Stagecoach, Shark Attack, and Alien Invaders From Space.


Outlaw and Stagecoach is a 2-player game that simulates a Western chase scene, in which the outlaw tries to chase down and rob the stagecoach. The stagecoach moves one or two spaces (determined by a die roll) along a fixed path toward East City. The outlaw moves one or two spaces forward or backward, and may utilize the shortcuts. Once the outlaw ends a move on the same space as the stagecoach, a gunfight occurs. The gunfight consists of the outlaw winning three out of three rounds of "Who can roll a higher number on the die?" - re-rolling in the event of a tie. If the stagecoach wins the gunfight, it escapes with a free move.



Shark Attack sends 2-4 players diving for treasure in slightly shark-infested waters. On your turn, you roll a die, then move in orthogonal steps, generally toward the treasure. You may not swim through other pawns. If you start your turn in the shark attack zone, which is 4/7 of the playfield, then you will also roll and move the shark. The shark may swim through other pawns, but if it ends its movement on a player's pawn, that pawn goes back to the boat and starts over. The goal is not only to get past the shark to reach the treasure, but also return through the shark's waters to the boat thereafter.



Alien Invaders From Space is a 1-player roll-and-move with a die-driven squad of aliens hunting you along the path. A die roll indicates which 3-4 of six rooms are occupied by aliens. For your attempted escape, each turn, you roll a die. On an even roll, you move that many spaces; odd, the alien in the current room (if any) moves that many spaces, eventually getting into your path and threatening you. One exception: If you roll a 1, the aliens all get reset, and you roll again to determine their new three or four starting rooms. You simply try to reach your "rocket ship to Earth" without a turn ending you and an alien on the same space.
categories: American West, Animals, Dice, Science Fiction

name: Varsity: The Scientific Football Game
description: The game comes with a board shaped like a football field with two tracks that the football and 10-yard stick slides up and down, four spinners, dice, and several charts to look up the results of called plays and their results based on the die throws.

name: Bumper Golf
description:
Bumper Golf is a deluxe version of the carom golf game, you might play at a Parks and Recreation building. The game board depicts an entire 18-hole golf course. Players shoot their 'balls' (wooden disks) from the numbered tee spots and aim for the equivalent numbered 'hole' (cup depression.)

There are two ways to play. In the first version, each player plays each hole one at a time keeping track of his shots. At the end of 18 holes the player with the fewest strokes wins. For a more interactive game, players alternate taking shots, thus allowing chances to block off holes or knock other players balls out of position. In this version the first player to complete the course is the winner.

name: Badetag
description: Each player draws two tiles. The remaining tiles are placed face down on the table. Each player also receives 5 stripes face up depicting a dirty figure with a "clean side" face down. Every a turn a player selects a tile. If he got a tile with the picture of a flannel he has to turn one stripe of his figure from the dirty side to the clean side. Otherwise he looks whether he now has a trio of motives or background colors. If so, he keeps the trio and draws another two tiles. As soon as one figure of any player is perfectly clean the game ends and the one with the most trios wins.

name: Don't Miss the Boat
description:
CONTENTS
yellow island, yellow cone
8 balls on strings
8 boats
4x 3playing pieces, dice

OBJECT OF THE GAME
to be the first player to get all three playing pieces onto the island.

HOW TO PLAY
Each player takes 3 playing pieces of one color and places them in any 3 separate boats. At the start not more than 2 men per boat.
During the game not more than 3 men per boat are allowed.
Each player in turn, throws the dice and moves any one of his men from boat to boat. A player must also select a ball from the central cone to pull in one of the boats.
If the boat pulled ashore contains the player's own play piece then he may place it on the island. If the place on the island is already occupied by an opponent's piece then the play pieces are exchanged.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Humor, Memory, Nautical

name: New York Scene
description:
From the back:

"The excitement of Broadway, a shopping spree along Fifth Avenue, elegant dining among the skyscrapers of Manhattan, and a tour of the city's famous landmarks - all these are a part of the New York Scene.

Have you ever wanted to own the Mets, Tiffany's, the Plaza Hotel or the Daily News? Now is your chance by playing the New York Scene!

- you will buy and sell your favorite local properties;

- become either a union leader, a lawyer, a politician, or a network executive;

- bargain with the other players to receive a "Connection Card" which will permit you to develop your properties and thereby collect increased rent.

The object of the New York Scene is to accumulate wealth and enjoy a unique witty and up-to-date view of the exciting way of life in New York. During the Game you will draw New York Scene Cards which will reward or penalize - for example:

-- The Aussie Strikes Again - You may Buy Any or All of the Newspapers for Twice Their Stated Purchase Price

-- You're Riding the Subway, the Hand in Your Pocket Belongs to Someone Else - Lose Two Turns Due to Shock"
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: MacDonald's Farm Game
description:
Four Scotch brothers, Sandy, Neil, jack and Rob MacDonald, own four adjourning farms. But they have no livestock, no poultry, not even a dog for their farms. They can get what they need at the County fair, but because the supp of each item is limited as e each brother wants to be the FIRST to stock his farm, the competition is keen and exciting. In playing MacDonald's Farm Game, you can take the part of one of the Scotch brothers and attempt by "Selecting Stock at the County Fair" -- "Cornering the Market" -- "Trading" and "Unloading Surpluses" to be the FIRST to stock up your own farm.

Each player tries to fill his farm with the exact animals needed. On each turn, you spin the spinner and must take one group of animals, if possible, from the section the spinner lands on. If you have too many of a specific animal, you may attempt to trade by spinning. If the spinner lands on a trade space, you may attempt to negotiate a single trade with any of your opponents. Otherwise, your turn ends. Once you have all of your needed animals, you get rid of your excess at the county fair. Again, you spin and if you land on a county fair space, you may return one group listed there to the stock. Otherwise your turn ends. However, if you forget to declare that you are going to the fair, you must draw animals as though it were a normal turn.

name: Trout: The Most Realistic Fishing Game Ever
description: The objective is to catch 6 fish. Move around the board doing things like getting a fishing license or going to fly fishing school. Looks like a Monopoly clone.

name: Four Scores
description:
CONTENTS:
a square plastic boardgame
tiles with crosses in 4 colors
round and squares markers in 4 colors

OBJECT:
The object of the game is to form, by skilfully placing the cards, as many crosses or squares as possible, each comprising all 4 colors.

PLAY:
Whenever a player succeeds in forming a four color cross or square, he places one of his counters on the peg in its center:
if it is a cross, a round counter, if it is a square, a square counter.
Each player adds up his score. A cross (round counter) is worth 2 points, a square (square counter)
1 point.
The winner is the player who has scored most points.

name: Alphemo
description:
A Scrabble like game.
Description off the box:

Alphemo is not a crossword puzzle; words are formed horizontally only.
Words are also formed letter by letter.
Each player has his own color board.
Letters can be superposed; the letter on top gives the point.
The use of the dictionary is allowed at any time so young and adults can compete.
A difference of only ten points stands between the winner and the losers which keeps everyone involved in the game from beginning to end.

name: Seoul Police
description: This game is a (unofficial, I guess) Scotland Yard clone which was published in Korea. It's basically a game of Scotland Yard set up in Seoul.

name: Campaign: Race for the White House
description: Bush, like Ford, seems to have eluded the eye of the board game designer. To date, the only U.S.-made election board game we have located which depicts George Bush in any manner is Campaign: Race for the White House. Caricatures of Bush and the three previous elected Presidents adorn the cover.

name: Frog Pond
description: The playing surface vibrates causing the plastic frogs to "hop" up in the air. Players use fishing pole devices to magnetically catch the frogs.

name: Alak
description:
A one-dimensional (played on a line) variation of Go that was first described by A.K. Dewdney in his book The_Planiverse. In 2001, Alan Baljeu modified the game into its present form.

The rules (from Wikipedia):


Black and white take turns placing stones on the line. Unlike Go, this placement is compulsory if a move is available; if no move is possible, the game is over.
No stone may be placed in a location occupied by another stone, or in a location where a stone of your own colour has just been removed. The latter condition keeps the game from entering a neverending loop of stone placement and capture, known in Go as ko.
If placing a stone causes one or two groups of enemy stones to no longer have any adjacent empty spaces--liberties, as in Go--then those stones are removed. As the above rule states, the opponent may not play in those locations on their following turn.
If placing a stone causes one or two groups of your own colour to no longer have any liberties, the stones are not suicided, but instead are safe and not removed from play.


Play continues until a player cannot place a stone on their turn. At this point, the number of stones on the board is counted; the winner is the one with the most stones.

Online Play


Super Duper Games
Richard PBeM server

name: Pictionary: NASCAR Edition
description:
Pictionary®, The Game of Quick Draw®, now with a NASCAR® twist!

Specially designed by renowned NASCAR artist Sam Bass, this game is sure to be fun for everyone at home or in the motor home! There are 2,000 exciting new NASCAR-related words to draw. Many are racing specific, but others relate to everyday life as a NASCAR fan. This game even includes a special Junior category for kids Ages 7 and up so the whole family can play together.

Pick a card. Draw a word such as stock car, racetrack or doughnut. Make your teammates guess the sketch in less than a minute. Be the first team to reach victory lane and win the game!

Comes complete with custom game board, 204 cards including 4 category cards, 4 stock car movers, 4 pencils, 4 pads of paper, one-minute timer and die.

name: Wall Street Spin
description:
Play the stock market with Wall Street Spin™, the fast-paced Award Winning stock market board game from FunSpin®! Experience the ups and downs of the market, without risking your shirt. You’ll enjoy the whimsical stock names, cheer when the spin goes in your favor and be on the edge of your seat wondering what the market will do for you (or to you) next.

Designed for ages 10 to Adult and 2-6 players, Wall Street Spin was made with fun and learning in mind. Basic math skills are honed, while newcomers to the stock market get to feel like Wall Street tycoons when learning and using market lingo. Adults and kids will both develop their own unique investing strategy while gaining an appreciation for how quickly fortunes can be built-up and lost.

Simple to learn and highly fast-paced with handfuls of cash being exchanged on almost every turn, Wall Street Spin™ is fun for every aspiring tycoon, number cruncher, wheeler and dealer and haggler in your family.

Move around the board buying up stocks. The more stocks you buy in a group, the more valuable they all become. Land on someone else's stock, and spin the wheel to find out what dividends you owe them. Buy all the stocks in a group and you'll be rolling in the dough, but don't get too comfortable at the top; market events can break up those holdings and change your fortune in a spin. Bull and Bear News cards offer chance for a Hostile Takeover of another players stock or the loss of one of your own. Day trading can quickly multiply your investment.

Games can last as short or long as you want, and time limit rules keep the game moving fast. Agree on a friendly hour long game or play a marathon session until one of you is in the poor-house.


66Wall Street Spin67 homepage
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Overpass
description:
From the publisher's website:

Two wood dice determine how many actions you take on a turn: trade pieces on parallel lines, overpass a series of pieces on connected vertices, slide along a line, or exit a piece from an outermost corner. First player to exit all 10 pieces wins. The move combinations are very exciting, especially because you can move any piece on the board, not just your own.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Long March
description:
Found in issue #7 of Little Wars magazine, fall 1977 (the game is also described in the rules as “Baselisk Game #2").

Tactical Studies Rules (TSR) published a total of twelve issues of Little Wars magazine from 1976 to 1978 before folding it into The Dragon.

Components

1 11x17” area map of China and Southeast Asia
160 uncut, unmounted counters
4 pages of rules
1 page of game historical background

Counter Manifest

50 red (Communist Chinese) counters: 2 4-strength armies, 2 2-strength armies, 19 1-strength armies, 24 control markers, 1 Mao marker, 2 blanks

49 blue (Nationalist Chinese) counters: 1 4-strength army, 2 2-strength armies, 18 1-strength armies, 1 air force marker, 24 control markers, 1 Chiang marker, 2 blanks

56 yellow (Japanese) counters: 2 2-strength armies, 21 1-strength armies, 3 air force markers, 24 control markers, 2 blanks

4 green (British) counters: 4 1-strength armies

1 turn marker

What the designer says : Long March is a game for three players (there is a two player scenario) about the struggle for control of China during and immediately following World War II. It is 1942, Japan is at the height of her expansion into Southeast Asia and the Pacific, yet China stands defiantly unconquerable. As the Japanese player, you must carefully pit the Chinese factions against each other while using your superior military machine to bring all of China under your control. As the Nationalist Chinese player, you must cooperate with the Communists (however distasteful that may seem) to drive the invading Japanese from the shores of China before re-establishing your authority as the only central government of China. As the Chinese Communist player, you too are faced with an enemy worse than fellow Chinese. You must first drive the Japanese from China before you can put your superior guerrilla tactics to work against the corrupt Kuomintang.

Player’s Value: This is a simple game with undemanding rules (movement two areas per turn, roll dice in simultaneous rounds of combat, each “1” is an elimination and each “6” is a retreat, minor variations on this for leaders, air forces, etc.). It hustles right along at six months per turn, with a variable exit point for the Japanese. The game is unusual in that it is designed primarily for three players, any one of which has a good shot at winning the game (if the Japanese player wins, the two Chinese players can play a Civil War endgame to see who comes in second).

name: UFO Target
description:
Ages 5 and up for 2 players
The aim of the game is to put one's UFOs (little plastic cogwheels) on the galaxy (the board) and to make the opponent's UFOs go round. Each player plays when it's his or her turn. Pirate UFOs in black and white (every player has got 4) enable to stop the opponent from coming on to them. During the whole game, all the UFOs should be able to go round. The winner of the game is the one who can
make all the UFOs go round, yellow, blue and pirate with the last UFO he puts down. Educational game based on strategy and application of gearing movements.

name: Jimmy the Greek Odds Maker Poker-Dice
description:
The game comes with five twelve-sided dice. Each face of each die represents one card of a standard deck of playing card plus eight wild cards.

In turn, a player rolls all the dice. A player has three chances to roll the best possible poker-type hand.

The Oddsmaker Program Selector gives the odds of improving each roll at a glance.

name: Hunchback of Notre Dame Activity Card Game
description:
From the box:
Join lovable Quasimodo as you race to form teams with spirited Esmeralda; noble Phoebus; Djali, the goat; Achilles, the horse; and Clopin, the gypsy storyteller. But watch out! Evil Frollo and his henchmen, Brutish and Oafish, will stop at nothing to send Esmeralda or Phoebus to the dungeon.
Claim sanctuary and avoid Frollo's evil threats. Or, seek assistance from the gargoyles, Hugo, Victor and Laverne, who can come to the aid of Quasimodo and his friends.
The "Festival of Fools" and the "Jester's Challenge" add zany activities to the game, bringing a lively world of topsy turvy outcomes.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Lifestyles of the Rich and Famous: The Game
description:
Inspired by the popular television program, Lifestyles of the Rich and Famous, this exciting game takes you into the extravagant world of fabulous fortune and precious possessions.

The object: to collect the most wealth by guessing the prices of a wide variety of unusual and luxurious items. Be the player with the closest guess and win a valuable treasure. There's 2400 Rich and Famous articles in all, in six richly entertaining categories.

name: Profi-Cross
description:
You have a scrabble-like board from 12*16 and 13 dice with letters and numbers on them. You throw the dice, try to make words with your dice. The numbers on the dice are the points you get for making words. Extra points when you reach the colored squares on the board.

Profi-Cross is a word dice game.

name: Wahlk(r)ampf
description: In this card game, the players are lobbyists who are trying to get the party members to support that party program which gives them the most advantages.

name: Agri-hazard
description:
Players buy and sell farms, stock them with sheep, cattle and tractors, grow crops and sell their produce at market. Each completed turn round the board represents a farming year.

The game does not define a fixed set of ending conditions. Players are called on to set a time limit prior to the start of play, with the added condition that all players must finish on reaching the Market square. Presumably the players proceed to the market square after the time limit has expired, as there are no rules encompassing the failure to be on that square at the end of the allotted time.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Adler Luftverteidigungsspiel
description:
Translated English title: Eagles Air Defense Game

This game was produced in World War II-era Dresden, and the instructions say it was "developed by an officer of the Luftwaffe with the aim of the defence of our airspace. It's more profound reason is to be prepared for an attack on the Fatherland". Created for the Hitler Youth to teach them the strategic thinking needed to defeat an enemy.

This is a WWII era children's game about anti-aircraft batteries. Each player has to try a bombing raid on the enemy city. The 24 wooden airplanes are 6 escort fighters and 6 bombers for each side. Hits are determined via a special die. Each player (red and blue) tries to gain air superiority over the board, attacking the opponents positions and defending their own.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Fighting, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Second Galactic War
description:
Simultaneous plotted movement plus instantaneous travel to any system in the galaxy makes this a very wide-open game. Clean, simple rules for two players only. Solitaire suitability is zilch, and there are only counter sets for two players. Unfortunately poor production quality, especially the counters, detracts from the game.

Counters are generic Warships, Transports, Planetary Defense, Infantry, and Bases. Rules for space battles, ground battles, transport, and production.

To win, you must conquer 13 of the 25 systems in the galaxy, including four of the five major systems. Or, since this can be a long game, set a time limit and minimum systems required to win before you start.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Square Grid

name: Ebbets Field Pro Baseball Game
description: a very simple die-rolling baseball game -

name: Alice in Wonderland
description:
A simple children's game based on Alice in Wonderland. The game also includes a few short Alice stories. Game includes 27 cards; 20 ALICE cards 5 each with RED letters, BLUE letters, YELLOW letters and GREEN letters and 7 MENACE cards. (DUCHESS, MAD HATTER, MARCH HARE, MOCK TURTLE, WALRUS, CARPENTER and KING OF HEARTS.

Object of the game is to turn over cards one at a time and depending on which card is in which position try to spell the name A-L-I-C-E. First one to spell the name wins.

There are cards that allow you to remove all of the face up cards that are not in proper order. Once you find the A you can put it on a place called the ALICE spaces. The ALICE spaces are safe and cards placed there cannot be removed.

name: Krimo
description: A trick-taking game with a detection theme. The deck includes a Guilty and a Detective card and the players who have these want to hold on to them until the other is played, as this scores bonus points. There are fixed unsuited trumps: Crimes, Alibis, and Not Guilty cards, some of which have restrictions on play.

name: Sphinx:  The Game of Ancient Egypt
description:
Both sides, jade and amber, have six sphinxes, and the objective is to reach the other side's kingdom at the opposite ends of the board with one sphinx.
At the start of a round, two dice are rolled and one of 18 pyramids lands on the space. If a sphinx was there, it is removed from the game. If another pyramid was already on the space, then it is removed and the space is free again.
Each side then moves a piece one space orthogonally or captures an opponent's piece one space diagonally. This ends the round, and the player who moved second is now the starting player.

name: Granny's Candies: The Delicious Game of Word Meanings
description:
Combine the excitement of picking colorful "candy" tokens from Granny's candy jars with hundreds of opportunities to expand word meaning (semantic) vocabulary skills.

First, you fill up the "candy jars" with "candy" (soft, foamy, and colorful tokens). Then players choose question cards from one of eight semantic areas (or mix and match cards, as desired). Students answer the questions, roll the die, and pick "candy" from the jars. The player with the most candy at the end of the game wins.

You receive 672 word-meaning cards (84 for each area below):
What belongs in this group?
Which one doesn't belong?
Give a describing word.
How are they alike?
What do these have in common?
What is this used for?
How are they different?
Give an action word.

name: Game of Solomon
description:
The game was originally published in GAMES with the rules for two two-player games (The Basic Game and Solomon Nim) by Gardner and one (Son of Solomon) by Sackson. There were also two solitaire games and some puzzles.

Kadon describes their version like so:

"We're honored to have an exclusive of this game invented by the beloved author of countless books on recreational mathematics. The hand painted, 15" square fringed game cloth (washable) serves for four games for 2 players, plus a variety of jumping and positional puzzles for solitaire. The title game lets players invade the opponent's castle, capture as in checkers. Another game is an unusual version of "Nim". And "Caravan" is a desert-crossing trek, with strings attached. The 18 solid hardwood maple disks are hand-tinted in 3 colors. Directions are on a "scroll"."

Caravan is new to the Kadon edition, as is the three-player game, if different. Son of Solomon is presumably not included in this edition as it requires numbered pieces.

name: The Enterprise Game
description:
An educational game aimed at school & college students. It is based upon manufacturing and trading in competition with other players, managing resources. Can be played by teams and has a number of levels of detail which can be adapted to suit the group. Comes complete with teachers notes.

This game consists of two games, the simpler "trader" version which, with additional rules and pieces, becomes the "manufacturer" version and it is this latter that is described below. Players may buy manufacturing machines (to make product), trucks (to deliver product) and representative cars (to get customers). They will need to pay manufacturing costs and operating costs and then deliver product to customers to earn money. Rep. cars are simply placed at a customer and remain there until product is delivered. Trucks move as dice throws, one die per truck, but all die are thrown together and player may select which die goes with which truck.

The object is to make the greatest profit.
categories: Dice, Economic, Educational, Industry / Manufacturing, Transportation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Simulated Inter-hemispheric Naval Combat (SINC)
description:
From the introduction: "S I N C is a game of strategy, devoid of any element of chance. It is a game in which two players match their strategic acumen by engaging two opposing fleets of symbolic warships. One fleet represents the Eastern Hemisphere and the other the Western Hemisphere."

As the full name suggests, SINC is an obvious product of the Cold War period intended to simulate a fleet battle between the U.S. and U.S.S.R.

The game was published in two editions. One version comes in a standard long box and contains 34 substantive metal ship pieces. A second version comes in an album-style slipcase and serves as a travel edition, with 34 magnetic ship components clearly identifiable via their silhouette, name and classification.

The ship classifications drive the comparative cruising and firing capabilities of the various warships which they emulate.

name: Synapse
description:
Synapse is a real-time card game in which cards are used as tiles to play into rows and columns of a 6x6 grid. Placement of tiles is concurrent and play ends when one player places his last card, much as in the game "Light Speed." The tiles are then scored based upon adjacent symbols which are the same in color, shape or number.

The game is available for free download from the Black and White Games website:

http://www.fairplaygames.com/newworldgames/bnw/synapse/synap...

From Mike Petty and the game's website:

"Synapse is a two-player game where players race to arrange their cards into scoring positions.

Like many real-time games, the play of the cards is fast and furious, then the scoring takes a little while as players figure out who actually won! Since only a complete understanding of scoring will allow a player to make good plays, however, it may be a little hard (while reading these rules) to understand when, where and maybe even why a player would place a cards into play. For now, suffice it to say that cards placed next to each other are potentially worth points if the icons on their adjacent sides match up in either shape, number or color. Sometimes a player will want to aim for matches worth maximum points. Other times he may want to form "connections" worth no points at all, in hopes of stopping his opponent from scoring. All the while a player has to keep a close eye on what his opponent is up to!

As far as the design goes, Synapse is my attempt at a real-time game that has no luck and no room for cheating during the fast play. I think it succeeds well on these two accounts."

name: Wishbone Card Game
description: This game mixes the classic style of Crazy 8s with characters from novels and plays portrayed in the Wishone PBS series.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Omaha Beach
description:
Omaha Beach was a PanzerBlitz variant published in The Spartan magazine number 4. The variant attempted to cover most of the Normandy landings, not just Omaha Beach.

The variant added units, rules, maps, and scenarios for recreating the invasion, including numerous unmounted counters and several geomorphic mapsheets. Scenarios included Gold Beach, Juno Beach, Sword Beach, Omaha Beach, Utah Beach, 6th Air Landings, 82nd & 101st Air Landings, Combined British Sector, and Combined Utah Sector.

name: Westfront
description:
Westfront was a PanzerBlitz variant published in The Spartan magazine number 1. The variant expanded the PanzerBlitz system to the Western Front, prior to the release of Panzer Leader. The variant added new geomorphic maps, unmounted unit counters, and rules.

A reprint of the variant was released in 1973. The reprint included four pages of rules additions, 12 scenarios, 4 geomorphic maps, and one counter sheet of U.S. units.

name: Patriot Challenge
description:
In Patriot Challenge players move their token around the game board, which features illustrations of U.S. postage stamps, and try to be the first to pass the year 2000. In order to move their tokens players must answer questions on cards that are divided by difficulty into three categories: white cards (basic), blue cards (challenging), and red cards (expert). The questions pertain to aspects of American history and culture. Correct responses earn points which a player uses to move his token.
If a player does not know the answer to a question, he has the option of teaming up with another player, and if the team answers correctly the points are split between the two players.
Some of the cards have bonus questions. If a player successfully answers a bonus question, the other players, as a democratic group, must decide how many points to award.
The player who best combines teamwork, strategy, and knowledge will have the best chance of winning.
The game components are: a game board, 650 cards, rules, an answer key, a magnifying glass, and six tokens.

name: Laurel and Hardy Card Game
description:
This is a children's game of number matching and simple addition. There are four suits (Green, Blue and Red each have cards numbered 2-10, and Yellow has cards numbered 2-5) but there are no rules for different suits, oddly enough. There are also four "Lucky One" cards that don't belong to any suit.

On your turn you either match cards on the table (you start the game with three cards on the table) and so put them into your pile, or play a card that is the sum of two cards on the table and so put those cards into your pile, or add a card to the table. At the end of the game, the player with the most cards in his/her pile gets 3 points; each Lucky One you collected gets you one point, and the Lucky Two and Lucky Ten are worth two points each (there are only one of each of these).

The cards are illustrated with crudely drawn cartoon images of Laurel & Hardy, alas - photos would have made the game worthwhile for adults, at least as a collector's item.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: KilrSat 7
description:
KilrSat 7 is subtitled the Anti-War War Game. Players set up bases and anti-missile defenses on an island and submarines and destroyers at sea. Players then take turns launching nuclear missile at each other, with anti-missile action on the off-phase. The near-future Sci-Fi setting states that these islands were set up as places to fight so that no one would fight elsewhere on the planet.

Multiplayer variants are included: team play and a third-player UN team. Pieces consist of targets, various missile types, various anti-missile weapons (including laser cannons), subs, destroyers, army, air, and naval bases, dice and a map with network lines and nodes.
categories: Dice, Fighting, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: House of Doors
description:
House of Doors was a finalist in the 2004 About.com Board/Card Games / Abstract Games Magazine Shared Pieces Game Design Competition.

It's played on a 4x4 grid, with each player controlling one token and sharing control of 8 doors. The goal is to use the doors (and possibly your token) to block in your opponent's token.

name: Poserbility
description:
The game of crazy poses for 4 or more players in 2 teams.

Race against the clock to get your 'model' into position where your team can guess what he is. you either shout or physically move him - sometimes wearing a blindfold.

It gets frantic as the timer ticks away...

Contents:

100 single poses
50 multi poses
1 posometer
set of rules
Playing pieces
Dice
Scorepad
Pencil.

name: Breeders: Initial Contact
description:
Breeders: Initial Contact is a game of tactical SciFi combat taking place sometime in the next century, where interstellar travel is a lengthy but common process, and a militant alien race, known as the Bre'kada, have been discovered. Each player assumes the role of either a Terran force or a force of alien Breeders. Players have an individual goal to accomplish defined by the scenario being played. Breeders: Initial Contact is a complete introductory micro-game contained in the pages of Fractal Spectrum #14. It is the prelude to Breeders: The Assault

Contents:

10 page rulebook
6.5" x 10" playing map
100 unit counters


Illustrated by DJAR

name: Rymdraketen
description:
This is a Swedish Monopoly-clone from the 1950's, judging by the look of it.
Players take turns making "launch attempts" using the spinner, which determines their destination in the Sol planetary system. Unless a player has already bought the destination, it may then be purchased using "space fuel".
When all planets/moons in a set are owned by a player, he or she may construct space stations which increases the amount of space fuel paid by other players landing at said station. There are also the equivalent of "chance" cards, which are written in sort of a pulpy SF style as befits the theme.
